Note: Would give most Sauternes a run for their money. The salty, nutty, tobaccolike aromas and rich, ripe flavors are full and satisfying. Sweet, unctuous and long on the finish. Mature now and ready to drink. 2,262 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Margaret River
Note: Crisp and focused, with sharply defined peach, pear and spice aromas and flavors, hinting at toast and butter on the long finish. The structure is tight, suggesting this will improve with cellaring. Drink now through 1995. 21,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Barrel Selected Private Reserve
Note: Crisp at the center, but nicely rounded and polished around the edges, featuring toasty hazelnut, pear and honey aromas and flavors that extend into a long finish. Reminiscent of a good Puligny-Montrachet. Has style and grace. 700 cases made.

Name: Barbera d'Alba Conca Tre Pile
Note: Tart, flavorful and spicy, with a generous, focused beam of juicy berry and currant flavors and a touch of oak on the finish, ending up smooth and balanced. Drinkable now.

Name: Cabernet Breganze Fratta
Note: Rich, balanced and deep, with great harmony. At this stage you taste a lot of new oak, but the generous vanilla, violet and toast notes complement the rich plum and black currant flavors. Best after 1995.

Name: Chablis Les Preuses
Note: Bold and intense, with rich, lively pear, peach, honey and citrus flavors that are fresh and lively. Complex and concentrated, showing a burst of fruit on the finish. Drinkable now. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Keyneton Hill of Grace
Note: One of Australia's finest red wines. Extremely ripe in flavor and plush in texture, with a great combination of fruit, spice, chocolate and tobacco. Complex, intense and satisfying, showing enough oak. Resembles a Côte-Rôtie. Tempting to drink now, but s 2,000 cases made.

Name: Barbaresco Selezione del Trentennio '30'
Note: Intense and concentrated, with sharply focused cherry, raspberry, anise and rose petal flavors that are deep and complex. The tannins and acidity taste raw. Very tightly wound. Cellar until 1999 for best results. 2,000 cases made.

Name: Hermitage Monier de la Sizeranne
Note: Ripe, rich and complex, with deep currant, earth, oak and spice flavors that are finely woven together. The tannins are firm and rugged and clamp down on the finish. Best after 1997. 8,500 cases made.

Name: Brut Champagne Brut Premier
Note: Creamy, elegant and stylish, offering complex layers of pear, spice, honey and vanilla flavors that are smooth and polished, finishing with a long, complex aftertaste. Subtle and refined; a treat to drink.

Name: Zinfandel El Dorado Walker Vineyard
Note: Round and ripe, with a fine line of sweet currant and plum aromas and flavors running through it from the first sip to the long finish. Beautifully crafted fruit flavors are immediately appealing, and the texture is plush and smooth. A real winner. Taste 750 cases made.

Name: Gewürztraminer California
Note: An intensely flavorful, full-bodied, Alsatian-style wine, with layers of heady fruit, spice and mineral flavors that linger on the long finish. Dry in sugar, but rich in fruit and body, this is smooth in texture and very distinctive. 1,600 cases made.

Name: Fumé Blanc Barrell-Fermented Reserve Alexander Valley
Note: Stands out from the pack. A rich-tasting, rich-textured Fumé Blanc, with butter and vanilla overtones to the citrus and pear flavors. Has depth, elegance and a long finish. 24,000 cases made.

Name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape La Bernardine
Note: Shows uncommon balance, proportion and finesse, offering lovely currant, cherry, chocolate and smoky oak flavors that are complex and luscious. The finish is long and complex, with soft but firm tannins. Tasty now, but can age through 1998. 8,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County
Note: Complex and intriguing for its band of flavors, offering lots of smoky raspberry, cherry, earth and tar notes that give dimension to the cola and oak shadings. Intense and lively, yet smooth in texture, finishing with a rich core of fruit flavor and a decadent edge that adds to the wine's interest. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Barolo Sperss
Note: Complex and fascinating, offering all sorts of floral, earthy overtones to the solid core of black cherry, blackberry and anise flavors. An intense wine that shows many facets, including a welcome whiff of vanilla and toast on the aftertaste. 2,700 cases made.

Name: Barolo Cannubi Ca' dei Gancia
Note: This stunning wine is rippling with layers and layers of dense, exuberant black cherry, violet, blackberry, tar and vanilla aromas and flavors. Muscular at the core, but sweet and supple through the extraordinary finish. A great wine in any context. The tannins are so refined you could drink it now, but has the stuff to age past 2000. 825 cases made.

Name: Johannisberg Riesling Alexander Valley Late Harvest Special Select
Note: Deep, dark, ripe and rich, a gorgeous, unctuous wine that offers cascades of honey, floral, caramel, apricot, pear and ginger aromas and flavors, finishing almost delicate for such a rich wine. Fabulous to drink now, perhaps best in 1996-1998. 475 cases made.

Name: Barolo Bric dël Fiasc
Note: A luscious mouthful of wild berries, black cherry, toast and rose petal. Concentrated and exotic, a powerful wine with totally disarming aromas and flavors and remarkably supple texture. Layers and layers of personality make this a stellar candidate for cellaring. Best after 1997. 800 cases made.

Name: Sangioveto
Note: The greatest Sangioveto ever made. Massive wine with layers of tobacco, chocolate and violet character; full bodied and complete with perfect tannin structure and excellent acid. Best after 1997. 500 cases made.

Name: Barbaresco Marcarini
Note: Sensational expression of Nebbiolo, exploding with black cherry, wild berry, lemon verbena and anise flavors without an overlay of oak, an exotic wine that holds itself in check just enough to qualify as elegant. Fresh and vibrant, tempting to drink now, but probably best from 1996. 600 cases made.

Name: Barolo La Corda della Briccolina
Note: Totally disarming, a gorgeous array of rose petal and anise-scented raspberry, vanilla and strawberry aromas and flavors extending through a supple finish that wraps its fine tannins smoothly around the warm fruit and spice. Drink now. 725 cases made.

Name: Montrachet
Note: Packed to the brim with coconut, butterscotch, apple and pineapple character. Full-bodied, with amazing acidity and class.  Try now. 600 cases made.

Name: Meursault Désirée
Note: Fantastic, with intense aromas of white truffles, apples and fruit. Full-bodied and concentrated, with great acidity. Drink now. 300 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Monterey
Note: Ripe, intense and concentrated, with rich, spicy pear, peach and pineapple flavors that are smooth and polished. Reveals more depth and finesse with each sip and gains complexity and grace on the long, smoky finish. Simply delicious to drink now. 6,000 cases made.

Name: Brut Champagne La Grande Dame
Note: Like a wild horse. Tons of potential. It's extremely exuberant and lively. Full bodied with masses of lemon, toast and apple character. It shows great acidity and long finish.

Name: Muscat Canelli Monterey Vin de Glacière
Note: Brilliantly spicy, fruity and generous, showing its flavors with digital clarity—nutmeg, cinnamon, pear, apple and honey—finishing sweet, rich and amazingly balanced. Drinkable now. 3,200 cases made.

Name: Syrah McLaren Vale Show Reserve
Note: Deep, dense, dark and powerful, with layers and layers of plum, berry, chocolate, coffee and cedar flavors finishing round and generous. Drink now. 1,900 cases made.

Name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Nackenheim Rothenberg
Note: This electrifying wine jolts you with its intense flavors. Starts with citrus, apricot and lemon notes and ends with honey, floral and almond flavors on the clean, focused, complex finish. Drinkable now, but should be better after 1997. 350 cases made.

Name: Brut Champagne R de Ruinart
Note: Rich and earthy with complex pear, toast and honeyed flavors that taste mature, picking up carmel and earth flavors that offer uncommon depth and richness. Delicious now. 2,000 cases made.

Name: Meursault Les Tessons Clos de Mon Plaisir
Note: A blockbuster, with vanilla, honey, butterscotch and ripe fruit aromas and flavors. Full-bodied and immensely appealing. Best after 1996. 475 cases made.

Name: Barbera d'Asti
Note: Peppery, spicy notes invigorate this smooth-textured, nicely balanced wine, berry at the core, hinting at tobacco and tar on the rich finish. Drinkable now through 1996 and beyond. 11,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Woodburne Cuvée
Note: This Washington wine has all the facets and depth you want in a barrel-fermented, malolactic-style Chardonnay.  Apple and pear flavors are spiced up by toasty, buttery aromas and a spicy, butterscotchy note on the finish.  Rich, beautifully balanced and complex. 7,500 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Sonoma County Scherrer Vineyards
Note: Delicious, pure and ripe, offering cherry, raspberry, plum and spice flavors. Intense, complex, wonderfully balanced and harmonious. Try a bottle now and enjoy for its vitality, and keep a few to see what happens. Best from 1994 through 2000. 531 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
Note: Ripe, lush and spicy, with a rich core of pear, peach and nectarine flavors kept alive by crisp acidity. Has a smooth, creamy texture and a long, full, lingering aftertaste. Drink now. 3,470 cases made.

Name: Meritage Lake County
Note: Comes alive with rich, complex fruit that echoes currant, spice and cherry, with a pretty toasty, buttery character from new oak. Balanced and concentrated, adding a long, full finish that keeps pumping out the flavor. 66 percent Cabernet Sauvignon, 18 percent Cabernet Franc, 15 percent Merlot. 4,672 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Anderson Valley Première Reserve
Note: Bold, ripe, rich and creamy with pretty spice and vanilla flavors, but also a load of pear, apple, citrus and toast notes on a long, full, complex finish. Wonderful sense of harmony and finesse; drinks well now but should hold through 1995. 3,400 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Barrel Select
Note: Youthful, tight and focused, with spicy pear, nutmeg and melon flavors and pretty oak shadings. An impeccably well-balanced wine that allows the ripe fruit to play off the toasty oak and stay together through the finish. Drinkable now, but may benefit from cellaring. 6,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Carneros
Note: Ripe, rich and packed with flavor, with tiers of honey, pear and butterscotch. The texture is smooth and silky, and flavors run on and on, gaining nuances on the finish. Best Rombauer Chardonnay in years. Delicious now through 1995. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Sancerre La Moussière
Note: Ripe, round and spicy, this uniquely balanced wine offers hazelnut, butter and toast nuances to the basic green apple and honeydew melon aromas and flavors that echo on the long finish. A stylish wine that shows all the signs of growing more complex. Drink now through 1995. 20,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley Reserve
Note: A great combination of ripeness and delicacy, with honey, hazelnut, pear and butter flavors. True Chardonnay flavor comes through in this Washington wine, with complexity and length. Beautifully balanced, showing richness without weight. Drink now through 1995. 2,060 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Lytton Springs
Note: Full-blown and fully oaked, displaying a fine, deep color, rich fruit flavors and polished tannins. Lush in texture and sweet with vanilla and spice notes from oak aging, but backed by solid blackberry, currant and black cherry flavors. A concentrated California Zinfandel. Best from 1995 through 2000. 7,430 cases made.

Name: Fronsac
Note: A classy wine that shows great winemaking. Fills your mouth with plum and black cherry flavors and silky tannins. From Michel Rolland. Drinkable now. 3,500 cases made.

Name: Sauvignon Blanc Santa Barbara County
Note: Firm and flavorful, with a nice array of spicy, toasty, slightly herbal pear, honey and grapefruit aromas and flavors that ride gently into a long finish. Stylish, harmonious and graceful, showing a definite touch of oak. Drinkable now. 2,803 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Gold Leaf Cuvée
Note: Crisp and lively, with a rich, focused band of raspberry, cherry and currant flavors flanked by firm, drying tannins. Packs in lots of fresh, lively fruit and is elegantly balanced. The tannins suggest you can cellar this through 1998. 2,050 cases made.

Name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Zeltinger Sonnenuhr
Note: This has what many '92 Mosel Rieslings are lacking: structure and concentration. A bit shy now, but the peach, floral and mineral flavors become fuller and more complex after a while in the glass. Try now.

Name: Meursault Clos de la Baronne Domaine René Manuel
Note: Wonderfully ripe, with toasted oak, vanilla, honey and tropical fruit; a full body and a long, flavorful, fresh finish. Drink now. 800 cases made.

Name: Barolo Brunate
Note: Smooth and polished, with an elegant beam of raspberry, cherry, spice and rose petal lighting up the aromas and flavors, sweet tannins swarming over the finish. Still, the fruit shines through. Best to drink from 1997. 1,800 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Santa Ynez Valley Barrel Fermented
Note: A graceful, harmonious California Chardonnay, with plenty of style. Crisp, focused and flavorful, with spicy, toasty apple, pear and vanilla aromas and flavors that swirl around on the finish. Drinkable now. 16,000 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Knights Valley
Note: Firm and ripe, a medium-weight wine with a fleshy texture and spicy, cedary currant and mineral aromas and flavors, all of it smoothly shaped into a wine that should continue to improve through 1999. 35,000 cases made.

Name: Meritage Alexander Valley
Note: Ripe and distinctive, with a toffee, spice-scented tone to the supple currant and blackberry flavors, finishing rich and elegant. Has the style and concentration to mature through 1998. 70 percent Cabernet Sauvignon, 25 percent Cabernet Franc and 5 percent Merlot. 8,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley 20th Anniversary
Note: Ripe, smooth and complex, offering silky, elegant cola, cherry, currant and vanilla flavors that are rich and intense, with subtle nuances and deep, lingering flavors. Drinks well now, but appears to have the intensity and depth to cellar through 1996. T 640 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Northern Sonoma Estate Bottled
Note: Gallo hits the big time with this outstanding new estate Chardonnay. Elegant, rich and flavorful, with beautiful detail. Has wonderful balance and finesse. Picks up a smoky edge on the finish. Drink now through 1995. 3,520 cases made.

Name: Brut Champagne Carte d'Or
Note: Packs in lots of concentrated flavors, yet maintains its elegance and finesse, with spicy pear, vanilla, toast and light cherry notes, finishing with a smooth, creamy texture. Drink now through 1996. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Brut Anderson Valley L'Ermitage
Note: A wonderful example of just how good California bubbly can be. Creamy and rich, a toasty wine with pear and hazelnut notes that keep singing on the finish. A graceful bubbly with style and plenty of flavor, a lot like a fine Champagne. 4,600 cases made.

Name: Siena Sonoma County
Note: A solid wine with beautifully articulated currant, spice and vanilla aromas and flavors, smooth and generous on the long finish. Has style and grace to age through at least 1998. A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. 375 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Oregon
Note: Smooth, ripe and focused, with supple cherry, plum and cedary oak flavors that run deep and gain complexity on the finish. Drinks well now, but has elegance, balance and fine tannins to age. Drink now through 1997. 2,350 cases made.

Name: Côte-Rôtie La Mouline
Note: No gimmicks here, just intense ripe fruit piled on top of ripe raspberry flavor. Rich and seductive, firm and balanced. A pedigreed Rhône for the cellar. Drink now through 2008. 500 cases made.

Name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Gueberschwihr Goldert Vendange Tardive
Note: Compelling, undeniable Gewürztraminer. Sweet and rich, abundant flavor and a thick, pleasingly unctuous texture with great acidity to keep it fresh on the palate and the finish. Delicious now, but it's still a baby, and will be more interesting if cellared until about 2000. 300 cases made.

Name: Vintage Port
Note: Even better than I remember from prior tastings. The best Croft since 1966 and easily one of the best of the vintage. This shows terrific cassis and black fruit aromas and flavors. Full-bodied, thick and medium-sweet, massive, with loads of tannins. Best after 2002. 9,000 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Pagani Ranch Late Picked
Note: This packs in lots of ripe, jammy flavors, yet maintains its elegance and finesse. Plenty of intense and concentrated black cherry, wild berry and currant, finishing with a long, full, rich finish. Delicious. Drink now through 1998. 2,689 cases made.

Name: Barolo Sorì Ginestra
Note: Rich, ripe and generous, a huge mouthful of seductive, pure fruit, balanced and supple right through the finish. Tannins are smoothly integrated into the berry, black cherry, anise, rose petal and violet flavors that seem to fan out over the palate. Delicious now, but has a great future; target 2000 to 2005.

Name: Oroppas Napa Valley
Note: A solid wine with a rich core of ripe plum, black cherry, currant and new-oak flavors, all of which are bright and well focused. Finishes with a long, full, rich aftertaste. Has the depth and concentration to age well into the next decade. Delicious and merits special attention.  650 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Stags Leap District
Note: A ripe and richly concentrated wine, with focused cherry, berry and currant flavors. On the finish, the tannins really kick in, but it also delivers a lot of fruit. This is a tremendous wine, especially in its price range. Best in 1997 and thereafter. 12,850 cases made.

Name: Barolo Ornato
Note: Deep in color and tremendously rich in aroma and flavor, a supple package that oozes with licorice, plum, berry and black cherry notes. The tannins are beautifully integrated, gently supporting the whole show of fresh flavors. Awfully tempting to drink now, but try to hold off until 1997 to 2001.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Beckstoffer Vineyard Reserve
Note: Young and a bit austere at first, it is well focused, concentrated and serves up complex herb, currant and black cherry flavors that turn supple and elegant on the finish. Shows a measure of finesse and restraint. Ready in 1998. 1,311 cases made.

Name: Vintage Port Quinta de Vargellas
Note: The greatest Vargellas ever produced. Offers an explosion of fruit flavor. Deep dark purple color, with amazing cassis and chocolate aromas. Thick and rich, medium-sweet; full tannins but racy and fine. Try after 2000. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Brut Rosé Champagne
Note: Has the taste of authenticity, with a provocative style that reminds us of an aged red Burgundy. Earthy, leathery aromas, well-seasoned, meaty flavors and echoes of cherry and spice on the long finish. Exciting and unique. 9,000 cases made.

Name: Vintage Port Guimaraens
Note: Wonderful and classy, with superb balance. Very dark and inky, featuring thick berry, tar and violet aromas and flavors. Sweet and silky with a long finish. Best after 2002. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Puligny-Montrachet Sous le Puits
Note: Stylish, exuberant and lively, with tons of toast, butter and pear flavors. Its vibrant lime and lemon character keeps it in check, leading to a crisp finish that gives it length and certainly, a long life in the cellar. Drink now through 1998. 600 cases made.

Name: Il Pareto
Note: A powerhouse, with deep color and super ripe, exotic berry, chocolate and plum aromas and flavors. Full-bodied, with full, soft tannins. Made from Cabernet Sauvignon. Try after 1998. 1,450 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley
Note: A claret style that's fresh and vibrant, with black cherry, plum and buttery toast flavors. Folded neatly together in complex and enticing style. Drinks well now. 1,325 cases made.

Name: Muscat Rutherglen Museum Show Reserve
Note: Amazingly rich, ripe and powerful, gorgeous and unctuous, with layers and layers of spice, tar, coffee and molasses around a core of prune and apricot flavors. A great dessert wine. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Tawny Port Australia Old Cave Fine Old
Note: A rich, round and generous wine that cascades its spice, leather, raisin, plum and toast flavors into a long and elegant finish. Delicious to drink by itself. 2,000 cases made.

Name: Savennières Cuvée Spéciale
Note: Imagine an apple tart glazed with honey and lemon. This wine has the same richness and intensity of flavor, but it's still tight and young. It's concentrated, balanced and long, with a trace of sweetness to balance the firm acidity, and a long beeswax and honey finish. Drink now. 2,600 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Napa Valley
Note: Ripe, rich and supple, with plush cherry, raspberry and plum-laced Zinfandel fruit. Carries its flavors exceptionally well, finishing with a long burst of fruit and smooth, polished tannins. Drinks well now, but short-term cellaring should soften it. Made with grapes from Howell Mountain, West Napa and Mount Veeder. 1,188 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Chateau Reserve
Note: Spicy, ripe, generous and silky, with layers of pear, apple, peach and honey aromas and flavors, deftly balanced between ripe fruit and spicy oak. Pretty notes linger on the long finish. Delicious now, so why wait? 1,200 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra John Riddoch Limited Release
Note: Chewy, focused and impressively deep in flavor. It's plush and pours out blackberry, currant and spicy-herbal flavors. Finishes with an echo of the minty notes that also sneak in on the aromas; this has style and great potential. Tempting now, but best from 1998. 3,900 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Reserve
Note: An outstanding reserve-style wine that comes at you with green apple and spice flavors that soften and swirl into honey and cream notes on the long finish. Drinkable now. 2,816 cases made.

Name: Brunello di Montalcino La Casa
Note: Fabulous, immensely appealing, with vibrant, plush fruit character and a hint of oak. Full-bodied with masses of fruit and tannins, but completely harmonious. Fresh and clean finish. Tasted four times. Approachable now, but better after 1997. 1,250 cases made.

Name: Chevalier-Montrachet
Note: It flies over the palate as delicately as a glider in the sky, leaving in its wake a trail of subtle, seamless flavors. Delicate with plenty of depth, offering focused lime, lemon, pear and toast flavors, with a creamy yet solid finish. 550 cases made.

Name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley Barrel Fermented
Note: Intense and flavorful, with a complex band of buttery pear, hazelnut and spicy flavors that stay with you on a long, full finish. Barrel fermented, this is the best Caymus Sauvignon Blanc in years. Delicious to drink now. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Moulin-à-Vent Aged in Oak
Note: Here's a winner. Bottle age has given this wine rich, exotic mature flavors of tobacco, cedar, plums and prunes; it's big but silky, firm but well-integrated, with a core of tannins that support but never intrude. Though it lacks the grapey freshness characteristic of young Beaujolais, it has only grown over time. Drink now.

Name: Chardonnay Coonawarra
Note: Ripe and distinctive, expanding and accelerating to the finish. It elevates its spicy, smoky pear and apricot flavors onto another plane on the long finish. Terrific. Drink now through 1997.

Name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Kessler
Note: Exciting and rich, stuffed with fruit, yet still has plenty of acidity for balance. Harmonious, complex, and its toasty, nutty flavors of vanilla, peach and apricot bloom on the palate and echo on the long finish. It's delicious now, on its own or with food. 2,000 cases made.

Name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Ürziger Würzgarten
Note: Very impressive for the vintage showing vivacious fruit character throughout. Medium-to full-bodied with sweet, ripe apple and apricot flavors, fine acidity and a long aftertaste. Delicious now.

Name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Le Bouge D'à côté
Note: Rich and earthy, with complex, concentrated pear, pineapple, oak and spice notes that turn elegant, gaining finesse and grace on a long finish, where the honey and pear flavors shine through. Ready now. 1,113 cases made.

Name: Coltassala
Note: A sturdy and tannic Sangiovese, with complex aromas that are intriguing and distinctive, but a tough texture makes it difficult to enjoy now. Packed with cherry, olive, coffee and spice flavors that linger nicely on the finish. Try after 1997. 1,900 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Oregon Reserve
Note: Smooth, ripe, generous and elegant, with beautifully delineated currant, plum and spice flavors that come into sharp focus and glow on the finish. Delicious now and should be fine through 1998. 730 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Carneros
Note: Intense and lively, with an elegant band of spicy pear, apple, vanilla and nutmeg flavors that fold together nicely on the finish. Drink now. 682 cases made.

Name: Rioja Viña Real Gran Reserva
Note: A big wine with plenty of fruit and lively accents of coffee and spice. It's balanced, concentrated and just beginning to show maturity. Drink now through 1998.

Name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Mount Pleasant
Note: Ripe and generous; broad, with some depth and distinction, layering its spicy pear, melon and grapefruit notes nicely. Flavors echo on the long finish. Drinkable now. 18,000 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Kara's Vineyard
Note: A classy, elegant young wine that blends toasty, buttery oak with a supple core of bright, lively cherry and currant flavors. Finishes with a broad, complex aftertaste and fine tannins. Tempting now but sure to improve through 1997 and age into the next century. 1,200 cases made.

Name: DVX Napa Valley
Note: Crisp and clean, with a band of toast, ginger, pear and spice. Gains depth and complexity on the finish, where the flavors fan out. Mumm's new prestige cuvée. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County La Bauge Au-dessus Bien Nacido Vineyard
Note: A dead ringer for a fine red Burgundy. Shows this producer at its best, with the tight, focused, complex cherry, spice, earth and oak flavors that turn smoky and meaty on a long, full finish. Beautifully crafted. Try from now to 2002. 413 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Oregon Laurène
Note: Smooth and generous, glowing with blackberry and currant flavor that echoes on the supple finish. A fruit-centered Pinot Noir that is graceful enough to drink now. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Morgon
Note: An intense, concentrated wine that adds meaty, smoky and peppery notes to the core of black cherry fruit, and achieves its intensity without new oak. It's dramatic, powerful and pays no mind to the idea that Beaujolais is a simple quaffing wine. Drink now through 1996.

Name: Zinfandel Paso Robles Dusi Ranch
Note: Bold, ripe and jammy in an older style of Zin. Ripe, incredibly lush black cherry and plum flavors. Enticing now, but it should hold through 1998. 4,100 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Frei Ranch Vineyard
Note: Bright and lively, with spicy black cherry, raspberry and peppery notes that are deep and complex, finishing with a long, lingering aftertaste. Debut Frei Ranch Zin from Gallo. 3,600 cases made.

Name: Ribera del Duero Mesoñeros de Castilla Crianza
Note: Lush and velvety in texture, with focused flavors of black cherry and plum, accented by toast and chocolate notes from the oak barrels. Has a sense of grace despite the firm tannins, lasts a long time on the finish. Drinkable from now to 2000. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Santa Cruz Mountains Estate Reserve
Note: Bold, ripe and complex; tiers of spicy cherry, anise, tar and cola flavors pick up a nice earthy, mushroomy note. Smooth, supple texture going long into the finish. Drinkable now. 300 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
Note: Elegant and refined, with ripe, smooth and silky flavors that echo cherry, raspberry and spice and finish with toasty, buttery oak. Not quite as concentrated as the wonderful '91, but worthy nonetheless. Perhaps with more bottle time it will show more complexities. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Sancerre
Note: Quintessential Sauvignon Blanc: high-intensity and classic flavors in an elegant, subtle style. The citrus, grapefruit and mineral elements are balanced and clean; the acidity is bracing without sharpness. Great with food. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Roederer Estate Vineyards
Note: Deep color, with ripe, rich, well-focused black cherry, wild berry and raspberry flavors that are complex and concentrated. Distinctive and makes a strong statement about the quality and potential of Pinot Noir from this California appellation. 750 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Calistoga Cuvee
Note: Bold, ripe and supple, with a rich, focused core of currant, black cherry, plum and exotic spice flavors. Builds richness, intensity and depth on a long, complex finish. Beautifully crafted. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

Name: Pouilly-Fumé Coteaux du Petit Boisgibault
Note: Fresh as a sea breeze. Intense and vivid, offering crisp lemon-lime and light herbal notes with a nervy acidity that gives it lift and elegance. It's fresh, clean and maintains good focus through the long finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Sangiovese Napa Valley
Note: Ripe and generous, round and flavorful. Pours out its pure plum, berry and spicy vanilla character in a supple package that just doesn't quit. Beautifully made. Drinkable now. 1,492 cases made.

Name: Brut Anderson Valley
Note: A spicy California sparkler, with ripe pear, hazelnut, honey and butter notes. It serves up a wide range of complex flavors and finishes with an elegant touch. 56,000 cases made.

Name: Nuits-St.-Georges Les Vaucrains
Note: Dense and expansive, with a slightly herbal edge to the chunky raspberry, blackberry and spice aromas and flavors, a powerful red buried under a thick layer of chewy tannins. Tightly wrapped now. Best after 1999.

Name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Preferred Stock
Note: Strikes a nice balance between its ripe, supple pear, vanilla and spice flavors and the light, toasty oak shadings. Turns smooth and creamy on a complex finish, where the flavors echo on. Ready now. 1,250 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Unfiltered
Note: A racy style with lots of ripe, juicy Cabernet fruit. Echoes currant, plum and black cherry notes before picking up some toasty oak on the finish. Drinkable now. 73,460 cases made.

Name: Shiraz South Australia Grange
Note: Amazingly ripe, rich and opulent, with layers of earthy currant, black cherry and anise flavors that are smooth and supple. The silky texture leads into a long, lingering aftertaste that offers echoes of fruit. The tannins are fine but substantial enough to age. Try from 1997 to 2005. 8,000 cases made.

Name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Zaca Vineyards
Note: An outstanding Syrah from this California winery. Rich and fruity, with gobs of ripe cherry, wild berry, currant and raspberry flavors. It picks up anise, cedar and spice notes, then turns smooth and complex on the finish. The tannins are fine and the flavors keep pouring through. Achieves its rich character without the heavy feel. 3,200 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Napa Valley Hayne Vineyard
Note: A truly exciting, beautifully proportioned, rich and vibrant red. Has a delicious core of ripe black cherry, raspberry, anise and plum, finishing with depth and smooth, polished tannins. Drink now through 1999. 200 cases made.

Name: Brunello di Montalcino Montosoli
Note: One of the greatest Brunellos ever made. Very muscular with loads of polished tannins and fruit. Full-bodied and powerful, boasting gravel, mineral and berry character. Needs time. Best after 2000. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Eisele Vineyard
Note: A classic California Cabernet that is well oaked, with distinct vanilla bean and toasty oak accents, but it also shows compelling cherry and berry flavors that develop complex nuances. The fruit shows a remarkable measure of finesse and harmony on the finish. 810 cases made.

Name: Clos Vougeot
Note: A giant of a wine. The greatest Clos Vougeot we have ever tasted. Mint, spice, dried herb and red berry flavors, full body, loads of tannins and a long, silky finish. An amazing wine, even for such a great vintage. Try in 2000 or later. 225 cases made.

Name: White Riesling Russian River Valley Late Harvest Special Select Oak Meadow Vineyard
Note: Gloriously sweet, rich, supple and complex. A dessert wine from California that unfolds a many-layered swirl of honey, caramel, apricot, pear and exotic tropical fruit and spices, all balanced gorgeously on a fine thread of acidity. Wonderful now, but should be fine through 1998, or even 2000. 300 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Rutherford Reserve
Note: Serves up a broad range of complex flavors—tiers of currant, plum, black cherry and spice—then finishes with prune and anise nuances that add some exciting dimensions. Finishes long and rich, with smooth, polished tannins. Better in 1998 or 1999. 500 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Oakville Ranch
Note: Has a wonderful sense of harmony and finesse, with tiers of currant, plum, cherry and tobacco flavors enhanced by hints of toast and vanilla from oak. Finishes with firm, fine tannins. Better still in 1998. 700 cases made.

Name: Volnay-Santenots
Note: Like great sex: exciting at first and relaxing in the end. Full-bodied and very voluptuous, boasting loads of berry, smoky, chocolate character. Full, velvety tannins and a long finish. Better after 2000. 97 cases made.

Name: White Riesling Columbia Valley Late Harvest Chateau Reserve
Note: A ripe, sweet, generous and elegant dessert wine from Washington. The silky mouth-feel and gorgeous honey, apricot and spice flavors blend beautifully, joined by a touch of almond on the lovely finish. Wonderful now, and it should last through 1999 and beyond.  1,000 cases made.

Name: Muscat Canelli California Vin de Glacière
Note: Sweet, rich and profound, a Muscat of astounding depth and complexity. The rich apricot, golden raisin and honey flavors persist on the long finish. A wonderful dessert wine. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Corley Estate Reserve
Note: Bold, rich and concentrated, with attractive pear, honey, spice and apple flavors that turn smooth and creamy as the toasty oak nuances chime in. 492 cases made.

Name: Volnay En Champans
Note: Full-blown currant juice; a reduction of fruit. Wonderfully concentrated layers of raspberry character. Full-bodied with velvety tannins, sweet fruit and very long finish. Try in 2000.

Name: Cabernet-Shiraz South Australia Bin 389
Note: Rich, smooth and plush, with complex currant, black cherry, anise and spice flavors that are bold and intense. Finishes with firm tannins, but the fruit still manages to gush through on the finish. 25,000 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Sonoma County San Lorenzo Reserve
Note: Dark, rich and complex, with splendidly ripe plum, black cherry and raspberry flavors that expand to reveal greater depth and concentration. Has a satisfying, full aftertaste. 622 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Morisoli Vineyard Reserve
Note: Remarkably complex and concentrated, with an appealing core of currant, black cherry, vanilla and spice. Finishes with smooth, polished tannins and a wonderful sense of harmony. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Nuits-St.-Georges Aux Murgers
Note: Lots of wood in this brooding, dark-colored Burgundy. Plenty of plum, chestnut and currant flavors, full body, a fresh core and solid tannins. Try in 1999.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District Hillside Select
Note: Sleek and elegant, with appealing black cherry, raspberry, spice and toast shadings. Offers a supple texture, with bright, ripe flavors and good length. Tempting now for its elegance and finesse, but it has the stuffing to age through another decade. 2,000 cases made.

Name: Napa Valley Napanook Vineyard
Note: Marked by an earthy, cedary edge, it manages to showcase a supple, harmonious core of currant, tobacco, mineral and anise flavors. Finishes with thick but polished tannins. Drink now. 6,500 cases made.

Name: Merlot Howell Mountain Bancroft Ranch
Note: Smooth and harmonious, with a supple core of black cherry, currant, earth and toasty oak that folds together nicely on the finish, the flavors becoming more complex and elegant as it progresses. This vintage adds one more to this California vineyard's fine track record for world-class Merlot.  9,000 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley The Montelena Estate
Note: Uncommonly dark and intense, even for this vintage, with a rich core of leathery currant, spice, cedar and anise flavors that are young and rambunctious. This is a massive wine that needs to age through 1999. 12,000 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Australia Bin 707
Note: Ripe and generous, elegantly balanced and velvety. The focused currant and plum flavors are shaded by a touch of smoke and spice, the fruit persisting beautifully on the finish. Best in 1997. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Masseto
Note: Better than the 1990 or '91 Masseto. Deep and profound Merlot exhibiting intense berry, mint and cassis aromas and flavors. Full-bodied but very elegant and refined; wonderful silky tannins and succulent finish. Drink now.

Name: Ribera del Duero Reserva
Note: An exciting new venture from the venerable Spanish estate of Bodegas Vega Sicilia. It's a rich, concentrated blockbuster that coats your mouth and lingers on your taste buds. Plenty of roasted and coffee nuances, almost jammy berry and black cherry and powerful yet silky tannins—this has it all. It promises great drinking in 1997 and beyond.  4,500 cases made.

Name: Volnay Frémiets
Note: Beautiful, vivid and ripe, sporting a gorgeous core of plum and red berry flavors and silky texture. Tannins creep up on the finish, so should need until 2000 to show it all.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza Catena Agrelo Vineyard
Note: This classy wine takes Argentine Cab to another level. From the deep color to the complex aromas of black cherry, cassis, tobacco and tar through the rich, full-bodied flavors and long finish, this shows concentration, focus and depth. Drink now. 2,700 cases made.

Name: Puligny-Montrachet Clavoillon
Note: A flamboyant, ripe and seductive style of Chardonnay with plenty of fruit flavor accented by intriguing notes of butter, vanilla, nutmeg and toast. Firm with acidity, full-bodied and long on the finish. Appealing now but better if cellared until 1997. 300 cases made.

Name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Gueberschwihr Goldert
Note: Bold and opulent but dry, combining smoky aromas, ripe pear and honey flavors and a long-lasting nutty, mineral character on the finish. Very full-bodied and assertive, yet well balanced by acidity. Drinkable now through 2000. 300 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Keyneton Cyril Henschke
Note: A smooth and harmonious Cab that shows off a pretty core of black cherry, currant, cedar and spice. Mild, elegant tannins and a lingering aftertaste round it off. Drinkable now, but age-worthy, too. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Santa Cruz Mountains
Note: Ripe and complex aromas and flavors of spice, pear and honey that persist and build through the finish. A toasty, buttery character accents it nicely. Another beauty from Ridge. 3,300 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay New Zealand
Note: Smooth, round and spicy, a mouthful of generous apple, tropical fruit, vanilla and citrus flavors singing harmoniously on the finish - this tells a story in the glass. Best from 1996 through 1997. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
Note: Massively flavorful but not heavy, expanding on its tar, prune, black cherry, coffee and cola flavors, then ringing out echoes of berries and spice on the long finish. A distinctive, complex and powerful Australian red. Tempting now, but best from 1999 on. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Chalk Hill
Note: A bold, ripe and spicy California Chardonnay, with an intriguing earthy edge to the rich, creamy fig and apple flavors. There are notes of vanilla and toast, followed by a complex aftertaste. Drinkable now, but should develop through 1997. 15,938 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley
Note: Bold, ripe, rich and complex. It's still tightly wound, but the layers of cherry, plum and spice flavors open up nicely and linger on the finish. Drinkable now. 625 cases made.

Name: Echézeaux Vieille Vigne
Note: Amazing intensity of vivid flavors. Ripe plum, black cherry, minty taste. Of medium body, it shows finesse despite the massive, supple tannins. Long and flavorful finish. Try after 2000.

Name: Chardonnay Hunter Valley Roxburgh
Note: Deep, rich, complex and mouth-filling. This oozes butter, spice, toast and vanilla flavors around a core of pear and apricot that remains elegant. Delicious now. 1,700 cases made.

Name: Merlot Columbia Valley
Note: Rich, plush and elegant, a high-fidelity voice that sings out its plum, black cherry, vanilla and spice flavors. A Washington Merlot that echoes ripe fruit and oak on the long finish. Drinkable now. 1,800 cases made.

Name: Shiraz South Australia
Note: A ripe, supple and silky Shiraz that is generous with its berry, spice and tar flavors, which also linger enticingly on the finish. Drinkable now. 60,000 cases made.

Name: Merlot Sonoma Valley
Note: Perennially one of California's tip-top Merlots. Dark in color, with lots of rich currant, herb, tobacco and buttery oak, but it retains a sense of elegance, even for such substantial weight and flavor. 6,700 cases made.

Name: Geyserville Sonoma County
Note: This is well oaked, with an interesting band of flavors. A hint of dill accompanies the ripe plum and cherry notes and it's smooth and supple on the finish. This Zinfandel-based blend gains complexity and depth on the palate as the flavors expand. Drinkable now.  6,300 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Keyneton Mount Edelstone
Note: A full-bodied, concentrated Shiraz that delivers lots of flavor, with ripe cherry, plum and currant, lively spice and cedary oak. Finishes with a complex aftertaste and firm but not overpowering tannins. Drinkable now, but may be better by 1997.  10,000 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Old Vines
Note: Complex and appealing, the minty, spicy notes are followed by pretty cherry and raspberry flavors. Turns smooth and supple, with mild tannins. A big, bold style that manages to hang in balance. 1,680 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Green Valley Don Miguel Vineyard
Note: A rich, smooth and polished white from this Spanish-owned venture. This has a creamy texture and ripe, broad pear, apple and spice notes that build in intensity. The finish is elegant and refined. 6,745 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Cold Creek Vineyard
Note: Subtle, harmonious and beautifully balanced, blending together pear, spice, vanilla, honey and toast flavors right through to the smooth finish. An intriguing Washington white that's drinkable already, but should improve through 1997. 3,600 cases made.

Name: Fumé Blanc Reserve Sonoma County
Note: Ripe, rich, round and spicy featuring new oak flavors backed by a mouthful of nectarine, pear and orange notes that expand on the finish. Superbly crafted in its supple, oak-centered style. 4,500 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Paarl
Note: Incredibly complex. Like a premier cru white Burgundy. Wonderful toasted oak, mineral, earthy and fruit components combined with full body and great acidity make this wine a superb package. Drink now through 1997. 2,000 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Napa Valley Chiles Mill Vineyard Unfiltered
Note: Intense yet elegant, focused on the spicy cherry, wild berry and light jammy notes. Has firm tannins to frame the flavors. Drinkable now through 1998. 1,350 cases made.

Name: Brut Champagne L.P.
Note: A vibrant Brut that pairs high-toned cream, vanilla and butter aromas with zesty fruit flavors and lively acidity. It's focused, harmonious and lush, staying sprightly on the lingering finish. 400,000 cases made.

Name: Rosso di Montalcino
Note: Big and opulent, offering stunning quality for a Rosso—it's more like a Brunello—and boasting masses of plum, black cherry, cedar and dark chocolate flavors. Lush and generous finish. Drinkable now.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Stellenbosch
Note: Classy and refined mint, coffee, cedar and dried plum character. Full-bodied and elegant, adding fine tannins and a silky finish. Superbly made. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

Name: Solaia
Note: What a beautiful wine! A classy Tuscan vino da tavola with a crisp character, but there are plenty of lovely, earthy cassis and sweet, ripe plum flavors. Delicious from start to finish. Watch for the tannins; better in 1998. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Keyneton Estate Eden-Barossa Valleys
Note: Smooth and spicy, with a nice undercurrent of ripe plum and anise flavors, plus a touch of prune. A harmonious and amazingly elegant Australian red that's appealing now. Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Carneros Red Shoulder Ranch
Note: Big, ripe, intense and juicy, loaded with rich, complex flavors. The echoes of ripe pear, anise, fig and spice are cast nicely in a full-bodied style. Yet for all its size and depth, it maintains a sense of elegance and finesse right through the long finish. 3,500 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Padthaway
Note: Tightly wound, a brilliantly flavorful white that unfolds slowly, displaying Burgundian hazelnut, honey and pear notes which linger on the finish. Drink now through 1997. 21,400 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Laguna Ranch Vineyard
Note: The seductive, complex smoky oak and exotic fruit flavors turn more elegant and refined on the palate as the tiers of earthy pear, grapefruit and spice show through. Finishes with a delicate touch. The first Gallo Chardonnay from Laguna Ranch Vineyard. 6,195 cases made.

Name: Crozes-Hermitage
Note: Pure, classic Syrah aromas of raspberry, licorice and game carry through on the rich palate, beautifully defined and balanced. Delicious now for its varietal character, it should improve through 2003. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay California
Note: Bold, ripe and exotic, boasting complex fig, apricot, honey, pear and vanilla notes, an altogether opulent and mouthfilling bottle of Chardonnay. Packs in lots of flavor, yet manages to maintain its finesse. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Tawny Port Colheita
Note: Absolutely fabulous. One of the best tawnies we've had in a long time. An array of floral, dried fruit and nut character on the nose and palate. Medium in body and extremely smooth. Great balance. Mega-long finish. 2,224 cases made.

Name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Basket Pressed
Note: A generous mouthful of brilliant berry, black pepper, sweet spice, coffee and chocolate flavors that swirl through the velvety finish. Delicious now; best in 1997. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Carneros Reserve
Note: Bold, ripe, smooth and creamy, a real mouthful of Chardonnay. Its tiers of ripe pear, fig and honey flavors are framed by smoky, toasty oak. An altogether complex and beautifully crafted young wine, with a rich butterscotch aftertaste that still has all those delicious flavors chiming in. Kudos to this California winery. Drink now through 1997. 1,130 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Padthaway-McLaren Vale-Clare Valley Eileen Hardy
Note: Dark, almost black in color, densely packed with blackberry, black cherry, pepper and licorice flavors that just don't quit, ending in a smoky note. Has great depth and a long, fat finish. Tight enough to want cellaring. Best from 2000 through 2005. 2,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Oregon Claudia's Choice
Note: A profound, graceful Pinot Noir that presents a gamy character on a first whiff, then shows an amazing depth of fruit, expanding into its spicy plum, black cherry and anise flavors that swirl through the long finish. Needs until 1998 or even 2000 to show it all. 300 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Estate
Note: A bold, complex style that packs in lots of ripe pear, fig, honey and butterscotch flavors and frames them with toasty, smoky oak. It all adds up to a rich, full-bodied mouthful of Chardonnay from this premier California winery. 2,772 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Bonny's Vineyard
Note: Dark, rich and complex, with tiers of polished currant, cherry, herb, dill and tea flavors. A delicious mouthful of Cabernet that packs in lots of flavor yet manages to remain elegant and not overly tannic. Picks up a complex tarry note on the aftertaste.

Name: Sémillon Australia Noble One
Note: Deep gold color, deep aromas and deep flavors, centering around fig, honey, almond and orange zest. Spicy vanilla notes swirl through the elegant finish.  A remarkable wine with a character all its own. 8,000 cases made.

Name: Brunello di Montalcino Vigna del Quercione Riserva
Note: Stunning concentration, with layers of berry, cherry and spice flavors. Full-bodied and very round, with loads of fruit and tannins. Drinkable now, but age it for decades to come. Even better than this producer's '90 norm, this is one of the greatest Brunellos ever made. 560 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley West Block Reserve
Note: Stunning, with an amazing core of ripe, rich, complex and concentrated fruit--tiers of brilliant black cherry, plum, currant and raspberry flavors--and just the right amount of oak shading, giving it a light, toasty vanilla accent that adds dimension. A sensational wine from a winery that is right on target. 243 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Reserve
Note: A bold, smooth, rich and exotic style of Cabernet that packs in lots of extra flavors. The well-focused currant, cherry, mineral and toasty oak flavors are deftly balanced, expanding on the finish where the herb, chocolate and smoke notes enhance the pure fruit.  This should hold well. Best after 1999. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra St. George Vineyard
Note: Ripe, smooth and opulent, a silky-textured Cabernet delivering rich black cherry, tar, spice and mint flavors bubbling around on the gorgeous finish. Approachable now, but youthful enough to want cellaring. Best after 2000. 7,400 cases made.

Name: Crozes-Hermitage Les Jalets
Note: A bright burst of raspberry flavor gives this wine panache, and it has the concentration to back it up, with pretty chocolate and floral notes on the finish. It's monolithic now, but should develop more complexity with age. 27,000 cases made.

Name: Shiraz South Australia Kalimna Bin 28
Note: Smooth and harmonious but tightly wrapped in fine layers of tannin, focusing its blackberry, anise and toasty-peppery flavors in a solid beam that keeps shining through the finish. Best in 2003 to 2005. 35,000 cases made.

Name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
Note: All the pieces fall together in this mature wine. It has mushroomy aromas and dried cherry flavors with plenty of leather to boot. Well balanced and almost chewy, with licorce and tea notes on the finish.  Drink now through 2000. 7,250 cases made.

Name: Vosne-Romanée Les Beaux Monts
Note: A deep, dark Burgundy that has concentrated, intense, ripe fruit notes, luscious oaky accents and a sense that it's still tight and youthful. Great balance between its firm acidity, tight tannins and ample hoard of flavors. Best to wait until 2000. 300 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Grand Reserve
Note: Rich, smooth and creamy, a complex and exotic style that offers lots of bold pear, spice, vanilla and hazelnut notes, picking up a citrus edge on the finish. Impressive flavor and texture. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Chardonnay Hunter Valley Vat 47
Note: A distinctive white from Australia that's crisply focused, packing in its spicy, honeyed, buttery pear and apricot flavors that swirl around beautifully on the long, elegant finish. Drink now through 1998. 8,000 cases made.

Name: White Riesling Anderson Valley Late Harvest Sweet Cluster Selected
Note: Frankly sweet but balanced, with enough racy acidity to showcase the pineapple, honey and apricot flavors with great style. Finish is long and luxuriant. Delicious now, it should keep improving. Best from 2000 through 2004. 369 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Napa Valley Aldo's Vineyard
Note: A Zinfandel in a rich yet elegant style, showing nuances of ripe cherry, raspberry, mint and spice. The toasty oak flavors fold in nicely on the finish. The best yet from this winery. 780 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Barossa Old Block
Note: Rich, spicy and complex, its generous plum and red cherry flavors cradled in a nest of sweet cinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla and meaty, roasted notes. Full-bodied, but gentle enough in texture to be approachable now. Best after 2000. 1,500 cases made.

Name: Chassagne-Montrachet En Remilly
Note: Seductive and charming, boasting tons of ripe pear and apple flavors. Rich honey, cream and dried herb complexity. Voluptuous mouth-feel and amazing silkiness. Needs time; try in 1999. 408 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Yamhill County The Beaux Frères Vineyard
Note: A bright, delicious wine packed with blackberry, black cherry, anise and smoke flavors that are just barely held back by the firm tannins. Needs to soften, and promises to be a real winner. Best after 1997. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Mount Veeder Brandlin Ranch
Note: This wine has a great sense of harmony and finesse. The texture is fleshy and polished, the flavors ripe and very complex tiers of plum, wild berry, cherry and currant that continue to unfold through the finish. 625 cases made.

Name: Volnay Premier Cru
Note: Great fruit combines with intriguing, spicy accents for a full-flavored, complex, interesting Burgundy sporting lingering aftertaste. Elegant but concentrated, firmly tannic but not harsh. Tempting now, but best in 1999. 400 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Overlook
Note: A fabulous California Chardonnay. Well oaked, rich and creamy, with a pretty core of melon, fig, honey and pear flavors that hold on through the finish. This builds on the palate, offering more complexity as it goes. 17,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Carneros Sangiacomo Vineyard
Note: A touch earthy, but has enough ripe pear, citrus, honey and light oak shadings to balance it out. Turns complex on the finish, where the flavors expand and intensify. Serves up a lot of intriguing flavors. 7,106 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Australia Personal Reserve
Note: Packs a lot of beautiful currant and blackberry between the layers of anise and vanilla, wrapped in velvety tannins, harmonious and elegantly proportioned. Tempting now. Best from 2000 through 2002. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Victoria Reserve
Note: Supple, generous and beautifully proportioned, this is a sleek wine with lovely buttery, spicy pear and apple flavors that extend into a long and glorious finish. Has depth and harmony. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Fontanelle
Note: This complex and distinctive Chardonnay from Italy blends toasty, spicy oak aromas with ample fruit and nutty nuances to make a concentrated, focused, nicely balanced whole. Long on the finish and thoroughly enticing. 1,200 cases imported.

Name: Zinfandel Mendocino DuPratt Vineyard
Note: Beautifully crafted, rich and complex, featuring layers of spice, wild berry, cherry and toasty, buttery oak, an altogether supple and harmonious red that packs in flavor while maintaining its elegance. Picks up a peppery note on the finish. Delicious. Drink now through 1997. 1,100 cases made.

Name: Mâcon-Chaintré Vieilles Vignes
Note: A work of art. This blends its crisp acidity nicely into creamy, butterscotch flavors. Fat yet restrained, seductive and full-bodied. Extremely long finish. Delicious now, but even better in 1999. 1,200 cases imported.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Cinq Cépages
Note: An elegant style that delivers a ripe, intense core of currant, coffee, cedar and cherry flavors while maintaining its balance and finesse. Finishes with a long, fruity aftertaste that lingers on and on. Gives you the flavor, richness and depth of the more expensive Cabernets at about half the price. 9,000 cases made.

Name: Chablis Les Fourneaux
Note: Great winemaking: mellow and lush, packed with flavors ranging from citrus to honey, mineral to cream. Comes together beautifully on a silky yet long and refreshing finish. Drinkable now through 2000. 580 cases made.

Name: Gewürztraminer Russian River Valley
Note: Beautifully structured to highlight its pretty floral and grapefruit flavors and luscious undertone of apricot and mineral notes--all of which persist through the off-dry finish. Ready right now. 585 cases made.

Name: Sauvignon Blanc Victoria
Note: Very fresh and spicy, packed with nectarine and vanilla flavors that linger enticingly on the finish. Big and refreshing at the same time. Drink now.

Name: Migration Red Napa Valley
Note: Ripe, well-focused, spicy black cherry, herb and cedar flavors are bright and lively. Well proportioned and moderately tannic, it's approachable now but better in 1997 after softening. Deliciously complex and terrific at this price. 4,900 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Monterey Riverstone
Note: A complex array of elegant pear, spice, honey and hazelnut notes, leading up to a nicely, smoky, toasted oak finish. Combines richness with depth, concentration and finesse. Has the flavor and complexity of wines two to three times its price. 86,000 cases made.

Name: Early Muscat Oregon Semi-Sparkling
Note: Light, sweet and utterly beguiling for its delicately spicy litchi and pear flavors that dance like ballerinas on the finish. Just delicious to drink fresh. 1,200 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Barossa Valley
Note: Ripe and generous, boasting a subtle, spicy edge to the blackberry and currant flavors packed between its layers of tannin. Shows enough promise to make it worth waiting until 2002 to 2005. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Sauvignon Blanc Chalk Hill
Note: Has a welcome subtlety and depth that's missing from many other California Sauvignons. Offers plush pear, tobacco and spice flavors and delicate touches of citrus and parsley on the finish. 12,950 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Monterey County
Note: A bold, ripe and full-bodied white from California that offers lots of rich pear, spice, honey flavors, all presented with a light shading of hazelnut. This has a sense of elegance and grace that goes on through the finish. 22,000 cases made.

Name: Merlot Rapel Valley Cuvée Alexandre
Note: Rich and well-defined. Powerful aromas of plum and toast give way to round, lush tannins and ripe fruit, as chocolate and sweet fruit flavors linger on the finish. Drink now through 1997. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Stellenbosch Private Collection
Note: Gorgeous, deeply flavored red sporting the exuberance of an Aussie Shiraz but the elegance of a Northern Rhône. Has enticing raspberry and violet aromas, rich, peppery tones and lingering finish. Drink now through 1999. 800 cases made.

Name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Fleur de Guebwiller
Note: Unusually elegant for a Gewürz--light-bodied yet intense, with alluring honey, smoke and dried peach aromas and flavors. The perfect balance of sweet and tart makes this a delicious accompaniment to assertive foods. 8,000 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Three Vineyards at Red Mountain
Note: Rich, generous and spicy, filling the mouth with ripe blackberry, currant, tar and tobacco flavors that don't let go even when met by the chewy tannins on the finish. Give until 2000 to 2002 for best drinking. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Viognier Sonoma Valley
Note: Rich and flavorful, showing more depth and range of flavor than most Viogniers, with tiers of peach, pear, honey and spice. An altogether complex and alluring wine. Drink now through 1997. 2,200 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Vineyard
Note: Ripe, spicy, rich and complex young red delivering supple cherry, tar, currant and berry notes. Has a measure of grace and harmony, finishing in fine tannins. Ready now. 900 cases made.

Name: Brut Champagne Carte Blanche
Note: Powerful and fruity, young and lively in texture, this offers lots of pear, strawberry and lemon flavors, with good depth and length. Nicely balanced, too. Should improve through 1998. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
Note: Superb. Well crafted, it's steely dry but exuberant at the same time, with distinctive, bright passion fruit, nectarine and herb flavors that linger bracingly through the zingy finish. Delicious. Drink now. 7,000 cases imported.

Name: Ribera del Duero Teófilo Reyes
Note: Gorgeous. Seriously aromatic, this Spanish red explodes with toast, smoke, coconut and vanilla aromas and flavors, with plenty of ripe fruit notes beneath. The tannins are big but beautifully framed, the wine is concentrated but completely harmonious and should improve for a decade. 9,000 cases made.

Name: Quarts de Chaume
Note: This gorgeous Loire white manages to be both extremely complex and utterly harmonious. Aromas of spice, crème brûlée and mango give way to mouthfilling flavors of honey, minerals, dried apricots and orange peel, very sweet yet kept vivid by crisp, lime-scented acidity. Irresistable now, better--probably much better--in years to come. Drink now through 2020. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Pouilly-Fumé Pur Sang
Note: Unique and delicious, this Loire Sauvignon Blanc is reminiscent of a great white Bordeaux, such as Haut-Brion, thanks to the vanilla and toast flavors of barrel fermentation. With enough acidity for balance and ripe fruit flavors that give it concentration and complexity, it's head and shoulders above the rest. Drink now through 2001. 2,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Starmont
Note: A remarkably complex California white, with tiers of ripe pear, fig, apple and vanilla flavors that linger for a long aftertaste. The texture is smooth and polished finishing with a creamy quality. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Combettes
Note: Fantastic--so ripe, so balanced, so fresh--you just can't get enough. Brilliant success here, even by the high standards of this vintage. Offers loads of sweet-tasting tropical flavors, mingled with toasted coconut, mineral and pear tart notes. Perfect, velvety texture, with a long, clean finish. Drink now through 2010. 268 cases made.

Name: Gevrey-Chambertin En Motrot
Note: Gorgeous purity of clean, scrumptious red- and blackberry flavor shines through in this full-bodied, ripe, seductive, perfumy and racy red Burgundy. Notes of spice, mocha, chocolate, toasted and smoky oak play subtly in the background, giving depth to a complex wine. Near-perfect finish. Tempting now through 2010. 240 cases made.

Name: Vigna l'Apparita
Note: Powerful and exotic, this is the wine of the year from Tuscany. An outstanding Merlot displaying masses of currant and berry, hints of spice, it's full-bodied, with loads of velvety tannins and a long, long finish. Gives Château Pétrus a run for its money. Best after 2000. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Riesling Alsace Clos Ste.-Hune
Note: The essence of French Riesling. Ripe, with honey, floral, apple and stone aromas and flavors, yet powerful and sporting a steel-girder construction, this seems youthful at almost 6 years of age and poised to last forever. The finish goes on and on. Terrific expression of site. 500 cases made.

Name: Chablis Montée de Tonnerre
Note: A good example of the spectacular quality of the '96 vintage in Chablis, this ripe and balanced premier cru delivers gorgeous mineral, lime, honey, tropical fruit, flint, stone and floral notes. Full-bodied, with smoky overtones on the long, succulent finish. Tempting now, but wait until after 2000, when the palate-coating mineral character should be fully developed. Drink now through 2004. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Enseignères
Note: Takes off like a rocket on the palate, with amazing intensity of fruit, acidity and toasted oak. Wonderful mineral flavors, too. Don't touch until 2000 to 2010. 650 cases made.

Name: Les Pavots Knights Valley
Note: Wonderful complexity, depth and concentration, with layers of ripe, juicy plum, currant and black cherry flavors tinged with spice, smoke, toast and buttery oak notes. Delicious aftertaste keeps pumping out flavors. A blend: 68 percent Cabernet Sauvignon, 16 percent Merlot, 16 percent Cabernet Franc. Best from 1999 through 2005. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Barolo Cicala
Note: Barolo of the vintage. Beautifully balanced, from one of the region's finest vineyards, it sings with the purity of the Piedmont soil. Full-bodied but also elegant, with lots of ripe, sweet plum, jamlike currant and licorice flavors, and a superb minerally lead-pencil thread that gives extra dimension. As subtle as a top grand cru Burgundy, like Richebourg or perhaps Romanée St.-Vivant. Drink now through 2005. 567 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay California Grand Reserve
Note: This reserve bottling is ripe, rich and full-bodied, with layers of creamy pear, fig, melon and honeysuckle flavors that slowly unfold, revealing ever-greater depth and concentration right through to the long, delicious aftertaste. The price is reasonable, too. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Mendocino County
Note: A bold and juicy California red, with black cherry, plum, wild berry and raspberry flavors that are ripe, plush and concentrated and finish in a complex aftertaste. A great find at this price and score. 2,000 cases made.

Name: Syrah McLaren Vale Balmoral
Note: Deep and aristocratic, this is an elegant wine with power. Layers and layers of blueberry, blackberry, pepper and cream flavors make it stunning to drink now, but best to give the fine mesh of tannins until 2000 to 2003 to resolve. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Lytton Springs Dry Creek Valley
Note: This single-vineyard bottling is altogether pleasing for its earthy wild berry, plum and anise flavors that fan out on the lingering finish. Not your run-of-the-mill Zin. A blend: 84 percent Zinfandel, 14 percent Petite Sirah, 2 percent Carignane. Drink now. 11,900 cases made.

Name: Sangiovese Sonoma County Coniglio Selezione
Note: Might be the best California Sangiovese going. Harmonious, smooth and supple, with plum, cherry and berry flavors that fold together nicely on the finish, with a nice streak of spicy, toasty oak. Wow, what a wonderful wine. Drinkable now. 2,500 cases made.

Name: Priorat Clos de L'Obac
Note: Showing off pure fruit and the essence of blackberries, this big red is rich, smooth and irresistible. Sure, it has tannin, acidity and alcohol--all in spades--but they are seamlessly integrated and subordinate to that ripe, sweet fruit. Much better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2002. 1,250 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Estate Series
Note: An elegant wine, silky smooth and nicely layered with nutmeg, nectarine and apple flavors that linger enticingly on the beautifully balanced finish. This reasonably priced Washington Chardonnay is delicious now, will be best from 1998. 20,000 cases made.

Name: Merlot Napa Valley Peter Mondavi Family
Note: Delivers plenty of detailed flavors, with pretty currant, plum and cherry notes complemented by lovely toasted oak shadings, all coming together quite nicely on the finish where the texture is polished. An impressive offering, it's this winery's best Merlot yet. 8,700 cases made.

Name: Brut Rosé Anderson Valley
Note: Wonderful complex aromas and flavors, with smooth creamy vanilla notes, lots of delicate black cherry, herb, spice and pear flavors, showing lots of finesse. Long and complex on the finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Cutrer Vineyard
Note: Overflowing with complex fig, pear, melon and butterscotch notes, smooth, ripe, rich and creamy. Reveals yet more depth and richness on the finish, while the flavors linger. Looks like Sonoma-Cutrer is back on track. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Muscat California Vin de Glacière
Note: Seductive, sweet and silky, remarkable for the purity of its spicy pear, apricot and citrus flavors, hinting at litchi on the slick finish. Utterly delicious now. Why wait? 13,500 cases made.

Name: Clancy's Gold Preference Barossa Valley
Note: Rich, spicy and complex, disarmingly seductive with plum, black cherry and exotic spices mingling on the plush finish. Has style and power, but finishes with welcome harmony. Absolutely stunning now, but should keep developing. Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2000 through 2005. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Pinotage Stellenbosch
Note: Here's a rich and remarkable South African red, impressively structured, with plenty of jammy flavors in the midpalate framed by chocolate, leather and smoke notes. Has good acidity as well. Drink now through 1999. 14,500 cases made.

Name: Brut Champagne Millésimé
Note: Complex and mature in style, this is a full-bodied but appealingly austere-tasting Champagne that expands on the finish. The perfect bubbly for those who value reserve and maturity. 23,000 cases made.

Name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Cathérine
Note: Broad and rich, this Alsace Riesling serves up a generous ripe apple, honey and peach character on a racy, powerful structure. It's intense and deep, with a long, apple-flavored finish. Would make a nice complement to food, just needs until 1999. 360 cases made.

Name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Ungsteiner Bettelhaus
Note: A real standout for this vintage, this shows lovely apricot and honey aromas and flavors, with a hint of spice and pie crust. Medium-bodied, medium-sweet, with a long, flavorful finish. Drink now. 233 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Rutherford
Note: A very impressive BV Rutherford bottling, this California red is deeply concentrated, with a rich core of plum, currant and cherry flavors. It shows remarkable finesse and finishes with a long, full aftertaste. Approachable now, will soften nicely in a few years. 85,000 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Clare Valley Domaine
Note: Elegantly built, remarkable for its rich flavor profile, with cascades of lovely cherry, blackberry, raspberry and spice flavors that swirl together smoothly on the taut finish. Delicious. Tempting now. Best after 1999. 5,000 cases imported.

Name: Volnay Clos des Chênes
Note: Great effort in this appellation. A delicious red that fills the mouth with rich black cherry flavors and spicy notes. The richness and concentration last through the lengthy finish. Give it time to integrate. Best after 1999. 275 cases made.

Name: Ribera del Duero Val Sotillo Crianza
Note: This big, bold red from Spain delivers toasty, chocolate-scented oak character, and backs it up with ripe plum and blackberry flavors and marked gamy notes that are concentrated yet quite fresh. Big tannins don't get in the way of a long, spicy finish. Try in 1999. 6,000 cases made.

Name: Bourgogne Côtes d'Auxerre White Domaine du Corps de Garde
Note: Stupendous. Silky in texture, full in body, with polished flavors, long finish, it's a seamless marriage of harmony and power. The spice, oak and fruit flavors show the smooth yet intense complexity of a premier cru Meursault. From one of Burgundy's rising stars in the field of white wine making. Drink now through 2002. 1,500 cases made.

Name: Ribera del Duero Crianza
Note: Very young and quite closed now, this rich Spanish red nonetheless promises a bright future. It shows concentration and balance, and offers an intriguing range of coffee, plum, licorice and tobacco flavors. Oaky notes are dominant, but the wine should improve with time. Best after 1999. 30,000 cases made.

Name: Madiran Château Bouscassé Vieilles Vignes
Note: Gorgeous aromas of roasted coffee and vanilla yield to flavors of cassis, chocolate and tobacco in this massive, backward wine. Its wall of tannin needs to be resolved, but the concentration and sweet fruit on the finish suggest it will come together in time. Try in 2001. 6,500 cases made.

Name: Brut Champagne Antique
Note: Definitely something special. This Champagne has riper fruit, a richer texture and longer finish than most non-vintage bottlings, with a soft, lush mouthfeel and subtle, seductive flavors. Delicious, and reasonably priced at this score. 12,000 cases made.

Name: Riesling Kabinett Rheingau
Note: Plenty of apple, spice and mineral character in this wine. Medium bodied, medium sweet with a long flavorful finish. Tastes more like a Spätlese. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

Name: White Riesling Columbia Valley Late Harvest
Note: Sweet, but balanced by crisp acidity and an explosion of honey-tinged pear, pineapple and floral flavors that persist through the rich finish. Not a "sticky", but a lovely mouthful of Riesling intensity from Washington. Delicious now, may be at its best after 2000. 17,400 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley Carneros
Note: Brimming with juicy plum, strawberry and black cherry flavors, with decidedly earthy and herbal notes, and finishing with firm, tealike tannins. Hold a year to soften; try in 1998. 1,416 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 13
Note: A white chocolate dream. Incredibly concentrated and viscous, lively and complex at the same time. The white chocolate is augmented by lemon peel, vanilla custard and apricot flavors that pulse through the finish. Best after 2000. 133 cases made.

Name: Tokaji Esszencia
Note: One of the world's finest dessert wines. Sensational, ultrasweet Tokay, yet with a lovely citrus underpinning that keeps it from being heavy. Like melted honey, with lime and pineapple, this is one of those marvelous gems that makes you swoon in delight. Tempting now into the 21st century. A collector's item to drink in small portions, by itself, to celebrate life. 165 cases made.

Name: Cornas
Note: Impressively complex, mingling wonderful fruit and spice accents with black pepper, tar, cassis and olive. Dark and brooding, this full-bodied Northern Rhône red is amazingly ripe, sweet-tasting, seductive--just plain delicious. So balanced, it's tempting now, but it will keep for years. Drink now through 2015. 1,330 cases made.

Name: Chablis Beauregard
Note: Fantastic. Deep and complex, subtle and reserved on the nose, with a classy, creamy, silky texture on the palate. Lots of fruit and soil substance stimulate the senses and alert you that this is a serious Chardonnay. Long, subtle, oil-like finish. Tempting now, but will improve. Drink now through 2007. 2,500 cases made.

Name: Late Harvest California
Note: Smooth, silky, supple-textured and sweet, this dessert white overflows with lovely honey-scented pear and peach flavors that linger delicately on the finish. It's delicious now, but will deepen and enrichen further by 2000, so try to hold off until then. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Vine Hill Vineyard
Note: A crisp and lively Chardonnay with a rich, concentrated, tightly wound band of nectarine, pear, citrus and spice. Gains momentum on the palate, and finishes with a wonderful display of fruit and oak complexity. Best from 1999 through 2006. 2,782 cases made.

Name: Tokaji Aszú 5 Puttonyos
Note: Modern-style Tokay. A laser-sharp, pure and clean sweetie, showing great elegance and refinement. Its superb citrusy, crisp structure counterbalances the honey, dried fruit and pineapple character that oozes from start to finish in this full-bodied beauty. Long, spicy and smoky finish makes it tempting now. Drink now through 2010. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Muscat Victoria Museum Release
Note: This Australian "sticky" rivals the quality of many more-prestigious versions, at a fraction of the price. It's a gorgeous mouthful of spice and walnut, sweet and opulent, and is deep with clove, coffee, dried litchi and berry flavors that linger with hints of tangerine peel on the finish. Yummy. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Red Rock Terrace
Note: Lovely orchestration of complex cherry, currant and floral flavors. Classic in its balance and grace. Long on the finish. A great young Red Rock Terrace. Better than when tasted upon release, last year.--Diamond Creek vertical. Best from 2005 through 2012. 900 cases made.

Name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape White
Note: This classy, distinctive white shows wonderful personality and fantastic balance. The smooth mouthfeel has a tight grip that explodes with cedar, spice, tropical, iodine, lemon and mineral notes, all swirling around beautifully. An ager for sure, but tempting now because of its full body. The ripe flavors linger on the bitter almondlike finish. Drink now through 2010. 1,665 cases made.

Name: Vintage Port Quinta da Cavadinha
Note: This young Port sneaks up on you and then--bam! Aromas of grapes, flowers and minerals pave the way for a slowly building palate that finishes with a burst of ripe, exotic fruit. Full-bodied, yet very tight and held back. Better than when previously reviewed as a barrel samples. Best after 2008. 7,000 cases made.

Name: Toscana Solengo
Note: Wild thing. This Italian red is even better than the wonderful debut '95. It offers exotic and complex aromas of blackberry, violet, crushed raspberry, is full-bodied, and though very tannic, the tannins are coated with ripe fruit, and the long and caressing finish delivers even more fruit. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah. Best after 2000. 2,000 cases made.

Name: Chablis Fourchaume
Note: A beauty. Ultrarich but also very elegant, thanks to loads of fresh, citrusy acidity. Balanced and full-bodied, with marvelous pear, honey, mineral, spice and tropical character that you expect from '96. Tempting now. Best after 2000. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Monterey Sleepy Hollow Vineyard
Note: An outstanding California Chardonnay, ripe, rich and creamy, with layers of pear, pineapple, fig and spice and a pretty dose of smoky, toasty oak folding in on the long, luxurious finish. Drink now through 2002. 7,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Edna Valley Coastal Reserve
Note: Beautifully crafted, this California white is rich, complex, concentrated and sharply focused, with layers of ripe pear, fig, peach and honeydew melon. Turns elegant and spicy on a long, lingering finish that echoes fruit and vanilla. Hard to go wrong at this price and score. 15,000 cases made.

Name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne
Note: Just gorgeous. Mouthfilling and wonderfully flavorful but not overpowering, it blends abundant ripe fruit flavors with a subtle mousse and weaves great complexity with an elegant restraint. Like a classic Meursault that sparkles. Drink now through 2003. 2,500 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Reserve
