Note: Smooth, ripe, rich and creamy, with pretty pear, vanilla, tangerine and spicy flavors. Turns silky-smooth on the palate and finishes with a long, rich, complex aftertaste, where hints of anise and butterscotch emerge. Drink now through 2002. 3,500 cases made.

Name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Vorbourg Clos St.-Landelin
Note: Melts in your mouth despite the laserlike acidity. Passion fruit, mineral and floral aromas and flavors give way to mouthwatering acidity and a finish on which the flavors have a featherlike touch. Best from 2000 through 2006. 650 cases made.

Name: Priorat L'Ermita
Note: Such a powerful mouthful of wine that after swallowing, it's almost hard to talk. Explosively aromatic, with jam, tar, licorice and exotic spices, it leads with concentrated fruit, then follows with a sledgehammer of polished tannins that somehow dissolve on the finish, where the fruit reemerges like a rainbow. With a slab of well-aged, chargrilled beef--paradise. Drink now through 2005. 450 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Western Australia Omrah Unoaked
Note: Bright and sharply focused, this jazzy mouthful of citrus, pear and mineral flavors remains juicy and vivid through the delicate finish. Nice now, but it should fill out with cellaring. Best from 2000 through 2005. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Brut Champagne Spécial Cuvée
Note: A satisfying, rich and flavorful brut in a nicely balanced package. It combines bright, fresh fruit flavors with mellow toast and vanilla accents from aging, is smooth in texture, vibrant in balance and long on the finish. Drink now through 2000. 80,000 cases made.

Name: Sauvignon Blanc South Australia
Note: Bright and fresh, appealing for its zingy passion fruit and nectarine flavors that linger beautifully on the disarmingly pure finish. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

Name: Hermitage White Les Nobles Rives
Note: Very lush and ripe, honeyed as can be, showing a supple texture that's to die for. Offers layers of honey, peach, pineapple and dried figs in an almost ethereal package. Full-bodied, with a long, harmonious finish. 1,330 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Napa-Sonoma Counties Reserve
Note: Shows impressive depth and concentration of fruit, brimming with ripe, rich, complex and concentrated fruit flavors, tiers of pear, tropical fruit, fig, melon and citrus shadings, yet manages to remain elegant and refined, too. Delicious. Drink now through 2002. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Carneros Reserve
Note: Smooth and silky. An elegant style, with dense, rich black cherry, plum, leather, earth and beef flavors, picking up a nice touch of toasty oak on the finish, where the tannins kick in. Delicious. Drink now. 2,700 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard Grand Reserve
Note: Smooth, ripe, rich and creamy. A supple, elegant, complex wine, with tiers of toasty, spicy oak, hints of pear, nectarine and peach, and a long, refreshing finish. Drink now through 2002. 20,000 cases made.

Name: Pouilly-Fuissé Château de Beauregard
Note: Exotic, with a lovely balance of oak and fruit. It smells of apple blossoms and tastes of kiwi, lime, pineapple and juicy ripe pear. Crisp yet also very smooth in texture, this medium-bodied Pouilly turns smoky and toasted on the lingering finish. Hunt for it. Drink now through 2000. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Gigondas Les Hauts de Montmirail
Note: Outstanding. Yes, it's oaky, but this exciting Southern Rhône red is also packed with freshly crushed black currant, black cherry, cranberry and blueberry flavors that burst from the glass. Thick, dense and seamless in its smooth texture, it's inky black in color, full in body and layered with violet, spice and mocha notes. The finish is silky-smooth. Drink now through 2007. 1,915 cases made.

Name: Syrah Coteaux du Languedoc Clos Léone
Note: A big, deep wine with a rich meaty aroma and layers of ripe plum, dark cherry and bacony flavors. Has all the stuffing and the trimmings besides, from the thick texture to the sophisticated tannins and almost decadent flavors. An amazingly concentrated wine that's full of character. Best from 2000 through 2005. 1,800 cases made.

Name: Toscana Summus
Note: A blockbuster red wine from Italy--the best Summus I've ever tasted. Shows an intense blackberry character offset by hints of wet earth. It's full in body, with full, mouthpuckering tannins yet a sweet and fruity aftertaste. Needs some age to come together. Best after 2001. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Canoe Ridge Vineyard Artist Series #4
Note: A smooth and silky Washington Cab, its dark plum, blackberry and vanilla flavors tumbling over the palate, finishing with sweet ripeness wrapped in polished, fine-grained tannins. Folds some pretty oak into the mix on the aftertaste. Delicious now. Best from 1999 through 2005. 2,340 cases made.

Name: Barbera d'Asti Ai Suma
Note: Incredible. Purple-black in color, full-bodied, hedonistically rich and so ripe it tastes almost like a late-harvest with residual sugar. Bursts with clean, pure and vibrant cassis flavors accented by deftly dosed toasted oak. Very youthful on the superharmonious, smooth and fruity finish. The quality matches the reputation of this cult wine. Bravo! Drink now through 2000. 2,160 cases made.

Name: Brut Napa Valley Prestige
Note: Toasty aromas and firm texture introduce this wine, which sports nut, fig, pear, honey and lemon flavors. Good on the midpalate, striking a fine balance between delicacy and substance. Drink now through 2002. 150,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Reserve
Note: Bright layers of pear, citrus and quince unfold beautifully on an elegant frame, combining fresh flavors with velvety texture and impressive length. Drink now through 2002. 553 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Napa Valley Edizione Pennino
Note: Elegant and refined, ripe, smooth and polished, with just the right proportion of black cherry, plum and blackberry flavors and spicy, minty nuances. Finishes with a burst of fruit and supple tannins. Drink now through 2002. 2,800 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Padthaway St. Hilary
Note: Here's an aromatic, spicy and beautifully focused white, almost resinous in flavor as it spreads its oak-scented pineapple, pear and honey tones over the finish. Nicely done, good price, too. Drink now through 2000. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Toscana Farnito
Note: Fabulous aromas of blackberry, black currant and mint. Full-bodied, full of tannins, yet polished and reserved. Slightly closed on the finish but should give more fruit with time. A top-notch Cabernet nearly every vintage. Best after 2000. 6,500 cases made.

Name: Toscana Luce
Note: Loads of crushed berry and milk chocolate aromas. Medium-bodied, very polished, with ultrafine tannins and a long, long finish. A slinky, sexy red, like a supermodel strolling down the catwalk. Best Luce to date. Best after 1999. 7,500 cases made.

Name: Coteaux du Languedoc
Note: Beautifully complex, with incredibly concentrated and well-focused flavors of blackberry, currant and ripe plum. Has a fragrant aroma and a lingering finish accented by leather and chocolate notes. Despite its impressive power, it comes off balanced and classy. Drink now through 2001. 2,800 cases made.

Name: Ribera del Duero Viña Mayor Reserva
Note: This strong, balanced red offers clean flavors of black cherry and plum, with notes of coffee and licorice, backed by firm tannins in a balanced, graceful package. This Spanish wine is food-friendly now, should become more expressive with age. Drink now through 2004. 25,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Sonoma County Green Valley Don Miguel Vineyard
Note: A delicious young Pinot Noir from a distinguished California vineyard, delivering ripe, rich and supple black cherry, wild berry, plum and spice flavors that are well focused, deep and lively. The wine finishes with just the right amount of tannin, and the aftertaste is rich and complex. Best now to 2002. 3,656 cases made.

Name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Reserve
Note: A real beauty, ripe, supple and complex, with a fleshy array of meaty plum, spice, oak and cedar. Holds its focus on the finish, where the flavors are vibrant, fan out and linger. Drink now through 2004. 2,100 cases made.

Name: Moulin-à-Vent Château des Jacques
Note: Impressive structure. The muscular tannins and firm acidity are well balanced, and there are hints of ripe fruit, game and toast flavors, but it's a bit closed right now. Best from 1999 through 2005. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Merlot Napa Valley Crimson Creek
Note: Smooth and supple, with ripe, earthy plum, wild berry and black cherry flavors that fold together nicely. Finishes with a complex interplay of flavors and mild, well-integrated tannins. Drink now through 2004. 10,500 cases made.

Name: Syrah Yakima Valley Red Willow Vineyard David Lake Signature Series
Note: Dark, dense and peppery, with lots of black cherry and blackberry flavors at the core, chewy tannins and a bite of earthy spice on the finish. Give it until 1999 to 2000 to soften. 2,400 cases made.

Name: Toscana Cepparello
Note: This blockbuster of a Sangiovese shows layers of ripe fruit on the palate, with loads of ripe tannins and a long, fruity finish. Truly monumental for this producer and appellation. Breathtaking. Best after 2002. 3,900 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Durell Vineyard
Note: This is a delicious mouthful of Chardonnay. It's big, bold, rich and creamy, brimming with tiers of flavor--vanilla, pear, anise, fig and melon--and finishing with harmonious notes of smoke and nectarine. Drink now through 2002. 2,847 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Barossa Valley E&E Black Pepper
Note: A profound wine, This Australian Shiraz burrows deep into its plush texture to reveal gorgeous flavors of ripe plum, berry and exotic spice, all balanced impressively on an elegant frame. The tannins are refined and well integrated. Approachable already. Best after 2001. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Mercurey White
Note: A Mercurey that tastes like a little Montrachet. With its beautiful blend of tropical and toasty aromas, this full-bodied white is generous and silky, coating every taste bud with its luscious, thick-as-oil liquid. Remarkable concentration of refined flavors--dried apricot, honey, lemon and mango. Drink now. 4,967 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Adelaide Hills
Note: A glorious white wine, graceful and harmonious as it layers its vibrant apple, pear, tropical fruit, spice and vanilla flavors and hints at raisin and lemon on the long, long finish. Best from 2000 through 2005. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Pommard Clos des Epeneaux
Note: A deep wine--one where you have to put your nose far into the glass to capture the subtleties. The black fruit, game, mineral and currant notes fill the palate, proving how dense and thick this '96 red Burgundy is. A brilliant Pommard. Best from 2006 through 2020. 1,665 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Sonoma-Santa Barbara-Monterey Counties Overlook
Note: Ripe, smooth, rich and creamy, with layers of pear, vanilla, anise and fig flavors that are deep, complex and concentrated. Finishes with a long, delicious aftertaste. Drink now through 2004. 15,000 cases made.

Name: Pouilly-Fuissé Tête de Cuvée
Note: What a beauty. Ultrasmooth, yet racy from a lemony texture laced with honey and lovely ripe fruit, this one of the cleanest Pouilly tasted from '97, displaying a minerally concentration on the finish, and not even the slightest astringency, it's that balanced. Drink now through 2005. 2,166 cases made.

Name: Clancy's Barossa
Note: A big red, ripe, rich and round, with lots of spicy, earth-scented black cherry and berry flavors, hinting deliciously at chocolate on the smooth finish. This distinctive Shiraz blend is drinkable now, yet has the depth to repay cellaring through 2007. 8,000 cases made.

Name: Toscana Vigna d'Alceo
Note: Even better than the superb 1996, this young wine has an amazing amount of pure fruit. A thick and rich Cabernet, with loads of tar, green tobacco, currant and fruit character. Full-bodied, with chewy tannins and a tobacco and wet earth aftertaste. Seriously well structured yet wonderfully harmonious. Best after 2003. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Langhe Sorì San Lorenzo
Note: The Romanée-Conti of Piedmont. An extraordinary red. Thick and ripe, with an elegant structure that makes it eerily balanced. Oozes blackberry, violet, mineral, smoke and petrol notes. Refined, with sweet tannins, it's tempting now if you don't mind a grip on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 870 cases made.

Name: Santenay Clos de Malte
Note: Impressive quality for a Santenay. Clean, pure, full-bodied, with ripe blackberry and wild raspberry flavors, wonderful terroir and mineral character, this has breeding and class written all over it. Firm structure, with crisp acidity. Good aging potential. Best from 2003 through 2010. 2,800 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Clare Valley Classic Clare
Note: This firm, beautifully framed, elegantly styled Shiraz fleshes out with berry, plum, white pepper and licorice flavors that last and last on the focused finish. Has style and the ability to age. Drink now through 2011. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr
Note: Fabulous. More like an auslese, this '97 spätlese is rich and zingy yet packed into a lean framework. Pinpoint delineation of lime, grapefruit and slate, intensely displayed on bracing acidity, is followed by a long, long finish. Best from 2002 through 2008. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Chablis Les Vaillons Domaine Long-Depaquit
Note: Absolutely gorgeous. Ripe, yet focused on the minerally soil of Chablis, this is creamy and refreshingly fruity, with masses of tropical, apricot, fig and pear character, with cream to boot on the buttery, caressing finish. Great winemaking. Best from 2000 through 2006. 3,033 cases made.

Name: Meursault La Barre Dessus Clos Marguerite
Note: Full-bodied yet incredibly elegant. So refined it smells of little but a vague mineraliness, and it's the same story on the palate--a great concentration of terroir, cream, compact tropical fruit and stone--with good acidity and subtle toastiness. Best from 2006 through 2015. 300 cases made.

Name: Trilogy Napa Valley
Note: An impressive red blend, tightly structured, with a rich array of currant, black cherry, anise, cedar, tar and spice flavors of remarkable harmony and finesse, ending in a long, complex aftertaste. A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2000 through 2009. 4,100 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Sonoma County Old Vines
Note: Well oaked, with lots of smoky, toasty flavors, but the fruit stands right up to it, with ripe cherry, raspberry and plum notes. Complex, flavorful aftertaste. Drink now through 2003. 25,000 cases made.

Name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Anagallis
Note: This is an ultrafine Sangiovese. Dark ruby in color, with bright aromas of raspberry, cherry, violet and rose. Full-bodied, with refined tannins and a superlong aftertaste. Best after 2000. 1,665 cases made.

Name: Nuits-St.-Georges Les Chaignots
Note: Sleek as a thoroughbred, the tannins are beautifully integrated with great minerally intensity, chalk, toast, spice and black cherry notes, and it has serious terroir etched all over it. Best from 2001 through 2005. 360 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Victoria Long Paddock
Note: What a find at this price and score. A lively white, crisp and juicy, with layers of vibrant apple, nectarine, passion fruit and floral flavors that last on the gentle finish. Wonderful now for its freshness. Drink now through 2001. 30,000 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Show Reserve
Note: Ripe, generous and supple, with pretty plum and currant flavors that persist beautifully on the finish. A bit rough around the edges, which cellaring should soften. Drink now through 2006. 15,000 cases made.

Name: Tempranillo Rioja
Note: Ambitious. This deeply colored, highly extracted red has a muscular structure, with mouthfilling tannins that dominate coffee and smoke flavors, which in turn dominate the core of ripe plum, tobacco, licorice and prune flavors. Give it time and watch it soar. Best after 2002. 2,500 cases made.

Name: Cabernet-Merlot Coonawarra
Note: Ripe and supple, with a chocolate and tobacco edge to the lovely berry, currant and herb flavors that linger through the silky finish. Has power and grace. A terrific wine, period, and even better for the price. Drink now through 2008. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Camelot Vineyard Single Vineyard Series
Note: Brimming with complex flavors, this California Chardonnay offers a harmonious blend of ripe pear, nectarine, pineapple and spice, with smoky, toasty oak filling in the gaps nicely. Drink now through 2002. 62,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Russian River Ranches
Note: Tight and crisp, with a flinty edge to the narrow band of pear, spice and apricot, slowly unfolding to reveal more nuance and complexity. Best from 2000 through 2004. 75,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay California Steele Cuvée
Note: Lots of up-front fruit and spice make this white distinctive, with tiers of fig, pear, melon, apricot and nutmeg cascading to a long finish with an intricate aftertaste. Even better than last year's version, also a Spectator Selection. Drink now through 2001. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Tapestry Reserve Napa Valley
Note: Tight in structure while plush in texture, offering rich plum, dark chocolate, cinnamon, spice and earth flavors that linger deliciously on the long, complex finish--this is one seductive California red. A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2005. 14,500 cases made.

Name: Priorat Les Terrasses
Note: Plenty of ripe, fresh fruit in this red, with flavors of black cherries, blackberries and plums, along with accents of toast and coffee. Yet it remains smooth and graceful on the palate, with well-integrated tannins and a long, fruity finish. Drink now through 2005. 9,500 cases made.

Name: Brut Champagne Royal Apanage
Note: The concentration is impressive in this intense, aromatic, full-bodied Champagne, with its assertive doughy and toasty aromas leading into flavors of ripe fruit and spices that linger enticingly on the finish. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

Name: Chablis
Note: Remarkably intense and rich for a village Chablis, this outstanding white kicks with life, boasting a round mouthfeel and a lovely combination of honey, pear, spice and toast flavors of good complexity and, above all, great length. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Coteaux du Languedoc La Copa Santa
Note: Quite a mouthful. Dense and incredibly concentrated, with layers of complex yet well-defined flavors of bacon, dark chocolate, ripe plum and raspberry, finishing with mineral and coffeelike notes. Rather plush despite its power, but this French red will need time in the cellar to integrate even further. Best from 2002 through 2008. 3,167 cases made.

Name: Pinot Gris Crimea 2 Year Old
Note: Delicious sweet wine. Amber-rust colored. Fruit cake with lots of dried fruits on the nose. Medium-bodied and lightly sweet, with a wonderful intensity of caramel and dried fruit character. Fresh finish. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.

Name: Rioja
Note: This ambitious red from Spain has a deep, opaque color, deep, almost charred aromas of coffee and toast and is firmly tannic on the palate, with ripe flavors of coffee, plum, prune and licorice. The wood notes are dominant now, but it has the concentration to improve with age. Best after 2002. 23,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Central Coast
Note: Smooth, rich and polished, with a complex core of herb-laced black cherry, currant, plum and raspberry flavors that soar on the finish, this California red offers an attractive combination of high quality and reasonable price, should be fairly available, too. Best from 2000 through 2004. 14,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley
Note: Wonderfully rich and silky, with polished, focused pear, nectarine and toast, showing more nuances of flavor on the finish. Drink now. 21,300 cases made.

Name: Haut-Médoc
Note: The best Cantemerle in years, beautiful and rich, with a wonderful core of fruit. Pretty plum and berry aromas, with hints of tobacco and chocolate, lead to a full-bodied wine with loads of chocolate and berry character. Long, long aftertaste. Best after 2005. 22,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Gris Oregon Reserve
Note: A lovely white, smooth and round on the palate, delivering a generous portion of melon, spicy pear and caramel flavors that linger beautifully, drawing you back for another sip. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Gisborne
Note: Smooth, polished and refreshing for its juicy pineapple, citrus and vanilla-almond flavors that wrap up neatly on the silky finish. Drink now through 2004. 8,000 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Barossa Filsell
Note: Ripe and spicy, here's a generous and focused red from Australia, dripping with blackberry, black cherry, anise and leather flavors that keep pumping through the long finish. Its fine tannins can use cellaring. Best after 2001. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Toscana Erta e China
Note: A pretty, balanced Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon blend. Intriguing aromas of plum skin and fresh mushroom have a hint of flowers. Medium- to full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a fruity, minty aftertaste. Best after 2000. 3,500 cases made.

Name: Riesling Kabinett Rheingau Hattenheimer Schützenhaus
Note: Authoritative, with a hint of a swagger, but this never loses focus. Shows peach aromas and flavors, but with more smoke and mineral, married to a rich texture and a firm backbone. Fine length of flavor. Drink now through 2007. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Pouilly-Fuissé Aged in Oak
Note: Lively, racy and full-bodied, this white Burgundy is packed with deftly created oak accents, showing a pronounced toasted character along with plenty of lemon notes, good fruit and impressive length on the finish. It's tempting now, but worth cellaring short-term. Best from 2000 through 2005. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Cabernet-Merlot Hawkes Bay
Note: Ripe, lively and remarkably elegant and refined, this has distinctive herb- and cedar-scented currant and raspberry flavors that keep spilling over on the long finish. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Riesling Alsace Cuvée des Seigneurs
Note: Aromas and flavors of forest floor, mineral and lanolin are allied to a sleek, steel-plated structure in this impressive Alsace Riesling. Dry, rich and intense, the wine combines freshness and some mature elements that should develop nicely. Drink now through 2005. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
Note: Wow. This is a richly concentrated, deftly made Chardonnay that's packed with ripe fruit flavors and layered with creamy, spicy accents that linger on the finish. Full-bodied, almost sweet in its ripeness, but still balanced. Drink now through 2001. 3,500 cases made.

Name: Dolcetto d'Alba Vigna del Mandorlo
Note: A Dolcetto of the highest level. Full-bodied, coating the palate with well-integrated tannins as well as mocha, chocolate and mostly black cherry and tar. For this varietal, there's amazing richness on the opulent finish. Tastes unfiltered. A perfect forebear of what the great '98 vintage might bring us. Drink now through 2001. 1,084 cases made.

Name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Forster
Note: Gorgeous. Exhibiting peach, violet and tropical fruit nuances, this white is concentrated and solidly supported by bracing acidity and power that carries through the finish. Young and unevolved, this shows great potential. Best from 2001 through 2008. 1,200 cases made.

Name: Pinot d'Alsace Alsace
Note: Delicious from start to finish, this gorgeous white bursts with ripe peach, smoke, nut and citrus character. Complex, fresh and beautifully balanced, this is textbook Alsace, a perfect introduction to the region. Drink now through 2001. 2,000 cases made.

Name: Toscana Solaia
Note: Dark ruby in color, with extremely ripe raisin and spice aromas. Full-bodied and very chewy, with loads of polished tannins and a long, long finish that's big and fruity. A solid, muscular red fromTuscany, this is the greatest Solaia ever made. Best after 2004. 7,000 cases made.

Name: Isosceles Paso Robles
Note: Absolutely delicious, this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (mostly), Cabernet Franc and Merlot is brimming with ripe and juicy currant, blackcherry, wild berry, plum and anise flavors that are complex, deep and polished. Finishes long and flavorful. Best from 2002 through 2012. 8,000 cases made.

Name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Cuvée des Cadettes
Note: Seductive and sexy, this world-class red is rich, opulent and ripe, with layers of superb mocha, toast and spice. Loaded with blackberry and cassis, its fabulous balance leads to a long fruit-and-oak finish. Very tempting now. Best from 2005 through 2030. 2,200 cases made.

Name: Profile Napa Valley
Note: Massive, with wonderful richness, depth and concentration, this Cabernet blend has layers of complex currant, black cherry, plum, vanilla and blackberry and a long, detailed, firmly tannic finish. Best from 2002 through 2012. 5,200 cases made.

Name: Bolgheri Ornellaia
Note: This Tuscan gem is black in color, with complex aromas of black currants, minerals and wet earth. Full- bodied, with lots of tannins, but very polished. Long, long finish. Super well-made—a great Ornellaia. Best after 2004. 11,415 cases made.

Name: Toscana Sammarco
Note: Black color. Aromas of blackberries, minerals and mint. Very subtle. Full-bodied, with amazing concentration of silky tannins and a finish that goes on and on. Monumental Sammarco. Best ever for me. Best after 2005. 3,500 cases made.

Name: Bolgheri Superiore Guado al Tasso Tenuta Belvedere
Note: A balanced and harmonious young red. Dark ruby color, with loads of grape, berry, mineral and violet aromas. Full-bodied, with loads of blackberry and cherry character, fine tannins and a medium finish. Gorgeous wine. Best after 2005.

Name: Barbaresco Sorì Burdin
Note: Kaleidoscopic character. This Piedmont red offers deep and rich aromas of ripe plum, meat and dried fruit and is full-bodied, with wonderfully polished tannins and a finish of red fruit and spice that goes on for minutes. Best after 2004. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Grenache-Syrah-Mourvèdre McLaren Vale GSM
Note: Rich and distinctive, a bit lighter than moststraight Aussie Shirazes but dripping withflavors, corralling a wild range of meatyblackberry, red cherry, black cherry and pepperflavors into a smooth wine of enormous characterand depth. Appealing already. Best after 2002. 4,500 cases imported.

Name: Toscana Casalferro
Note: A monster Italian red. Aromas of coffee, roastedmeat and ripe berries precede a full-bodied winewith mouthpuckering tannins and an enormousconcentration of fruit. What it lacks in eleganceand sophistication it gives in concentration andpower. Best after 2003. 8,750 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville
Note: Sturdy, rich and detailed, with complex, earthy currant, sage, mineral, tobacco and anise flavors that fan out and saturate the palate. Finishes with muscular tannins. Best Mondavi Oakville yet. Best from 2002 through 2012.

Name: Merlot Napa-Sonoma Counties
Note: Impressive. Espresso-style, deeply concentrated Merlot, boasting a core of rich currant, coffee, black cherry and anise. Firms up on the finish, where a touch of bay leaf adds complexity to the flavor profile. Drink now through 2006. 4,137 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Central Coast
Note: This wine is opulent, rich and creamy, with a core of nectarine, fig, citrus, pineapple and spice supported by firm, lively acidity, finishing long and full. Lovely Chardonnay from a growing California appellation. Drink now through 2005. 9,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Oregon Premier Cuvée
Note: Ripe, round and distinctive, with juicy, spicy, floral notes around currant and plum flavors that linger long. This Pinot has all its elements packed in tightly and harmoniously. Very classy. Drink now through 2010. 2,809 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Georges de Latour Private Reserve
Note: An extraordinary wine, dense, rich and earthy, with broad, plush tannins and tiers of complex currant, earth, cedar, black cherry, mineral and anise flavors. Keeps a tight focus on the long, rich, detailed aftertaste. Best from 2002 through 2010. 17,000 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Estate Series
Note: Round and cedary, this Washington red deliversdepth, length and distinctive flavor. Ripe, plushand generous with its exotic, seductive aromas andflavors, layering rich plum, currant and clove ona bed of fine-grained tannins. Great price/scoreratio. Drink now through 2011. 15,000 cases made.

Name: Toscana San Martino
Note: Big and powerful Tuscan red. Quite dark in color, with an intense blackberry, raspberry and floral character. Full-bodied, with very chewy tannins. Very tight now. Best after 2005. 1,077 cases made.

Name: Rioja Torre Muga Reserva
Note: Beautifully aromatic, with notes of cassis,lilacs, coffee and spices, this sinuous red ispolished and elegant, yet dense with fruit, oakand earthy flavors that linger and expand on thelong finish. An extraordinary marriage of typicityand sophistication. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Barossa Command
Note: A superrich and jammy Aussie red sporting a wonderful array of black cherry, wild berry, seductive toasty oak and spice nuances. The texture is silky-smooth, the finish a mile-long. Drink now through 2008. 1,800 cases made.

Name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Flaccianello
Note: This builds and builds and builds on the palate. Gorgeous aromas of ripe berries, meat and spices. Full-bodied, with polished, well-integrated tannins and a long, long finish. Give it time. Best after 2005. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Altenberg de Bergheim
Note: Terrific. Beautiful aromas of flowers, pine forests, peaches and citrus. Rich, creamy and just off-dry midpalate, with firm underlying structure, yet the finish is dry. Still needs time. Drink now through 2005. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape La Crau
Note: Reserved aromatically, but the wonderful balance is evident as this young Rhône red reveals its mineral, wet earth, delicate plum, mocha, coffee and blackberry character and subtle, ripe tannins. The wet earth and mineral really shine through on the lingering finish. Drink now through 2010. 16,665 cases made.

Name: Brunello di Montalcino Tenuta Nuova
Note: This is a blockbuster Brunello--the real thing. Tastes very ripe and earthy, with lots of wonderful fruit and wet leaf character. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a long finish. Drink now through 2008. 3,945 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Barossa
Note: Smooth, polished and positively glowing with fruit and spice flavors, bursting across the palate with gorgeous blackberry, black cherry, anise and cinnamon flavors, swirling in some sweet vanilla and pepper on the long finish. Best from 2002 through 2020. 12,000 cases imported.

Name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Cuvée Réservée
Note: Superopulent. Full-bodied and thick, with rich, ripe fruit flavors that taste sweet midpalate. Wonderful, supple, velvety finish. Delicious. Drink now through 2015. 6,250 cases made.

Name: Alexis Napa Valley
Note: Weaves together a complex array of rich black cherry, ripe plum, wild berry and floral notes, all sharply focused, finishing with firm tannins and wonderful length. Best from 2002 through 2010. 3,400 cases made.

Name: Priorat Finca La Planeta
Note: Intense. First, ripe fruit coats the palate, then darker flavors of coffee, anise and minerals emerge and linger. Firm tannins and high alcohol build an impressive structure. A big wine that needs time to unwind. Best after 2004. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Cold Creek Vineyard
Note: Rich, ripe and focused, this Washington Cabernet shows layers of currant, plum and vanilla flavors, with hints of pepper and bay leaf sneaking in on the long, supple finish. Fine-grained tannins. Best from 2001 through 2008. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Gevrey-Chambertin Lavaux St.-Jacques
Note: Blockbuster style of red Burgundy. Inky-black in color, full in body, packed with flavors, but also delivering great finesse with its silky tannins. Bold but focused blackberry, wild raspberry, smoke, petrol, and tar complexity. A winner, with its silky texture that endures through a long, balanced finish. Best from 2003 through 2015. 405 cases made.

Name: Toscana Vigorello
Note: This Tuscan red is big and plummy, full-bodied and tannic, with loads of vanilla and coconut, lots of pepper and berry character, too. Long, slightly hard finish. Needs time to mellow. Best after 2003. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Rioja Viña Lanciano Reserva
Note: Elegant. This polished Spanish red is bursting with cherry, berry, spice and vanilla flavors that float over fine-grained tannins and linger, fresh and clean, on the long finish. A beautiful example of the traditional style. Drink now through 2006. 13,600 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sant'Antimo Tavernelle
Note: This outstanding Cabernet Sauvignon from Tuscanyhas interesting aromas of ripe fruit and meat,with hints of dried herbs. It's full-bodied andvery concentrated, with plenty of velvety tanninsand a long finish. Give it some time in thebottle. Best after 2001. 7,500 cases made.

Name: Vintage Port Vau
Note: Dark purple in color, with wonderful violet, berry and cherry aromas. Full-bodied, medium-sweet, with a solid core of fruit and tannins. Long finish. Subtle. Best Sandeman since the 1960s. Best after 2008. 25,200 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon North Coast
Note: Ripe and fleshy, with blackberry, chocolate and toffee flavors supported by round tannins that linger on an intense finish. Drink now through 2005. 14,382 cases made.

Name: Brut Champagne Cuvée Sir Winston Churchill
Note: Power and intensity in a glass. Bold and full of bread dough and apple, with a marmalade note, married to a big, firm structure, it still seems youthful. A brilliant Champagne that should develop beautifully. Best from 2001 through 2010. 6,250 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Petit Verdot McLaren Vale Traditional
Note: Dark, ripe and complex, this red blend reveals its depth with layers of ripe plum, blackberry, coffee and earth. Finishes with a wide range of tasty herb flavors and rich, full tannins. Drink now through 2008. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Premium Selection
Note: Crisp and fragrant, this Kiwi white delivers a riot of floral and tropical fruit flavors, favoring passion fruit, lime and spicy rose petal notes. Delicious, and affordable, too. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

Name: Riesling Columbia Valley Eroica
Note: Offers a bouquet of wonderful flavors, pouring outits pear, apricot, mineral and honey notes.Off-dry but balanced, with enough of a steelybackbone to make the flavors sing. A collaborativeeffort of Chateau Ste. Michelle and Mosel's Dr.Loosen. Wonderful now. Best from 2002 through 2009. 2,600 cases made.

Name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Les Closiers
Note: Seductive because of the rich fruit and suppletannins, but also the fresh, clean and crispcharacter that cleanses the palate and gives thisfull-bodied, ripe red a sense of elegance andvibrancy. Has raisiny and plummy aromas, withroasted game, grilled lamb chops and cassisjam. Drink now through 2010. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Merlot Columbia Valley Estate Vineyards
Note: Beautifully proportioned to balance the fruit and oak, generous without being weighty, this Washington red serves up a lush mouthful of ripe berry and spice flavors, dripping with chocolate and sage notes on the polished finish. Drink now through 2007. 20,000 cases made.

Name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Sablet
Note: Seductive red for a Valentine's date. A bit earthy--but what amazing texture and ripeness in the midpalate. It just massages the taste buds,offering a hedonistic tasting experience that makes you dream. Mineral from the wet earth, blackberry and massive, sweet tannins. Very terroir-driven. Drink now through 2008. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Fiano di Avellino
Note: An impressive Italian white with layers of tropical fruit and citrus character. It's full-bodied, with wonderful concentration, good acidity and a long, long flavorful finish. Drink now through 2004. 21,000 cases made.

Name: Stellenbosch
Note: This red makes a statement. Fresh, bold and extravagantly oaked, exuding vanilla, coffee and toast elements, backed by a core of rich, concentrated plum and black currant. Lovely acidity keeps it all lively, and the long finish bodes well for the future. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Shiraz. Best from 2001 through 2008. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Chianti Classico Badia a Passignano Riserva
Note: Impressive Chianti Classico riserva. Aromas of currants, blackberries and toasted oats. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a long, long finish. Still needs time to open. Best after 2001. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Morellino di Scansano Riserva
Note: This Tuscan red is gorgeous. Emitting beautiful aromas of blackberry, wet earth and toasted oak, it's full-bodied and very polished, with fine tannins and a fresh, delicious finish. Needs time. Best after 2000. 2,590 cases made.

Name: Priorat Finca Dofí
Note: Seamless. This red is a beautiful combination of ripe fruit, powerful structure and polished texture. Lush flavors of blackberries and plums are supported by firm, ripe tannins and give way to coffee and mineral notes on the long finish. Drink now through 2010. 1,200 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Sicilia
Note: Here's an Italian white that tastes like a villageMeursault from Lafon; very impressive. Golden incolor, with very ripe pineapple and apricot aromasplus hints of vanilla and dough. Full in body,with lots of unctuous fruit and a long, longfinish. Drink now through 2003. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Ebenezer
Note: Firm in texture, with juicy plum, blackberry and rose petal flavors, the fruit echoing enticingly amid the fine-grained tannins on the finish. Appealing already, but it's destined for a long life. Drink now through 2012. 3,500 cases made.

Name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Spitzer Singerriedel
Note: Multidimensional. Intense aromas of licorice and spice combine with a broad structure and thick texture that feels more like that of a red wine. Closed now, so be patient. Best from 2001 through 2006. 625 cases made.

Name: Bolgheri Superiore Ornellaia
Note: A cool and sleek Tuscan red, with tarragon and fresh sage aromas, blackberry and cherry undertones. Full-bodied, with a wonderfully silky palate of fine tannins and a long, fruity finish. Very sophisticated and reserved. Best after 2004. 13,330 cases made.

Name: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano Grandi Annate Riserva
Note: Emits phenomenal aromas of crushed berries, roses, lilacs and currants. Full-bodied, with an incredible backbone of ultrafine tannins and a long, fruity finish. Not big and thick, but powerful and subtle. A very special wine indeed; the greatest Vino Nobile ever made. Hard not to drink it now. Best after 2005. 2,600 cases made.

Name: Bolgheri Superiore Guado al Tasso
Note: Wonderful balance here. Violet and berry aromas, with intense tarragon and currant character. Full-bodied and gorgeous, with wonderful finesse and subtlety. Very long. Best after 2005. 9,500 cases made.

Name: Vallagarina
Note: Black ruby in color, intense aromas of blackberries, licorice, red berries and green tobacco, this is a full-bodied red with loads of silky tannins and a long, long aftertaste of tobacco, sage and berry. A huge core of fruit in this wine. Needs time. An Italian interpretation of great Bordeaux from bygone days. Best after 2006. 7,450 cases made.

Name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil
Note: A tightly wound thoroughbred, with complex nut and biscuit notes playing off a floral freshness. Driving it all is a racy acidity matched by a seamless elegance and innate power that lingers through the persistent ginger-tinged finish. Will age beautifully. Drink now through 2008. 1,200 cases made.

Name: Syrah McLaren Vale Basket Pressed
Note: Crisp and juicy Shiraz, rich with fruit, bursting with flavor, offering a cascade of bright berry, guava, plum and anise flavors, echoing with a distinctive black pepper note on the spicy finish. Fine-grained tannins don't get in the way. Drink now through 2012. 8,000 cases made.

Name: Langhe Sperss
Note: A superb Sperss, with refined aromas of minerals, flowers, berries and just a hint of mint. Full-bodied and powerful, with chewy tannins and a long berry, cherry and mineral aftertaste. Impressive structure. Best after 2005. 2,000 cases made.

Name: Gigondas Le Grand Montmirail
Note: Fantastic. Dark and deep, with lots of black fruit, this is as silky a red as you can imagine—all cream and smoothness and seduction. Full-bodied, it kicks in with a touch of fresh fruit character on the long, juicy finish. Massive, sweet tannins lurk in the background, so it should age. Drink now through 2010. 3,750 cases made.

Name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Loibenberg
Note: Brilliant effort. Amply proportioned and spicy, this '99 Riesling combines fascinating smoke, quince and peach flavors with a vibrant structure that drives the flavors. Explodes on the finish with a potpourri of mineral and spice. Drink now through 2006. 1,200 cases made.

Name: Coteaux du Languedoc Bronzinelle
Note: A powerhouse red from the south of France. Rich and complex, with vivid and well-defined flavors of dark plum, meat and spice. Deeply colored with a meaty aroma, this has the stuffing to age. Peppery and brickish notes linger on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 1,000 cases imported.

Name: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano Riserva
Note: Ripe and powerful aromas of berries and smoke, with hints of raisins. Full-bodied and massive in the mouth, with big, velvety tannins and a long, long finish. A blockbuster riserva. Best after 2004. 7,100 cases made.

Name: Bolgheri-Sassicaia Sassicaia
Note: Lovely, subtle yet complex aromas of currants, sage and green olives lead to a full-bodied red with a solid core of fruit and well-integrated tannins. Still very reserved on the finish, but those who are patient should be rewarded. Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Best after 2005. 13,000 cases made.

Name: Verona Palazzo della Torre
Note: This Veneto red is glorious and rich, yet sophisticated. Dark ruby color, it emits aromas of raisins and berries, and hints of cocoa and spice. It's full-bodied, with chewy yet velvety tannins and a long, long finish. Best after 2001. 11,000 cases made.

Name: Chablis Premier Cru
Note: Amazing. This is a beautiful Chablis, tightly structured and very refined, expanding its mineral base to encompass some vanilla, ripe fruit, honey and slightly spicy oak. Medium-bodied and very long on the finish, it just keeps riding into the sunset. Best from 2003 through 2010. 16,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Grand Estates
Note: Rich and vibrant, beautifully focused to show off its plush honey, spice and smoke-accented pear and apricot flavors. Finish is seductively polished and as smooth as a Jean Arp sculpture. Drink now through 2005. 120,000 cases made.

Name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages
Note: Delicious and stylish young red, balancing fresh, focused and ripe fruit, clean and pure, with mineral, spice, mocha and coffee notes. Dark-colored and medium-bodied, its tannins are sweet, and there's pure fruit on the lively finish. Drink now through 2007. 40,000 cases made.

Name: Riesling South Australia Gold Label
Note: Wonderfully aromatic Riesling, its glorious noseful of apricot and floral notes segueing into off-dry flavors that center around lime and apple, with mineral and peppery-floral overtones. Tempting now, but should develop more depth and texture with age. Best from 2003 through 2010. 7,000 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Clare Valley Bin 61
Note: This rich, complex red drips with juicy blackberry, cherry and exotic spice flavors, weaving in hints of game and pepper as everything lingers on the long finish. Tannins are soft, making the wine seductive. Drink now through 2010. 15,000 cases made.

Name: Petite Sirah Sonoma County
Note: A dazzling red, dark, rich and exuberant, this wine reveals layers of peppery plum, black cherry and blueberry fruit that turn lush, with smooth tannins. Great example of its type. Drink now through 2008. 8,000 cases made.

Name: Crozes-Hermitage Les Pierrelles
Note: Ultrathick and concentrated Crozes; the liquid hangs on to the inside of the glass as you swirl it. The wine has mineral, iron, wet earth and ripe, clean fruit character that seduces, thanks to the sweetness of the whole package. Full-bodied, tough and long, this needs time in the cellar to smooth out. Best from 2005 through 2012. 5,415 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Monterey Great Estates
Note: Maintains a sense of elegance and finesse, even with its rich, creamy core of earth, pear, fig, citrus, hazelnut and nectarine flavors. Long and complex on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 4,029 cases made.

Name: Toscana Campaccio
Note: A lovely, juicy wine, with very soft and polished tannins, ripe and smoky fruit and a long and beautiful finish. This is gorgeous. The best Terrabianca in years. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2003. 7,915 cases made.

Name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Rasteau
Note: Traditional-style red that's worth hunting down. Digs the earth. Medium-bodied, it kicks up mineral and terroir, while also delivering a mouthful of beautifully ripe, black fruit and lots of firm tannins. Honest wine, without fancy oak, that will improve and soften with age. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Gattinara
Note: A poor man's Barolo, with mocha, smoky tea and dried fruit on the nose, and superripe, thick and rich fruit, verging on raisins. Full-bodied, with soft, silky tannins and a juicy, pruny finish. Hard not to drink it now. Best after 2005. 17,000 cases made.

Name: Sauvignon Blanc Toscana Poggio alla Gazze
Note: Aromas of peach, flint, gunpowder and ripe fruit come from this full-bodied yet reserved Tuscan white, with fine acidity and a long, long, flavorful finish. A Sauvignon with finesse, like a fine Pouilly-Fumé. Drink now. 6,665 cases made.

Name: Magnificat Napa Valley
Note: Appealing from start to finish. It's smooth and seductive, with pretty toasty oak, spice, currant and black cherry flavors. Mocha, raspberry and cinnamon come in on the finish, along with plush tannins. Great length. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2010. 11,500 cases made.

Name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Reserve
Note: Supple in texture and lively in flavor, this elegant New Zealand Sauvignon shows minty lime, apple and passion fruit flavors that linger through the finish. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

Name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
Note: Very tightly wound at this stage, here's a racy, intense Riesling full of finely etched lime, rhubarb and slate flavors. Be patient, it has all the elements. Best from 2002 through 2008. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Malbec Mendoza Catena Lunlunta Vineyards
Note: Serious Malbec. Dense, with a brooding feel to the smoky currant, plum and spice flavors, this Argentine red is really packed with fruit, with ripe, thick tannins coming in on the finish. Just needs a little time to strut its stuff. Best from 2002 through 2004. 9,900 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Coonawarra Bin 128
Note: Rich flavors of dark berry and cherry are balanced against a wiry backbone of fine tannins and acidity in this outstanding Shiraz, gaining momentum on the finish. Impressive for its intensity and elegance. Drink now through 2010. 82,489 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Chalone
Note: A ripe, rich, complex and concentrated California Chardonnay, with layers of ripe pear, fig, citrus and nectarine. Turns creamy and buttery in texture, with a long, full aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 24,310 cases made.

Name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
Note: Lots of shirt-collar-grabbing verve in this serious South African Sauvignon, a vibrant mix of lime, cut grass, sweet pea and chalk, with good, medium-weight texture and a long, juicy finish. Drink now through 2003. 11,000 cases made.

Name: Coteaux du Languedoc Pic St.-Loup
Note: An elegant, well-balanced red, with a chocolaty aroma and pure flavors of red plum and berry. Finishes with brickish and mineral notes.  Drink now through 2003. 4,300 cases made.

Name: Puente Alto
Note: This has a laser beam of currant and cassis running through its densely textured palate. Extra notes of cocoa powder, mineral and smoke come in on the finish. Densely structured, but the tannins are sweet and finely grained. A serious wine for the cellar. Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenère and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2002 through 2006. 12,000 cases made.

Name: Late Bottled Port
Note: An outstanding LBV. Black in color, with wonderful aromas of blackberries, cherries and licorice, it's full-bodied and medium sweet, with soft tannins and a long finish. Delicious now and will improve with age. Great value considering the quality. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2008. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Soave Classico Superiore La Rocca
Note: Hard to believe it's a Soave. Super, with wonderful late-harvest aromas of honey, light butterscotch and straw, this wine is full-bodied, with lots of ripe fruit and a long, long creamy, fruity aftertaste. Drink now. 3,330 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Great Estates
Note: A tremendous effort, very rich and full-bodied, with plush tannins wrapped around a complex, concentrated core of earthy currant, toasty oak, hints of sage and chocolate and rich black cherry fruit. Beautifully focused, elegant and tapered on the long, detailed finish. Drink now through 2008. 4,280 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Bella Oaks Vineyard
Note: Supple and elegant, a very impressive style, with creamy black cherry, currant, plum, olive, dill and spice. Finishes with polished tannins and a lingering aftertaste. Drink now through 2009. 4,700 cases made.

Name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Cairanne Cuvée Prestige
Note: Beautiful. Rich, ripe, thick and flavorful. The sweet-tasting fruit and lush tannins make for an opulent red with smoke, mineral, grilled meat, plum and blackberry character. Balanced. Drink now through 2015. 1,500 cases made.

Name: Lagrein Alto Adige Steinraffler
Note: A blockbuster red. Esoteric. Black-ruby color. Intense aromas of cooked fruits and grilled meat. Full-bodied and very chewy, with a long, long finish. Like a top Syrah. Best after 2003. 1,500 cases made.

Name: Coteaux du Languedoc Pic St.-Loup Grande Cuvée
Note: A full-bore, meaty French red, showing ripe flavors and aromas of dark plum, cassis and blackberry with exotic spicy and mineral elements. Dark chocolate, roasted plum and espresso notes make for an intense and long-lasting finish. Best from 2002 through 2007. 1,500 cases made.

Name: Chianti Classico Castello di Brolio
Note: Dark ruby color, with lots of chocolate, berry and vanilla aromas, this is full-bodied and velvety, with lots of fruit and a long, succulent finish. A beauty from a great vintage. Best from 2001 through 2006. 17,000 cases made.

Name: Barolo Zonchera
Note: Intense aromas of rosebushes and fruit. Full-bodied, with plenty of juicy fruit and chewy tannins. Needs time to open. Best after 2005. 6,300 cases made.

Name: Brunello di Montalcino Pian delle Vigne
Note: Amazing Brunello. Fantastic aromas of blackberries, flowers and minerals. Captivating. Full-bodied, with incredible layers of ripe fruit and silky tannins. The finish last for minutes. Racy and firm now. Give it some bottle age. Best from 2004 through 2014. 12,000 cases made.

Name: Brunello di Montalcino Castelgiocondo
Note: Superbly crafted. Pretty aromas of black cherry, cream and licorice. Full-bodied, yet incredibly tight and smooth, with ultrafine tannins and a long, long, velvety finish. Best after 2004. 12,000 cases made.

Name: Uriah Walla Walla Valley
Note: Ultrasmooth and gently spicy, a gorgeous rainbow of plum, cherry, cedar, chocolate and exotic spice flavors that play across a supple frame, polished to a deep sheen and echoing forever. Drink now through 2010. 1,200 cases made.

Name: Brunello di Montalcino Vigna di Pianrosso
Note: Beautiful, with blackberry, perfumed violet and milk chocolate aromas. Full-bodied, with loads of jammy, chocolaty fruit and big, velvety tannins. Lasts for minutes on the palate. Glorious now, but will age for a very long time. Best after 2004. 2,500 cases made.

Name: Toscana Ghiaie della Furba
Note: Fantastic. Very ripe and rich, with raisin and cured beef character. Full-bodied, with big, velvety tannins and a long, long finish. A massive but impressive red. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah. Best after 2005. 3,250 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District Estate
Note: Absolutely gorgeous, beautifully defined fruit, with uncommon richness and purity of flavor, gushing with ripe currant, blackberry and wild berry fruit, revealing extra facets and dimensions, with a long, intricate, detailed finish. Firmly tannic, but a wealth of fruit pushes through. Best from 2003 through 2012. 1,300 cases made.

Name: Syrah Columbia Valley Reserve
Note: Plump and generous, dark-colored and amazingly supple, offering pretty plum, blackberry and sweet spice flavors that linger on the polished finish. Drink now through 2005. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Margaret River Art Series
Note: Brilliant, juicy and multilayered, brimming with apple, pear, tropical fruit, almond, mineral and spice flavors that swirl together on a muscular but lithe and seamless frame. The flavors last and last. Has depth, length and power without being at all bulky. Drink now through 2011. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
Note: One whiff and you know this is serious stuff. The aromas of baking brioche, coconut, candied citrus and leather pick up roasted coffee and grilled nuts on the palate, permeating the senses. Profound depth and complexity, offering a unique Champagne experience. Drink now through 2006. 40,000 cases made.

Name: Barolo Carobric
Note: Very well-done. Bright fruit, with hints of dry porcini that turn to blackberries. Full-bodied, with loads of silky tannins and a medium finish. Best after 2005. 1,600 cases made.

Name: Shiraz South Australia Individual Vineyard
Note: Smooth and generous, an inviting red that's plump with black cherry, blackberry and exotic spice flavors, hinting at dark chocolate as the flavors persist on the fine-grained finish. Outstanding. Drink now through 2004. 20,000 cases made.

Name: Soave Classico Superiore
Note: Fantastic white. Lovely aromas of fresh green apples, grapefruit and peaches. Full-bodied and very rich, with intense fruit and a long, long finish. A super Soave. Drink now through 2005. 20,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Carneros Dijon Clones
Note: A bold mouthful of Chardonnay that packs in lots of rich, complex flavors that are concentrated and deep. Smoky toasty oak, pear, fig, sage and anise turn thick and buttery. Drink now through 2006. 15,000 cases made.

Name: Toscana Toro Desiderio
Note: Big and ripe red, with loads of black licorice, tar and sultanas. Full-bodied, with big, velvety, chewy tannins. Long, ripe fruit aftertaste. A blockbuster. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2005. 3,750 cases made.

Name: Merlot Columbia Valley Canoe Ridge Estate Vineyard
Note: Rich, round and generous with its ripe blackberry, cherry and sweet spice flavors, which echo beautifully on the velvety finish. Drink now through 2006. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Sonoma County Old Vine
Note: A big, ripe, expressive style that packs in lots of spicy blackberry and black cherry fruit, and manages a measure of elegance and finesse given its size and intensity. Finishes with hints of herb and tea. Drink now through 2009. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Adelaide Hills Thomas Hyland
Note: Silky, supple and creamy, beautifully balanced to layer its intense nectarine, pear, lime and cream flavors, which linger effortlessly on the elegant finish. Drink now through 2008. 14,390 cases imported.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Puente Alto Marqués de Casa Concha
Note: Delicious Old World-style Cab, with ripe currant and cassis fruit accentuated by mineral, loam, smoke and earth notes. Ripe and juicy, with lovely mouthfeel, and the tug of gout de terroir on the finish. Back-to-back outstanding efforts for this wine. Drink now through 2005. 24,500 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Mendoza Catena Agrelo Vineyards
Note: Delicious stuff. Juicy, with fig, pineapple and pear flavors, fat texture, and a long, bright finish that lets the flavors hang on. Drink now through 2003. 14,000 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Monte Rosso Vineyard Family Vineyard Selection
Note: Impressive for its rich, tight, deeply concentrated core of spice- and anise-laced currant and blackberry flavors. Sharply focused, intense and concentrated, its mouthfilling fruit flavors are long and complex on the finish, with well-integrated tannins. Best from 2004 through 2014. 1,365 cases made.

Name: Claret Napa Valley
Note: A supple, elegant style, with a range of herb, currant and green olive that offers complexity, picking up anise, earth and mineral flavors. Pleasantly balanced on the finish. A wine of grace and delicacy. Drink now through 2009. 9,800 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Arroyo Grande Valley
Note: A wine of finesse and elegance, with intense, vibrant fruit that's ripe and rich, with layers of smoky toasty oak, honeysuckle, fig and melon, turning subtle and polished. Drink now through 2005. 9,630 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Grand Reserve
Note: Orchestrates an assortment of ripe cherry, blackberry and currant flavors in a smooth texture. Has fine tannins, picking up toasty, cedary oak on the finish, providing backbone. Best from 2004 through 2012. 4,500 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Sbragia Limited Release
Note: A rich, complex and deeply concentrated style, with layers of pear, fig, smoke, apricot and honey. Bold and intriguing, it's a mouthful of Chardonnay that both relies on oak and carries it well. Drink now through 2005. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Meursault Les Charrons
Note: Gorgeous from start to finish. An explosive wine that delivers lemon, ripe fruit, and toasted oak (in manageable doses). Sweet-tasting, but with an impressive mineral note. Beautiful, long, succulent finish. Drink now through 2010. 500 cases imported.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Appellation Selection
Note: Wonderful richness, depth and purity of flavor. Shows layers of black cherry, ripe plum, raspberry and currant, as well as touches of anise and herb. Vanilla and cedar-scented oak linger in the background. Ripe tannins emerge on the long, complex, elegant finish. Best from 2003 through 2010. 2,500 cases made.

Name: Justification Paso Robles
Note: A ripe, intense, fruit-driven style, with racy, jammy black cherry and blackberry fruit that's well-focused, picking up pretty toasty oak, tar and leather shadings. Holds its focus nicely. Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2009. 2,000 cases made.

Name: Douro
Note: This Portuguese red bursts in the mouth with intense flavors of cassis, berry and red cherry that are powered by a strong backbone of acidity. Finish of game and bittersweet chocolate. Almost Burgundian in its elegance and balance. Best from 2003 through 2008. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Cuvée Sauvage
Note: Rich, elegant and stylish, with pretty hazelnut, toasty marshmallow, pear, fig and citrus flavors that are nicely proportioned. Drink now through 2007. 3,600 cases made.

Name: Umbria White Cervaro della Sala
Note: Wonderful aromas of apple pie, honey and cream follow through to a full body, with toasted coconut and rich tropical fruit on the palate. Very long. Always an excellent white. Chardonnay and Grechetto. Drink now. 13,000 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Langhorne Creek
Note: Rich and delicious, a lip-smacking mouthful of blackberry, currant, blueberry and plum flavors wrapped in a blanket of exotic spices, with hints of coffee and chocolate. Tannins are fine and chewy. Drink now through 2015. 1,000 cases imported.

Name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara-Monterey Castello
Note: A richly flavored yet elegantly crafted wine that's sleek and polished, with ripe pear, fig, honeysuckle and honeydew flavors that turn smooth and creamy, picking up subtle nutmeg and hazelnut nuances on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 2,466 cases made.

Name: Greco di Tufo
Note: An outstanding modern-style wine from an ancient Italian grape variety. Wonderful aromas of blanched almonds, dried peach, pineapple and minerals. Medium- to full-bodied, with lovely fresh fruit, flinty character and a long, long finish. Excellent. Drink now. 66,650 cases made.

Name: Montsant Laurona
Note: Powerful oaky flavors dominate this red now, but they wrap around a core of luscious raspberry and blackberry fruit flavors, and the texture is smooth and opulent. An ambitious wine in the modern style. Carignane, Grenache, Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best from 2004 through 2012. 4,300 cases made.

Name: Viño de la Tierra de Castilla y León
Note: Harmony and finesse mark this elegant red. It offers black cherry, toast and spice flavors over firm tannins, with a grace that almost hides its intensity. A lovely wine in the modern style. Drink now through 2009. 13,000 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley
Note: Rich and ripe, packed with beautiful currant and berry flavors, framed with superfine tannins that let the fruit and subtly spicy overtones linger effortlessly on the long finish. Drink now through 2010. 2,329 cases made.

Name: Merlot Spring Mountain District
Note: A magnificent Merlot, with gorgeous fruit that's ripe, rich and distinctive. The bounty of complex flavors includes enticing black cherry, currant, blackberry and spice, with a smooth chocolaty aftertaste. Drink now through 2012. 2,510 cases made.

Name: Clos Apalta Rapel Valley
Note: A stunner. This coats the palate with cassis, blackberry and boysenberry fruit, but stays focused and pure, with vanilla, spice and toast notes chiming in on the palate for added effect. The finish then resonates with purity. A thoroughly seductive wine that glides effortlessly, despite its obvious power and depth. Carmenère, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2009. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Priorat
Note: Suave, sophisticated, rich and concentrated, but remains balanced and polished, with bright blueberry and blackberry flavors supported by toasty, vanilla-scented oak. A modern wine with great structure and harmony. Best after 2005. 1,800 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Barossa Valley RWT
Note: Rich in character and aristocratic in structure, a noble red that wears its subtle cherry, blackberry, chocolate, pepper and sweet spice flavors on a polished frame like a bespoke suit, letting them all play out elegantly on the well-buffed finish. Drink now through 2015. 3,800 cases made.

Name: Toscana Oreno
Note: Dark, with fantastic aromas of currant, blackberry, spice and lightly toasty oak. Full-bodied, with very well-integrated tannins and a texture as fine as the best cashmere from Scotland. Superb. Needs time in the bottle to show its full potential. One of the new hot wines of Tuscany. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 2008. 3,330 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Bella's Garden
Note: Rich, dense and distinctive for its pepper and exotic spice notes weaving through the chewy cherry pie, dried blueberry and coffee flavors, echoing forever on the long, long finish. Drink now through 2020. 400 cases imported.

Name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Ritchie Vineyard
Note: Wonderful aromas of flowers, honeysuckle, fig, butter and hazelnut. Rich, silky flavors that are elegant and refined, with a creamy, citrus-laced finish. Vibrant acidity gives it backbone and sustains the flavors on a long, minerally aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 702 cases made.

Name: Coteaux du Languedoc Pic St.-Loup Cupa Numismae
Note: Pure, intense red, with delicious red plum, berry, game and spice flavors on a muscular frame. Pepper and leathery notes linger appealingly on the finish. Almost Hermitage-like in its structure.  Drink now through 2006. 4,700 cases made.

Name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Niederhäuser Hermannshöhle
Note: A beautifully understated spätlese, with subtle power, density and length. The passion fruit, sweet corn, berry, fennel and mineral notes are layered and just keep coming at you. Superbly balanced, it seems effortless and ethereal. The finish just melts away. Best from 2005 through 2020. 250 cases made.

Name: Syrah Edna Valley Reva
Note: Deep purple, with loads of ripe plum, black cherry and blackberry flavors, scents of violets, dark fruits, new leather, currants and minerals. A real mouthful that manages to show elegance and a measure of finesse. Long, gushing aftertaste. Drink now through 2012. 850 cases made.

Name: Douro Chryseia
Note: Essence of blackberry, dark cherry and smoke make this an alluring and distinctive red. Intense concentration and a firm structure provide loads of power. Dark chocolate notes dominate the finish. Still quite youthful, but should develop nicely in the years ahead. Best from 2004 through 2008. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Winemaker's Reserve
Note: A rich, flamboyant style, from its wonderful aromatics to its opulent display of fruit and oak flavors. The mix of fleshy pear, fig and smoky oak combine to open all kinds of flavor doors. Finishes with mineral and lemon-citrus scents. Drink now through 2006. 1,958 cases made.

Name: Coteaux du Languedoc La Méjanelle Cuvée Sommelière
Note: Full-bore, decadent red, with dark plum and blackberry flavors. Bacon fat notes mixed in. Rich, deep and lush, with dark chocolate and espresso notes on the finish. Powerful. Drink now through 2005. 6,000 cases made.

Name: Barbaresco Basarin
Note: Incredibly rich, with masses of ripe fruit on the nose, from plum to blackberry, showing smoky oak undertones. Full-bodied, with layers of silky, ripe tannins and a long, fruity, almost jammy finish. A real triumph. Moccagatta is a leader in Barbaresco right now, and this is one of the greatest wines ever from this producer. Best after 2010. 550 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Edna Valley West Slope Edna Ranch
Note: Remarkably complex and elegant, with a delicious range of flavors built around vibrant pear, nectarine, honeysuckle, creamy fig and light toasty-hazelnut scented oak. Turns sleek and vibrant, with a wonderful aftertaste of complex flavors. Drink now through 2005. 4,362 cases made.

Name: Barbaresco Vigneto Brich Ronchi
Note: Very attractive aromas of ripe plum, berry and grilled meat. Full-bodied, with lovely fruit and big, silky tannins. The finish is fantastic, with very ripe fruit, yet refined and caressing in texture. Best after 2008. 2,080 cases made.

Name: Barolo Pajana
Note: Layers and layers of fruit. Intense aromas of blackberry, tobacco, mineral and dried mushroom. Full-bodied, with big velvety tannins and rich and wonderful fruit. Long, long finish. Goes on and on. I like it better than the outstanding 1998. Clerico is a master again. Best after 2010. 550 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel San Francisco Bay Carla's Vineyards
Note: Dark and chocolaty, with zesty wild berry and blackberry fruit and lots of spice and espresso scents. The long, rich, concentrated aftertaste showcases the exotic fruit flavors. Drink now through 2008. 2,100 cases made.

Name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Appellation Series
Note: Rich and plump, a flood of fruit, with powerful blackberry, plum and a wee touch of peppermint, all echoing through the long finish. A serious McLaren Vale Shiraz, built to last. Drink now through 2012. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr
Note: Gorgeous balance and grace in this peach- and mineral-flavored Riesling. Great clarity and delicacy defy the amount of flavors deftly positioned on its lightweght frame. Plenty of snap and a chalky texture on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Toro Termes
Note: Blackberry fruit claims center stage in this powerful red, where it mingles with tobacco and coffee notes and plenty of smoky oak. Massive tannins give structure, but the fruit reemerges on the finish.  Best after 2004. 1,000 cases imported.

Name: Muscadet de Sèvre et Maine Sur Lie Château de Chasseloir
Note: This Muscadet offers rare explosiveness, with concentrated lemon peel, grapefruit, honeysuckle, mineral and briny notes. The racy acidity carries it along effortlessly, while a second wave of fruit emerges on the finish. Hard for Muscadet to be better than this. Drink now through 2004. 15,000 cases made.

Name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Icon Series
Note: Brisk, floral style brims with pear, grapefruit and passion fruit aromas and flavors, which linger effortlessly on the vibrant finish. Drink now. 14,000 cases made.

Name: Chianti Rufina Montesodi
Note: A beauty. Dark, with beautiful aromas of blackberry, mineral and spice. Full-bodied, with a solid core of fruit and tannins and a long, long finish. Pure Sangiovese. Best after 2006. 5,800 cases made.

Name: Merlot Peumo Marqués de Casa Concha
Note: Smoky and ripe, with black currant and plum fruit, hints of herbs, cocoa and toast, and fleshy, mouthfilling finish. Feels like it has the stuffing to cellar a bit too. This label is really strong these days. Drink now through 2005. 20,000 cases made.

Name: Brunello di Montalcino Ugolaia
Note: Fabulous bottle. Very, very classy aromas of freshly cut flowers, crushed berries, with hints of cedar. Full-bodied, yet extremely reserved, with fine tannins and impressive fruit. However, it's all in balance. It goes on and on. Best after 2005. 833 cases made.

Name: Bandol
Note: Rich, bacony aromas and flavors mix with alluring dark plum and red cherry flavors in this broad-tasting, full-bodied red. Intense blood, iron and mineral notes linger with spicy elements on the powerful finish.  Drink now through 2007. 1,500 cases imported.

Name: Sauvignon Blanc Groenekloof
Note: Really fine Sauvignon here--juicy and vibrant, with lemon, chive, chalk, nettle and mineral notes, and a long, lively finish. Strong grassy edge to the finish adds dimension. Drink now through 2004. 11,000 cases made.

Name: Riesling QbA Pfalz Bird Label
Note: Brilliance and clarity highlight this Riesling, whose peach, grapefruit and spice notes are brought into focus against the vivid structure. Subtle, lingering finish. Drink now through 2006. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Mudgee Hill of Gold
Note: Brighter, livelier and juicier than most Australian Shiraz, a vibrant wine with crisp blackberry, plum and vaguely leafy-herbal flavors that persist beautifully on the harmonious finish. Drink now through 2010. 23,000 cases made.

Name: Shiraz McLaren Vale The Footbolt Old Vine
Note: Bright and jazzy, with delicious blackberry and cherry and subtle touches of anise and pepper weaving through the lively, long finish. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases imported.

Name: Mencía Bierzo
Note: This dark red impresses with its solid structure and good balance. The flavors are muted now, but the concentration is evident, and a core of wild plum and toast notes will open with time. Best from 2004 through 2009. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Carmignano Villa di Capezzana
Note: This excellent wine is a relatively good value for the quality. Intense aromas of berry, spice and pepper follow through to a full-bodied palate, with silky tannins and a rich finish. Best after 2004. 5,800 cases made.

Name: Brut Champagne Special Cuvée
Note: A beautiful Champagne. Complex and elegant, evoking ginger, jasmine, citrus and honey aromas and flavors, accented by a biscuit and grain component coming as much from barrel fermentation as yeast aging. Very firmly structured and long. Enjoy with Asian foods or Parmesan cheese. Drink now through 2006. 9,500 cases imported.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Alpha Apalta Vineyard
Note: Lovely fruit here--cassis, red currant and blackberry--with supple texture. Yet there's serious grip, with mineral, cocoa and toast notes as well, all framed by firm yet well-integrated tannins. This should develop nicely. Drink now through 2006. 20,150 cases made.

Name: Malbec Mendoza Viña Hormigas Reserva
Note: Serious juice here, with deep, vivid purple color, loads of plum, boysenberry and blackberry fruit, extra layers of meat, mineral and toast, and a terrific velvety texture despite the dense, muscular tannins. Drink now through 2007. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley
Note: Smooth, rich and concentrated, with a tasty core of plum, blackberry and wild berry shaded by toasty, smoky oak. It all comes together on the finish, where it turns complex and plush. Drink now through 2007. 9,213 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Sonoma-Monterey Counties Overlook
Note: Loads of rich flavors yet with a sense of elegance and finesse, with layers of ripe, spicy, apple, pear and buttery notes, finishing with lively, well-integrated acidity and a burst of flavor on the aftertaste. Drink now through 2005. 18,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Santa Rita Hills Botella
Note: Dark, firm, rich and intense, with lots of concentration to the black cherry, blackberry, fresh earth and blueberry jam flavors. Well-focused, with mouthcoating, integrated tannins and a long, pure, rich aftertaste. Drink now through 2008. 536 cases made.

Name: Priorat Solanes
Note: A luscious, velvety texture carries plum, toast, spice and licorice flavors in this generous red. Tannins are big, ripe and round, the finish sweet and spicy. Drink now through 2012. 4,700 cases made.

Name: Alluvium Red Knights Valley
Note: Dark, rich and polished, with complex, concentrated currant, tobacco, olive, bell pepper and blackberry flavors. Finishes with a flash of spicy, toasty oak and ripe, integrated tannins. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Best from 2004 through 2011. 9,000 cases made.

Name: Toro El Albar Excelencia
Note: A beauty, in the international style. Dark color, lavish oak, ripe fruit and muscular structure mark this red. Flavors range from cassis to chocolate to mineral. Balanced and deep.  Best from 2005 through 2010. 1,500 cases made.

Name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal
Note: A floral white, delicate and graceful, this combines apple, citrus and mineral flavors with a slim yet medium-bodied frame. Its silky texture and seamlessness reveal its pedigree. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Seven Hills Vineyard
Note: A racy, wild, generous Syrah, juicy with lively acidity balancing the raucous blackberry, plum and a whiff of mineral and gamy character that wafts through the long, aromatic finish. Tannins are subdued, and it all holds together nicely. Drink now through 2010. 960 cases made.

Name: Ribera del Duero
Note: Beautifully polished, complex but balanced, this impressive red shows ripe fruit, judicious oak and a vibrant sense of place. Not overly muscular, but finely proportioned and deeply flavored. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases imported.

Name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Turckheim Herrenweg
Note: Lovely richness, fleshing out the honey, litchi and grapefruit peel notes. It gets good support from a moderately firm structure, with a touch of bitterness shoring up the long finish. Best from 2004 through 2008. 1,600 cases made.

Name: Riesling Alsace Les Pierrets
Note: Etched in stone. Dry and tightly wound, this conjures up a limestone cliff after a thunderstorm. Quince and peach also mingle in its rocky depths. Firm and concentrated, this is for rock hounds. Best from 2005 through 2012. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Syrah California Roll Ranch Vineyard
Note: Simply delicious, overflowing with flavor. Inky dark, ripe, rich and plush, with a load of jammy plum, blackberry, wild berry and spicy aromatics. Finishes with a long, complex aftertaste and a gush of fruit. Tannins are well-integrated. Drink now through 2010. 600 cases made.

Name: Barbaresco Vigneto Marcarini
Note: A big wine, with fascinating aromas of black licorice, berry and toasted oak. Full-bodied, with loads of ripe fruit and velvety, fruit-coated tannins. Long finish. Easily the best wine from this producer this year due to the richness and balance. Best after 2008. 1,500 cases made.

Name: Syrah Mount Veeder
Note: Tightly wound and firmly concentrated, it opens up to unveil a wealth of rich, exotic spices, with beefy bay leaf, earth and mineral scents to a dense, chewy core of beefy currant, blackberry and new leather, finishing with espresso, mocha and vanilla flavors that make it quite enticing. It should only get better in the next year. Best from 2005 through 2012. 430 cases made.

Name: Chassagne-Montrachet Morgeot Vieilles Vignes
Note: Fat and rich, with a botrytislike dried apricot, dried peach, fig and honey character. Has the opulence of a grand cru. Silky. Full-bodied and harmonious, but not as long as it could be on the finish.  Drink now through 2010. 700 cases made.

Name: Clos Apalta Colchagua Valley
Note: Stunning purity, with concentrated plum, boysenberry and raspberry fruit that just glides across the palate, buttressed by superfine yet muscular tannins. Suave toast, coconut butter and spice notes along with alluring chocolate and black tea hints chime in on the long finish. A superb combination of fruit and elegance. Drink now through 2009. 4,885 cases made.

Name: Toscana Masseto
Note: Wonderful aromas of blackberries, raspberries and fresh tobacco, with a hint of exotic fruit. Full-bodied, with loads of velvety tannins and a long, long finish. Very silky indeed. A gorgeous, seductive, classy red. A monument to Tuscany. Layers and layers of fruit and tannins. Perhaps the greatest Tuscan red ever. Best after 2012. 2,670 cases made.

Name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Reserve
Note: Dark, deep and powerful, an explosive wine, positively vibrating with ultraripe raspberry, blackberry, licorice, sweet peppers and spices, all balanced with juicy acidity and finishing with remarkable harmony and tremendous length. A real knockout. Best after 2006. 800 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Sonoma County Sonoma
Note: Wonderful balance and sense of elegance, it offers vivid ripe fruit flavors that are rich and complex, with spicy black cherry, blackberry, pomegranate, herb and sage notes that add flavor dimensions and complexity. Firm, but ripe tannins add structure, allowing the fruit to push through. Drink now through 2009. 48,000 cases made.

Name: Alec's Blend Napa Valley
Note: A stunning effort. Wonderful fragrant aromas of violets, vanilla bean, espresso and tiers of black cherry and blackberry fruit. This is an unusually fruity and complex wine that is quite reliant on oak for some of its flavors, but also a wealth of rich, concentrated dark berry flavors, finishing with a long, luxurious finish. Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases made.
