Name: Chardonnay Rutherford
Note: Brilliant yellow-gold color, superrich and multifaceted, with layers of rich, creamy fig, citrus, pear and honeysuckle. This deliciously full-blown wine is deeply concentrated, finishing with a long, persistent aftertaste, picking up a cedar, smoke and toasty oak nuance that adds another dimension. Drink now through 2009. 960 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley
Note: You won't find many Chardonnays in this class. Ultrarich and multidimensional, with a fabulous array of creamy flavors built around a core of fig, apricot, crème brûlée and roasted marshmallows. Full-bodied, yet elegant and concentrated, it weaves the tapestry of flavors to a long, rich, graceful finish. Drink now through 2009. 2,016 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley The Beaux Frères Vineyard
Note: Big and ripe, a mouthwatering wine with tingly acidity bringing harmony to a wash of plum, blackberry, cherry and dusky spice flavors, which persist on the fine-grained, not terribly tannic finish. Drink now through 2012. 2,599 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Puente Alto Don Melchor
Note: Terrific personality, with prune, cocoa, loam, mineral, dark currant, blackberry, tar and sanguine flavors that don't quit. Well-structured, with fine balance and harmony already and a very long finish. Best from 2005 through 2010. 15,200 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Victoria
Note: Bright, juicy and lively with blackberry, huckleberry, white pepper and a refined floral character that melds beautifully through the finish, and the tremendous aftertaste just doesn't quit. A stylish Shiraz that should keep giving for years. Best from 2006 through 2015. 5,000 cases imported.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Reserve
Note: Ripe, polished, opulent style teems with spicy black cherry, raspberry, black olive, bay leaf and sweet spice flavors, which echo against the superfine tannins on the long, generous finish. Drink now through 2013. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley
Note: Ripe, beautifully focused and generous, a delicious mouthful of blackberry, cherry, blueberry, plum and exotic spice flavors that just don't quit, hinting at smoke and meat on the lithe, elegant finish. Impressive for its balance of power and grace. Drink now through 2012. 1,360 cases made.

Name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley Eisele Vineyard
Note: An exceptional bottling that offers a veritable explosion of hay, lemon blossom, grass, melon and nectarine notes. Tangy acidity, supple cream tones, anise and mineral nuances weave through a finish of superior depth and dimension. Doesn't get much better than this. Drink now through 2006. 1,300 cases made.

Name: Pouilly-Fumé La Porte de L'Abbaye
Note: This offers layers of streamlined flint, lime, lemon curd, smoke, green almond and dried herbs, all running through a long finish that never breaks stride. Drink now through 2008. 12,500 cases made.

Name: Syrah Viño de Mesa de Toledo Dominio de Valdepusa
Note: Powerful aromas of anise, game and tar may be too strong for some, but they morph into ripe blackberry, cassis, espresso, black pepper, licorice and mineral flavors on the palate. The texture is plush, the tannins massive but well-integrated, and the fruit sails on the finish. Ambitious red in the full-blown international style. Drink now through 2010. 4,000 cases made.

Name: The Struie Barossa Valley
Note: Ripe, round and decadent, plush in texture, oozing with tarry, chocolaty plum and black cherry flavors that linger beautifully. Picks up all kinds of spicy notes as the finish goes on and on. Should only get deeper with age. Drink now through 2020. 2,500 cases made.

Name: Barolo Bricco Fiasco
Note: The nose of this wine evokes crushed Nebbiolo, with hints of fresh flowers and Indian spices. Full-bodied, with incredibly round, soft tannins. Long, velvety finish. Voluptuous. Azelia has come into its own. Serve this to the nonbelievers. Best after 2008. 1,040 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Paso Robles Richard Sauret Vineyard
Note: Intense and rich in flavor, with smoky, toasty oak wrapped snugly around a core of plum and blackberry fruit, turning complex as they fold together on the finish, ending with a chocolate espresso bean aftertaste. Drink now through 2009. 2,858 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Sophia's Cuvee
Note: Appealing for its exuberant display of ripe, fleshy blackberry and wild berry fruit. It adds a pretty touch of floral and cedar nuances before revealing its depth, richness and concentration on a long, persistent, impressive finish that keeps the flavors lively and flowing. Drink now through 2012. 1,375 cases made.

Name: Montsant Castell de Falset
Note: Expressive aromas of black currants and coffee follow through on the muscular palate, amplified by anise, tobacco and mineral notes. When the tannins give way, the finish is clean and long. A full-throttle red that achieves power without ever losing control. Grenache, Cabernet Sauvignon, Carignane and Tempranillo. Best from 2006 through 2014. 1,500 cases imported.

Name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Angel's Share
Note: Not a huge mouthful, but it unfolds its flavors and builds up intensity as the blackberry, plum, cedar and floral pepper flavors persist onto the long, generous finish. Best from 2007 through 2015. 2,200 cases imported.

Name: Merlot Columbia Valley Grand Estates
Note: Ripe, plump and generous with its fresh cherry, dried cherry, dark plum and sweet spice flavors, nicely framed with toasty oak as the fruit persists impressively on the long finish. Drink now through 2009. 310,000 cases made.

Name: Malbec Mendoza Reserva
Note: Terrific core of blackberry, black fig and boysenberry fruit, with lush toast, cocoa powder and loam notes as well. Juicy and long, with a powerful finish. Jump on it. Drink now through 2008. 3,500 cases imported.

Name: Chianti Classico Cellole Riserva
Note: Phenomenal nose, with complex smoky, tarry, licoricelike red fruit aromas. Full-bodied, with added tobacco and vanilla coming through on the palate, with silky tannins and a long, minerally finish. One of the best Chianti Classicos I've ever tasted. Best after 2005. 2,500 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Otis Vineyard David Lake Signature Series
Note: Smooth and polished, an elegant red with depth of flavor that sneaks up on you. Currant, blackberry, smoky spice and dried tomato flavors compete for attention, building in intensity as the fine tannins subside on the long finish. Best from 2006 through 2015. 2,380 cases made.

Name: Goat-Roti Western Cape
Note: This just oozes fruit--blackberries, plums and currants--but has firm tannins to keep it from getting to gushy. Lots of tar, smoke and dark chocolate here too, with the fruit pumping through the finish. Shiraz with five percent Viognier. Drink now through 2005. 7,000 cases imported.

Name: Firehouse Red Columbia Valley
Note: Polished, focused and impressive for its pure currant and blackberry fruit, nicely shaded with hints of mineral and a whisper of red pepper. The flavors linger enticingly against fine, crisp tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2012. 4,312 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Santa Rita Hills Southing
Note: Ultraripe, rich and plush, with concentrated, detailed black cherry, wild berry and plummy flavors framed by firm toasty, cedary oak, and finishing with a long, intense, persistent aftertaste offering a wealth of flavors and plenty of rich minerally tannins. Drink now through 2009. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Riesling Alsace Les Princes Abbés
Note: This is lush and though it starts out off-dry, the racy structure emerges midpalate, driving the floral, peach and mineral flavors to a long, dry conclusion. It really sings on the finish today, with a long, smoky aftertaste. Drink now through 2010. 2,000 cases imported.

Name: Malbec Mendoza
Note: Rock solid, with thoroughly ripe blackberry and boysenberry fruit augmented by toast, spice, mineral and loam. Dense and plush, but vivid and defined through the finely stitched finish. Drink now through 2007. 33,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate
Note: Dramatically aromatic, brimming with black cherry, hinting at smoke and spices as the flavors play against firm tannins. Needs time to soften, and then fasten your seatbelt. Best from 2006 through 2012. 4,500 cases made.

Name: Three Cape Ladies Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
Note: Suave wine, with black and red currant fruit offset by tangy mineral and sanguine notes. Plenty of toast and spice as well, but it's all folded together in a rich, creamy package with a nice tar note on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinotage and Merlot. Drink now through 2006. 6,000 cases made.

Name: Madiran Château Montus
Note: Full-bodied, with loads of dark plum, blackberry, dark cherry and spice flavors. This is a finely sculpted red that packs plenty of punch as well. Espresso and dark chocolate notes linger on the finish. Tempting now. Best from 2005 through 2009. 20,950 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Barossa Gold Label
Note: Round, velvety and generous with its smoky blackberry and tar flavors, gently balanced with tangy acidity, but the emphasis is on the berry and spice flavors that linger on the finish. Not a typical Barossa Shiraz, but it's a honey. Drink now through 2010. 4,000 cases imported.

Name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Appellation Selection
Note: Impeccable balance, richness and complexity, with tiers of spicy pear, floral, honey, vanilla and toasty oak and a long, persistent finish that echoes hazelnut and spice. Drink now through 2009. 26,500 cases made.

Name: Rioja Cosme Palacio y Hermanos
Note: Expressive and alluring. This modern red shows a plush texture and ripe fruit flavors of blackberry and plum, with pretty oak accents and well-integrated tannins. It has depth, but remains graceful on the palate. Drink now through 2008. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon San Rafael-Argentina Famiglia
Note: The lush cassis and raspberry fruit is surrounded by cocoa, spice and toast notes. The fruit really pumps through the finish, offset by a mineral note that adds further dimension. Elegant and well put together. Drink now through 2008. 6,000 cases made.

Name: Syrah Chalone
Note: Delicious for its core of fleshy roasted plum, wild berry and black cherry, this wine holds its focus while picking up a nice touch of beefy, peppery flavors, only to return to its core of pure Syrah, ending with a nice lift in flavor and ripe, integrated tannins. Drink now through 2009. 2,310 cases made.

Name: Riesling Spätlese Rheingau Rüdesheimer Magdalenenkreuz
Note: A tantalizing mix of apricot, orange, rose and mineral meshed in a creamy texture, all backed by vibrant acidity. Concentrated and long, with a crispness at the end that will become integrated with time. Best from 2006 through 2015. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Priorat Cartoixa Reserva
Note: Alluring spice notes of cinnamon and clove add complexity to the ripe plum and sweet vanilla flavors in this rich red. It's balanced and expressive, not overly powerful, but brings you back for another sip. Grenache, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases imported.

Name: Chablis Grande Cuvée
Note: Very refined, with a lemony cast to this firmly structured, minerally white. It's concentrated, elegant and beautifully balanced. It requires time, however, to integrate all its components. Best from 2006 through 2012. 7,500 cases made.

Name: Mélange Columbia Valley
Note: Ripe and plump, generous with its spicy, mocha-scented cherry and blackberry flavors, persisting smoothly through the long, harmonious finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese, Merlot, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2010. 19,000 cases made.

Name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
Note: Plenty of soft and spicy character with hints of black pepper, even eucalyptus. Medium-bodied, with round and velvety tannins and a long finish. Very well done. Tuscan enologist Luca d'Attoma has turned this place around. Drink now through 2008. 11,600 cases made.

Name: Barolo Tortoniano
Note: Very fresh on the nose, with sliced plums and hints of blackberries. Full-bodied, with a solid core of ripe yet clean fruit and very silky tannins. Very polished. Best after 2007. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Paul Sauer Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
Note: Great character in this throwback wine, with a thicket of dark currant, blackberry, tar, beef, chestnut, mineral and sanguine flavors. Long finish is etched with bittersweet chocolate and another layer of really ripe blackberry fruit. Impressive. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2008. 3,080 cases made.

Name: Soave Classico
Note: Beautiful aromas of mineral, apple and light honey with just hints of lemon rind. Full-bodied, with lively fruit and a long, long finish. A beauty. Drink now. 13,000 cases made.

Name: Savennières Clos du Papillon
Note: Plump, with lots of fig and quince fruit; pretty hints of spice and minerals in the background while the fruit takes center stage. Nice dry, minerally finish keeps it honest and bodes well for cellaring. Drink now through 2015. 2,330 cases made.

Name: Sancerre Le Chêne
Note: Subtle note of honeysuckle and straw, but the palate explodes with mineral, citrus peel, chive flower, flint and gooseberry flavors. Then fresh, racy acidity supports a long, flinty finish. Ideal with Crottin de Chavignol. Drink now through 2006. 1,250 cases imported.

Name: Insolia-Chardonnay Sicilia Angimbé
Note: Fantastic white, with lively pineapple, honey and apricot aromas and flavors. Full-bodied, with bright acidity and a long finish. Excellent value. Drink now. 8,500 cases made.

Name: Falanghina Sannio
Note: Aromas of lemons and rhubarb turn to minerals, melons, and honey. Medium- to full-bodied, with lovely acidity and a long, ripe fruit aftertaste. Delicious. One of the best values in Italian white. Drink now. 70,000 cases made.

Name: Brut Sonoma County
Note: An exceptional value. Round and full-bodied, with rich, ripe apple, pear and honeydew melon flavors. This complex sparkler has a nice touch of yeast and doughy aromas that give it added character, turning creamy with a touch of vanilla. Drink now through 2009. 65,000 cases made.

Name: Moulin-à-Vent Domaine des Rosiers
Note: Great core of blackberry and currant fruit, with ample chocolate, spice and briar notes. This is structured like its colleagues, but manages to end on a lush, creamy note. Drink now through 2005. 9,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley-Carneros
Note: Intense and vibrant, with a firm tannic backbone to the core of earthy blackberry and wild berry fruit. Tightens on the finish, with a hint of clove and cedary oak, at times flexing its muscles yet also offering concentration and depth. Drink now through 2009. 20,400 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Rockpile Rockpile Road Vineyard
Note: Ripe, delicious and exuberant; rich with layers of wild berry, blackberry and raspberry shaded by light, toasty oak. Finishes with a fantastic burst of fruit and ripe, integrated tannins. Drink now through 2009. 4,973 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherford 20th Anniversary
Note: Another tremendous effort from this producer, supple and harmonious, with rich, fleshy blackberry, black cherry, plum and currant fruit that's tight and concentrated. A hint of mocha, herb and cedar add a wonderful dimension and the structure is excellent, with lively acidity and firm tannins. Best from 2006 through 2012. 2,500 cases made.

Name: Toro Campo Eliseo
Note: This elegant red shines in the international style, with toasty oak, polished texture and clean, ripe fruit. Blackberry, espresso and mineral notes mingle over well-integrated tannins and emerge haloed by spices on the toasty finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,250 cases made.

Name: Syrah Cortona Il Bosco
Note: Powerful aromas of crushed black fruits, pepper and wet earth; just a hint of roasted meat. Full-bodied, chewy and rich, with a long, long finish. This is a fantastic Syrah. Like a great Hermitage. Best after 2008. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Maritime Vineyard
Note: A gorgeous wine, rich, smooth and seamless, with layers of complex creamy cherry, wild berry and plum shaded by mocha-laced oak that is neatly integrated. The tannins are ripe and supple, the aftertaste fascinating. Drink now through 2010. 545 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Barossa Shotfire Ridge
Note: Big, rich and concentrated, a huge mouthful of peppery black cherry, plum and exotic spice flavors pulling themselves together into a supple wine that actually strives for elegance. It's all in balance, which lets the rich flavors ride on a sleek track and linger beautifully. Best from 2008 through 2020. 12,000 cases made.

Name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Sixtine Réserve
Note: A superb core of blackberry, boysenberry and black currant fruit stands amidst cocoa, mineral, licorice and tar flavors. Densely structured but perfectly ripe, with a long finish that cascades with both fruit and terroir. Awesome for its power and balance. Best from 2007 through 2025. 1,800 cases made.

Name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Domaine Grand Veneur Les Origines
Note: Jaw-dropping raspberry ganache and plum fruit, along with cocoa, tar, hoisin sauce and mineral notes, are flamboyantly displayed, while an intense tarry, minerally drive extends the finish. Best from 2007 through 2025. 1,000 cases imported.

Name: Brunello di Montalcino Castelgiocondo Ripe al Convento Riserva
Note: Very structured. Superattractive aromas of plum, blueberry and pressed flowers follow through to a full-bodied palate, with firm, silky tannins and a long, caressing finish. Layers and layers of ripe fruit, with everything in beautiful proportions. Almost a replay of the 1997, which scored 98 points. Best after 2006. 2,200 cases made.

Name: Syrah Russian River Valley
Note: Classic Syrah aromas of beef carpaccio, pepper, wild berry, blackberry and plum. This remarkable wine is rich and concentrated, with a tight focus and an intense yet supple and integrated finish, where the flavor themes keep building on each other. Drink now through 2012. 866 cases made.

Name: Douro Reserva
Note: Seductive and refined, with a beautiful aroma of Asian spice, cassis and chocolate with flavors to match. Broad and lush, with plenty of structure and a caressing finish of cream, black truffle and mocha that goes on and on. Tempting now. Best from 2006 through 2010. 2,000 cases made.

Name: Maremma Toscana Ilatraia
Note: Gorgeous aromas of blackberries, raspberries and hints of tar follow through to a full-bodied palate with supersilky tannins and a long, long finish. Classy red from Maremma. Rich yet subtle. Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese and Petit Verdot. Best after 2008. 1,650 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Paso Robles Richard Sauret Vineyards
Note: A delicious young Zin, with layers of ripe, zesty blackberry, boysenberry and wild berry shaded by toasty oak. Plush, rich aftertaste. Drink now through 2009. 7,029 cases made.

Name: Finca Altamira Mendoza
Note: A stunning nose of blackberry and boysenberry confiture that never gets heady leads to a massively endowed palate of fruit, lavender flower, mineral, tar and graphite flavors. Superlong finish, with hints of dark chocolate, shows both power and elegance. An amazing display of fruit and balance thanks to terrific acidity. Drink now through 2015. 715 cases made.

Name: GSM South Australia
Note: Rich, dense and focused, a chewy mouthful of plum, blueberry and dusky spice flavors, with meaty texture and flavors that mingle with the fruit on the long, generous finish. Grenache, Shiraz and Mourvèdre. Best from 2007 through 2015. 4,000 cases imported.

Name: Walter Clore Private Reserve Columbia Valley
Note: Polished, lithe and seductive, its ripe currant and blueberry fruit shaded nicely with peppery, creamy oak notes that still let the fruit persist beautifully through the long, silky finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2012. 5,250 cases made.

Name: Relentless Napa Valley
Note: A tremendous wine from the start, with captivating aromas of rich currant, beef, blackberry and wild berry. Tightly focused and impeccably balanced, this offers wonderful complexity and depth with a long, rich, intense finish. Syrah and Petite Sirah. Drink now through 2010. 2,500 cases made.

Name: The Prisoner Napa Valley
Note: Dark, immense and packed with zesty wild berry, spice, floral and currant flavors that are sharply focused and well-defined. The long, persistent aftertaste offers a hint of chocolate and vanilla. Zinfandel, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Charbono and Petite Sirah. Drink now through 2009. 4,500 cases made.

Name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Paretai
Note: Packs an enormous amount of zingy, lively character into a beautifully focused, racy frame, offering lime, mineral, passion fruit and a crunch of celery, all mingling with zesty grapefruit as the finish lingers. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

Name: Jumilla Altos de Luzón
Note: Ripe and luscious. This rich red is bursting with fruit, with flavors of cherry, boysenberry and currant, supported by well-integrated toasty oak, balanced acidity and ripe tannins. Accents of coffee, mineral and briar add allure, and mingle with the fruit on the long finish. Monastrell (Mourvèdre), Cabernet Sauvignon and Tempranillo. Drink now through 2010. 1,500 cases made.

Name: Riesling Clare Valley Polish Hill River
Note: This lively, distinctive Riesling has grapefruit, nectarine and mineral flavors that persist into a juicy, generous, dry finish. A stylish wine with amazing intensity and deftness. Drink now through 2012. 2,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Migration
Note: Notably rich and plush, dark red cherry in color, with a mix of ripe plum, cherry and wild berry fruit flavors that are evenly distributed. It gains complexity and reveals its concentration on a long finish. Shows a dash of heat, but also fine acidity and tannins. Drink now through 2008. 3,061 cases made.

Name: Douro Prazo
Note: Rich and concentrated, with layers of mouthfilling red and black fruit flavors. Full-bodied, with blackberry, dark chocolate and licorice elements all in balance. Pure, minerally finish, with plenty of grip. Tempting now. Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca, Tinta Barroca and Touriga Nacional. Best from 2007 through 2010. 2,000 cases imported.

Name: Syrah Minervois La Livinière La Touge
Note: Very meaty and decadent, this has ripe, full-bodied flavors of cassis, dark plum, chocolate and spice. Reminiscent of a Northern Rhône with its powerful, intense style. Pepper and beef carpaccio on the long finish. Tempting now, but should improve with some cellaring. Best from 2006 through 2010. 4,200 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Limestone Coast
Note: Bright, lively and generous with its distinctively blueberry, plum and smoky aromas and flavors. Lingers with unexpected elegance and hints of sweet spice on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 45,000 cases imported.

Name: Chablis Mont de Milieu
Note: Compact, yet dense and powerful, exhibiting honey, mineral and lemon aromas and flavors, all balanced with a vibrant structure and supple texture. Fine length, but needs time. Should age well over the next decade. Best from 2007 through 2015. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Syrah Colchagua Valley Alpha Apalta Vineyard
Note: Suave, stylish wine, with aromatic black cherry, blackberry, vanilla, violet and mineral notes. Shows darkly roasted coffee bean and tar notes on the finish, but relies more on guile and finesse overall. Drink now through 2007. 18,000 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Landslide
Note: A delicious Cabernet at a terrific price. Smooth, rich and juicy, with tiers of lively black cherry, wild berry and blackberry fruit that are deeply concentrated with a supple, elegant mouthfeel. On the finish the tannins show some grip and a nice dusty, cedary oak quality adds a note of complexity. Best from 2005 through 2011. 7,175 cases made.

Name: Malbec Mendoza Alta
Note: Deftly toasted, with vanilla and mocha suavely intertwined with lush plum, blackberry and boysenberry fruit. Long, plush and smoky through the finish, with the fruit taking an encore. A beauty. Drink now through 2008. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Saumur-Champigny Domaine des Roches Neuves
Note: This wine has a beam of pure, lush blackberry and boysenberry fruit, along with suave toast, cocoa, mineral and tobacco notes. Concentrated, but lush and sweet through the finish, this drips with both terroir and fruit. Drink now through 2008. 6,500 cases made.

Name: Goats do Roam In Villages Red Coastal Region
Note: Solid, modern-style wine here, with dark, racy blackberry and boysenberry fruit, ample toast and cocoa notes, and a long, plush, fruit-filled finish. Solid acidity keeps it all honest too. Delicious. Shiraz and Pinotage. Drink now through 2006. 12,000 cases made.

Name: Malbec Mendoza Grande Reserve Terroir Selection
Note: Structured Malbec, with lots of graphite and loam layered within the blackberry and black currant fruit. Thick, but ripe, with chocolate and espresso notes framing the finish. Nice mineral hint too. Best from 2006 through 2010. 1,500 cases imported.

Name: Pinot Bianco Alto Adige Classico Terlaner
Note: Really wonderful, with ultraclean and focused aromas of mineral, chalk, and apple. Full-bodied yet balanced, with good acidity and a long, creamy finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

Name: Colli Orientali del Friuli Terre Alte
Note: This shows lots of character but it's reserved and refined. Aromas of toasted oak, apple and peaches. Full-bodied, with white pepper and apple flavors. Long and lively. A fantastic blend—this is now one of the best whites in Italy. Tocai, Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Bianco. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

Name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Les Sinards
Note: Juicy, modern style, with mocha, blackberry, fig and boysenberry flavors mingling with tar and mineral notes. Firm finish has plenty of pure fruit for balance, and this gains steam in the glass too. Drink now through 2013. 6,700 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
Note: Lithe and lively. A lovely mouthful of richly textured currant, blackberry and plum flavors that persist into a gorgeously balanced finish. Has enough style and steel to make it last and develop in the bottle. Drink now through 2012. 2,100 cases imported.

Name: Chianti Rufina Castello di Nipozzano Riserva
Note: Very pretty aromas of licorice, berry and lightly toasted oak. Full-bodied, with layers of fruit and silky tannins. Long finish. Serious wine. Serious value. Best after 2005. 72,800 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia
Note: Soft, supple, ripe and generous with its currant, cherry and wild berry aromas and flavors, lingering nicely on the spicy finish. Immensely appealing stuff. Drink now through 2010. 6,000 cases imported.

Name: Ribera del Duero Hacienda Monasterio Crianza
Note: Elegant and polished, with blackberry and black cherry flavors accented by toasty, vanilla-scented oak and backed by focused tannins. Graceful through the long, floral finish. Drink now through 2009. 15,000 cases made.

Name: Coteaux du Languedoc Pic St.-Loup Vieilles Vignes
Note: Lovely aromas of violet, dark cherry and spice, with flavors to match. Ripe and full-bodied, wth plenty of character and power. Smoke and cocoa notes with mineral shadings fill the finish.  Drink now through 2007. 5,500 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Victoria Billi Billi
Note: Ripe, generous and distinctly peppery around a generous core of ripe plum, cherry and spice flavors, the black pepper character weaving enticingly through the finish. Yummy stuff. Drink now through 2015. 2,000 cases imported.

Name: Toscana Lucente
Note: Big, rich aromas of crushed blackberries, licorice and minerals with just a hint of lemongrass. Full-bodied with thick, luscious tannins and a long, smoky tar and berry finish. A full-throttle wine. This is really excellent for the money. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2009. 11,300 cases made.

Name: Albariño Rias Baixas Lagar de Cervera
Note: This full-bodied white is rich with almond, pear, butter and herb flavors. It's not overtly fruity, but shows complexity, with a firm backbone of acidity for balance. Drink now. 29,000 cases made.

Name: Cahors
Note: Quite polished and filled with layers of concentrated flavors of blackberry, dark plum, boysenberry, black olive and cassis. Well-integrated tannins, though they need time to settle. Finishes with notes of chocolate-covered strawberry. Best from 2006 through 2010. 9,410 cases made.

Name: Nero d'Avola Sicilia Una Rosa
Note: Dark, full-bodied and chewy, with meaty blackberry and mineral character. Medium- to full-bodied, with good, solid tannins and a long finish. Well done. Best after 2005. 1,500 cases made.

Name: Vacqueyras Les Christins
Note: A gorgeous nose of dark fruit confiture and spice cake flavors is followed by a powerful palate of dark fruit, smoke, tar and minerals. Richly layered and densely structured, but with an elegant side as well. Best from 2006 through 2009. 4,165 cases made.

Name: Touriga Nacional Alentejo
Note: Decadent and powerful, with a meaty, gamy aroma backed by deep plum and dark cherry flavors. Mocha and roasted notes fill the long finish, with plenty of licorice. Reminiscent of a Châteauneuf. Drink now. 12,062 cases made.

Name: Gevrey-Chambertin Vieilles Vignes
Note: A pure, elegant Gevrey. Medium-bodied and bursting with fresh cherry, berry and earth notes. Concentrated, with a sense of refinement. Excellent length, with fine tannins. Best from 2007 through 2018. 400 cases imported.

Name: Toscana Il Blu
Note: The aromas leave me speechless, with freshly cut roses and lilacs that follow through to crushed blackberry and cherry undertones. Full-bodied but extremely balanced, with velvety yet caressing tannins and a finish that goes on for minutes. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2008. 4,100 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Shea Vineyard Estate
Note: Lithe, supple and expressive, offering layers and layers of white pepper-accented currant and cherry, with a mineral note that adds depth and distinction. Broad and open-textured, lasting beautifully on the finish against superfine tannins. Best from 2007 through 2016. 1,200 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Valley Floor
Note: For a wine that doesn't feel big or broad, this Shiraz has amazing depth of flavor and focus, delivering a seamless package of blueberry, currant, plum and vanilla-spice flavors that fan out over the palate. Has compelling purity and impressive persistence. Best from 2008 through 2016. 8,000 cases made.

Name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Boisrenard
Note: Loaded with rich, dark layers of black currant, blackberry, truffle, tar, mocha and bittersweet cocoa, this pumps out both fruit and terroir on the gripping finish. Immense in scale and depth, this is hard to lay off now, but should be even more impressive when it drops its muscle to show more elegance (that will take a while, though). Best from 2008 through 2030. 1,665 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Klopp Ranch Méthode à l'Ancienne
Note: A classy Pinot Noir that captures the essence of the grape in spades, with vivid, complex wild berry, raspberry, spice, anise and hazelnut shadings that are well-dispersed. Impeccable balance, lively acidity and tremendous fruit complexity. Drink now through 2011. 1,250 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Arcus Estate
Note: Dense and dramatic, with layers and layers of raspberry, red plum and red cherry flavors that form a tight ball and whoosh through the finish, hardly slowed by mouthcoating tannins. This has tremendous style and depth. Best from 2008 through 2015. 1,522 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Lauren
Note: A stunning wine, with amazing richness, depth, purity of flavor and concentration, with layers of ripe pear, crème brûlée, date, apricot and hazelnut flavors that glide along on a silky smooth texture, with a finish that keeps revealing extra flavor nuances. Drink now through 2011. 900 cases made.

Name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich
Note: The aroma is marked by matchstick now, but this is positively crunchy on the palate. The vibrant structure and clarity set the tone for its peach, citrus and mineral notes. It's refreshing and alive, with a mouthwatering finish. This needs time. Best from 2009 through 2030. 1,200 cases made.

Name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Paretai Estate Series
Note: Juicy, mouthwatering and vibrant with lemon, quince and mineral aromas and flavors, persisting impressively on the long, expressive finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases imported.

Name: Pouilly-Fumé
Note: Tight on the nose, but uncommonly rich, with a tightly wound core of lemon zest, white flowers, chalk and freshly baled hay. Long, riveting finish. Best from 2007 through 2011. 2,500 cases made.

Name: Grenache-Shiraz-Mourvèdre McLaren Vale Cadenzia
Note: A vivid red, rich and velvety, brimming with plum, blackberry and cherry flavors, wrapped in a veil of very fine tannins, weaving a dark chocolate note through the long, generous finish. Best from 2008 through 2015. 2,474 cases made.

Name: Tokaji Aszú 5 Puttonyos Red Label
Note: Alluring aromas of gingersnap cookies, apricot and orange marmalade. Sweet, yet deftly balanced by lively structure. Fine lingering finish, where the harmony really shows. Drink now through 2020. 13,000 cases made.

Name: Douro Reserva Old Vines
Note: A ripe, full-bodied red packed with dark fruity flavors as well as plenty of paprika. Powerful, with a dense core of spicy elements that follow through to the long, cream-filled finish. Drink now through 2012. 6,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Nuthouse
Note: Polished and rich in texture, a bit hot but expanding beautifully to show off its ripe cherry and blackberry and faint notes of earth and shiso that linger along with the fruit, wrapped in a light veil of toasty oak. Best from 2008 through 2013. 1,810 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Edna Valley Chamisal Vineyards
Note: Subtle earth and crushed raspberry and wild berry fruit is seductive, with savory herb, mushroom, bay leaf and exotic spice. This is a notably complex and concentrated wine, well-extracted and firm on the finish. Try one now; cellar one for later. Drink now through 2009. 2,144 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Emily's Cuvée
Note: Fragrant rose petal and crushed raspberry aromas turn elegant and stylish on the palate, with fresh, lively acidity and a sleek, rich aftertaste. Wonderful balance, finesse and delicacy. Finish sails on. Drink now through 2010. 1,595 cases made.

Name: Rioja Edición Limitada
Note: Powerful yet graceful, this rich, ripe red delivers blackberry and currant fruit framed by coffee and toasty oak notes. Though thick on the palate, it remains fresh and focused, and the finish is clean and sweet, with floral and mineral grace notes. Drink now through 2012. 1,500 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Canary Hill Vineyard
Note: Lush and velvety, but beautifully restrained, the better to let the plum, blackberry and minty cream flavors spill gently over the tongue. The flavors linger against ultrarefined tannins on the long, delicate finish. Drink now through 2014. 700 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Rosella's Vineyard
Note: Decadent forest floor, chocolate and dense boysenberry provide a captivating core of complex flavors in this tighly wound youngster. Firmly tannic, with subtle nuances of dark berry fruits that emerge on the finish, along with delicate toasty oak, giving an extra layer of complexity. Drink now through 2009. 750 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Garys' Vineyard
Note: Plush and concentrated, with layers of pure Pinot delight built around gorgeous plum, wild berry, blackberry and huckleberry fruit. Elegant and vibrant, it dances on the palate, finishing with fleshy, ripe fruit. Drink now through 2011. 628 cases made.

Name: Toscana Torrione
Note: Plenty of blackberry and currant bush aromas. Intense. Full-bodied and very chewy, with ripe tannins and a long, powerful finish. A structured Sangiovese. Like the 2001 or better. Best after 2008. 3,100 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Canoe Ridge Estate
Note: A fruit-centered wine, this sings with pear, grapefruit and peach aromas and flavors, perched enticingly on a lithe frame, with subdued oak notes lingering around the periphery. It's the texture, though, that makes it so attractive, polished and refined. Drink now through 2010. 9,000 cases made.

Name: Shiraz South Australia Reserve
Note: Thick, with a layer of black pepper over a mouthfilling gob of black cherry and licorice that cries out for grilled red meat. Drinkable now, better with some age. Best from 2008 through 2013. 61,000 cases imported.

Name: Cabernet-Merlot Limestone Coast
Note: Lively, juicy and graceful. A smooth red with currant and plum flavors wrapped harmoniously around the finish, with overtones of toast and cedar. Drink now through 2012. 90,000 cases imported.

Name: Pinot Bianco Alto Adige
Note: Ultrarich, with layers of opulent, tropical fruit and light mineral undertones. Full-bodied, with a long, long finish. Drink now. 12,500 cases made.

Name: Garnacha Campo de Borja Tres Picos
Note: Coffee and smoky flavors add complexity to the core of plum and raisin fruit in this muscular red, and pretty floral and spice flavors linger on the finish. A bit tannic now, but still expressive. Drink now through 2011. 5,000 cases imported.

Name: Shiraz McLaren Vale-Langhorne Creek-Padthaway The Boxer
Note: Dark and dense. A big wine, yet lively with nutmeg- and cinnamon-scented blackberry, cherry and licorice flavors, balanced against firm but well-integrated tannins. Needs some time to soften. Best from 2007 through 2014. 14,194 cases made.

Name: Douro Churchill Estates
Note: Very pure-tasting, with an impressive array of mineral and dark fruit flavors. Blackberry and raspberry dominate, with dark plum and boysenberry. Long, fresh finish, with touches of smoke. Drink now through 2012. 19,200 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Thea's Selection
Note: Rich and aromatic. Not heavy, but packed with huckleberry, plum and an array of sweet spices that keep sailing through the long, beautifully formed finish. A complete wine that has style and grace. Best from 2007 through 2012. 3,386 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Dry Creek Valley Home Ranch
Note: A bold, opulent style, uncharacteristically complex and distinctive for this appellation. Layers of rich fig, apricot, pear and melon are deep and perfumed, finishing with a long, detailed aftertaste that showcases the wine's depth of flavor while maintaining a graceful mouthfeel. Drink now. 1,300 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Coach House Block Rare Single Vineyard
Note: This ultrarich and decadent Shiraz comes from old vines in Greenock, a prime growing area in the Barossa. They make heady wines that don't weigh you down like some big Shiraz can. This one has zippy acidity to balance the generous layers of black cherry, boysenberry and black plum flavors, shaded with bittersweet chocolate and smoke notes as the finish becomes increasingly plush. Best from 2009 through 2020. 1,050 cases made.

Name: Côtes du Rhône Mon Coeur
Note: Dark coffee and game aromas herald this burly red, with dark plum, hoisin sauce, chestnut, tar and garrigue flavors that pump through the structured finish. A very big Côtes du Rhône. Best from 2007 through 2009. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Falanghina Irpinia
Note: Peaches and apples follow through to a full-bodied palate, with lemon, honey and fruit flavors. Long. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
Note: Lithe, supple and immensely appealing for its creamy texture and almond-scented pear and peach flavors. It all lingers beautifully, too. Drink now. 11,100 cases made.

Name: Riesling Kabinett Rheingau Johannisberg V
Note: Everything comes together here--the site, the grape, the grower--to create something special. Alluring aromas and flavors of pear, peach and a heady blossom essence mark this Riesling. It's balanced, seamless and very, very long on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
Note: A rich, round red, with lots of jammy berry and strawberry character. Full, round and caressing. Lots going on. Needs time. Best after 2007. 16,600 cases made.

Name: Clos de Tart
Note: Aromas of tar and smoke, with very pure, concentrated blackberry and spice notes underneath mark this exotic, seductive red. Silky and complex, it caresses the palate. It needs a little time to absorb the oak, but this is long and has great potential. Best from 2009 through 2030. 1,250 cases made.

Name: Shiraz-Viognier Victoria
Note: A wine of remarkable elegance, aromatic, with spicy, floral overtones to the pure berry and plum flavors, lingering with hints of black pepper and licorice against refreshing acidity on the finish. Best from 2007 through 2014. 1,745 cases imported.

Name: Alfa Crux Uco Valley
Note: A very flashy, modern-style wine, with layers of mocha and spice-infused toast leading the way for boysenberry, blackberry and fig fruit. Shows additional tar, mineral, graphite and even violet notes through the rich but racy finish. Tempranillo, Malbec and Merlot. Drink now through 2010. 3,300 cases made.

Name: Clos des Lambrays
Note: An opulent, exotic red. Packed with Asian spices, sweet blackberry and raspberry ganache notes, a swath of dense tannins and new oak for support. Vibrant, and sings now, but needs time to fulfill its potential. Great length. Best from 2009 through 2025. 400 cases imported.

Name: Montsant
Note: Pretty raspberry and strawberry flavors gain depth from floral, mineral and herbal accents in this plush, well-structured red. Balanced and deceptively powerful. Garnacha, Merlot, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2014. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Stellenbosch
Note: Exotic and thoroughly ripe, this offers a gorgeous display of blackberry, blueberry, fig and currant fruit backed by cocoa, graphite and mineral flavors. Powerful and rich but never heady, the pure fruit just sails on through the finish. Drink now through 2009. 212 cases made.

Name: Premières Côtes de Blaye Cuvée Viva
Note: Wow. Just as I remember it from barrel. This is really beautiful on the nose, with plum, blackberry and spice. Medium- to full-bodied, with a solid core of silky tannins and a medium-to-long finish. All in finesse. A real beauty. Delicious. In harmony. Best after 2007. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Malbec Mendoza Punto Final Reserva
Note: Offers lovely notes of freshly crushed blueberry and boysenberry fruit, along with integrated mocha, mineral and floral notes. Creamy mouthfeel and a long, fruit-stained finish. Drink now through 2008. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Calchaquí Valley
Note: Exotic aromas of fig and hoisin sauce give way to a rich, creamy-textured palate full of dark plum, blackberry, coffee and chocolate ganache. Has solid grip on the finish, with a loamy hint in the background. Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon and Tannat. Drink now through 2008. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Kamptaler Terrassen
Note: Rich and focused aromas and flavors of ripe apple, peach, gooseberry and ruby red grapefruit give this plenty of punch and power. Long finish of spice, pepper and vanilla. Built to age. Drink now through 2015. 2,500 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Adelaide Hills M3 Vineyard
Note: A seamless wine that has real presence and delivers plenty of personality. Lithe and refined, with lovely peach, orange and spice aromas and flavors. Harmonious, many-layered and very, very long. Drink now through 2014. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Martinborough Te Muna Road Vineyard
Note: Lithe and distinctive, with a definite minerality and a touch of loamy earth to the ripe cherry and currant flavors, lingering beautifully on the generous finish. Tannins are well-submerged and its sense of delicacy is welcome. Drink now through 2011. 1,500 cases made.

Name: Douro Altano Reserva
Note: An intense, powerful red, yet lush and juicy, with deliciously pure flavors of red plum, smoke and cherry. Silky tannins, with a long finish of cream and spice. Touriga Franca and Touriga Nacional. Drink now through 2012. 2,300 cases made.

Name: Montlouis Sur Loire Les Choisilles
Note: Very precise, with a beam of green almond, fig, pear tartine and green tea flavors that races to a long, perfumy finish. Concentrated but elegant, with impressive length. Singing today, but fine for cellaring as well. Drink now through 2011. 1,330 cases made.

Name: Syrah San Antonio EQ
Note: Offers lots of plum, fig and black currant fruit, along with briar, mineral and tar flavors. Bacony toast and racy acidity wraps it up into a powerful and focused presentation. Drink now through 2009. 800 cases made.

Name: St.-Joseph Les Granits
Note: Dark and beefy, with a note of game running through the black currant, coffee and tar flavors. This unwinds more on the finish, with a fine mineral thread running through currant and cocoa notes. Drink now through 2010. 650 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Santa Cruz Mountains Santa Cruz Mountain Estate
Note: Great balance, depth, elegance and finesse. Shows lots of spicy, toasty, smoky oak, but also plenty of rich, vibrant, smooth and concentrated pear, fig and melon flavors before returning to the toasty oak. Drink now through 2011. 2,000 cases made.

Name: Toscana Tignanello
Note: Offers aromas of blackberry, with hints of raisin and lots of spices. Full and velvety, with wonderful concentration and a long, rich finish. Very stylish and exciting. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Best after 2012. 26,665 cases made.

Name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Carnival of Love
Note: A stunning wine of immense depth and integrity. Seamless from start to finish, this starts off strong and keeps building through the long, powerful finish. The flavors center on blueberry, plum, meaty cherry, cedar and cream, with a hint of mint, and the tannins are so finely polished they gleam. Drink now through 2020. 4,738 cases made.

Name: Rioja Torre Muga
Note: Plush and harmonious, this red is alluring yet subtle, with intense flavors backed by an impressive structure. Look for black currant, cocoa, cigar box and mineral notes now, and expect further complexity as this evolves. Tempranillo, Mazuelo and Graciano. Drink now through 2020. 2,000 cases imported.

Name: Brunello di Montalcino Madonna del Piano Riserva
Note: Mind-blowing aromas of crushed berries, meat, blackberry and violet. Full-bodied, with layers of incredibly velvety tannins and a long, long finish. This is so complex and long, and the mouthfeel is spellbinding. Develops wonderfully in the glass, becoming more and more rich with air. One of the greatest Brunellos I have ever tasted. Best after 2012. 2,000 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Gamble Ranch Vineyard
Note: This big, rich, flamboyant Chardonnay delivers a wallop of flavor, with tiers of smoky, toasty oak, buttery pear and fig notes and hints of citrus and fresh earth. Yet for all its size and dimension, there's a measure of elegance. The finish sails on, revealing extra flavor nuances. An excellent combination of a great Chardonnay vineyard and a winemaker who knows the site. Drink now through 2010. 1,275 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Kanzler Vineyard
Note: The initial dusty berry and lead pencil shavings are far richer and fruitier on the palate, while still being very taut, backward, intense and concentrated, with potent wild berry and black cherry fruit that's deep and expansive. Needs time. Best from 2008 through 2014. 500 cases made.

Name: Entity Barossa Valley
Note: A beautiful evocation of plum and blackberry balanced against a veil of creamy oak--but only a veil. It's the fruit that distinguishes the long, expressive finish. Shiraz. Best from 2009 through 2017. 1,000 cases imported.

Name: Extended Tirage Willamette Valley
Note: A stunner. Still fresh after 10 years. Pear, apple and orange marmalade flavors weave through a delicate structure and a flavor profile with distinct toastiness. It's the freshness that makes this elegant sparkler special. Drink now. 775 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Signature
Note: A supple, graceful style that serves up a complex mix of cherry, currant, herb and plum-scented fruit, picking up a light toasty oak and mocha note midpalate and finishing with a long, lingering aftertaste and round tannins. Drink now through 2013. 6,200 cases made.

Name: Chardonnay Edna Valley Wolff Vineyard
Note: Ripe and intense, with rich, perfumed apple, pear and spice flavors that pick up a note of butterscotch from oak. Turns elegant and stylish on the finish, showing a hint of lemon and citrus. A great value. Drink now through 2010. 7,532 cases made.

Name: Condrieu DePoncins
Note: Broad and powerful, with layers of dried apricot, fig, quince and anise offset by peach pit and bitter almond. The concentrated finish is tightly wound and almost tannic in its intensity. This is a rare Condrieu that requires cellaring. Best from 2008 through 2013. 900 cases made.

Name: Fumé Blanc Sonoma County
Note: A textural delight, with fresh, vibrant white peach, melon and lemon-lime citrus flavors that are fragrant, fleshy and rich, with a whiff of fresh-cut grass and juicy acidity. The flavors echo on the long finish. Drink now. 26,270 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Mendocino
Note: An elegant style, with a complex array of raspberry, wild berry and strawberry fruit that's delicate and refreshing. Supple in texture, ending with a burst of berry and pepper flavors and ripe, fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2011. 2,193 cases made.

Name: Sauvignon Blanc Russian River Valley
Note: A brilliant effort. Elegant and graceful, with a broad range of flavors including quince, melon, fragrant Asian pear, citrus, tangerine and herb. Lithe and refreshing, the flavors echo on the long finish. Drink now through 2009. 2,500 cases made.

Name: Petite Sirah Paso Robles The Heretic
Note: Delightfully rich and deep, ripe and fleshy, with a complex mix of currant, wild berry and blackberry fruit that's sharply focused. For all its size and range of flavors, it's lively and vibrant. Drink now through 2011. 885 cases made.

Name: Riesling Federspiel Trocken Wachau Terrassen Domäne Wachau
Note: Racy and powerful, with plenty of green peach, lychee and citrus flavors. Vibrant mineral notes run throughout, with an ironclad finish of graphite and hints of pineapple. Drink now through 2014. 7,750 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Rutherford Edizione Pennino
Note: Rich and loamy, with savory wild berry and brambleberry fruit that's shaded by pretty toasty oak. Yet the fruit holds center stage, and its depth and concentration are apparent. A hint of pepper sneaks in on the finish. Drink now through 2011. 2,499 cases made.

Name: Valdeorras As Sortes Val do Bibei
Note: Distinctive and ambitious. Toasty, smoky aromas and flavors overlay pear and mineral notes in this muscular, austere white. Gives up an easy fruitiness for concentration and intensity, yet remains balanced and rooted in place. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases imported.

Name: Vouvray Demi-Sec Clos du Bourg
Note: Shows very flattering ginger and peach aromas, but tightens up quickly on the palate thanks to its nervy acidity, which keeps the quince, persimmon and marzipan notes in reserve. Superlong finish. Best from 2008 through 2018. 1,740 cases made.

Name: Riesling Clare Valley Southern Sisters Reserve
Note: Balances explosive apple, peach and mineral flavors on a razor's edge of lacy acidity, yet remains remarkably open in texture. Tempting already, but has miles to go. Drink now through 2016. 5,000 cases imported.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Medalla Real Special Reserve
Note: Densely packed, with fig, currant and blackberry flavors, all wrapped up with coffee, bittersweet cocoa powder and loam notes. Long, ripe, muscular finish lets the notes of dark fruit, earth and grilled sage linger. Drink now through 2011. 22,435 cases made.

Name: The Impostor California
Note: As exotic as it is potent, with deep blackberry liqueur, sandalwood and wild game aromas and rich, ripe cassis, blueberry and licorice flavors that power on toward the bold, spicy finish. Zinfandel, Mourvèdre, Petite Sirah and Syrah. Drink now through 2012. 1,143 cases made.

Name: Bandol La Migoua
Note: An intense, mineral-laden red, with concentrated layers of dark plum, raspberry, smoke and spice flavors. Chiseled and powerful, with fine-grained tannins and a luxurious cream- and cocoa-filled finish. Drink now through 2020. 288 cases imported.

Name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
Note: A real live-wire, with crackling gooseberry, lemon zest, sea salt and floral notes followed by a long, tangy finish. Superdelicious. Drink now. 2,750 cases made.

Name: Bolgheri Moreccio
Note: A perfumed red, with currant and Indian spices on the nose. Full-bodied, with firm tannins and a tight structure. Long and caressing. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2010. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Shiraz Barossa Shotfire
Note: Aims for refinement and achieves a supple balance of ripe plum and currant fruit against a range of sweet spices and fine tannins. Lingers gently and expressively. Production was split between cork and screw-cap closures. Tasted from cork. Drink now through 2016. 15,000 cases made.

Name: Syrah Edna Valley Alban Estate Reva
Note: Rich and beefy, with plush smoke, blueberry, blackberry and spicy, leathery scents. Fans out and gains depth and complexity, picking up exotic spice notes. Best from 2008 through 2014. 2,500 cases made.

Name: GSM McLaren Vale
Note: Bright, focused and impressively long and detailed. Offers blueberry, cream and subtle spice aromas and flavors on a frame that's fleshed out with fine tannins, which let the finish open up gracefully. Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Best from 2008 through 2013. 6,000 cases imported.

Name: Douro Meandro
Note: Powerful aromas and flavors of cassis, mint, dark chocolate and spice are accented by an impressive minerality. Medium-grained tannins and plenty of structure back up the almost Port-like essence of this muscular red. Shows exotic Asian spice notes on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,450 cases imported.

Name: Greco di Tufo Loggia della Serra
Note: Shows piecrust, apricot and apple, with hints of mineral. Very aromatic. Full-bodied, with lots of fruit and a long, flavorful finish. A bright, fruity white. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

Name: Brut Blanc de Noirs Napa-Mendocino-Sonoma Counties
Note: A rich, vibrant mouthful of a bubbly, with bold, complex aromas of cinnamon, yeasty vanilla, apple and cherry, with subtle spicy flavors that build to a fresh hint of minerality on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 8,000 cases made.

Name: Bierzo El Castro de Valtuille
Note: A juicy, balanced red, with alluring aromas of wild berry and wet stone that carry through on the palate. Has intensity, yet remains graceful, with spicy and floral accents to the lively fruit. Drink now through 2012. 25,000 cases made.

Name: Syrah Columbia Valley Ex Umbris
Note: Supple, generous and beautifully focused to display its cherry, blackberry and dusky spice flavors. Not a big, blatant red, but a wine that shows finesse and refinement without losing any of its ripe flavors. Drink now through 2015. 3,100 cases made.

Name: D2 Columbia Valley
Note: Ripe, firm and beautifully focused, a complex mouthful of currant, plum, cedar and autumn leaf flavors that glow enticingly through the long, long finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2012. 2,600 cases made.

Name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia The Reserve
Note: Bright, lively, harmonious and generous. A sleek mouthful of blueberry, currant and plum flavors, neatly packaged with hints of cream and spice as the finish sails on. Drink now through 2015. 50,000 cases made.

Name: Barbera Piemonte Briccotondo
Note: Very plummy and grapey on the nose, with hints of chocolate. Full-bodied, soft and succulent, with lots of flavor and a long, long finish. Delicious. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

Name: Extra Dry Prosecco di Conegliano-Valdobbiadene
Note: A delicate, well-balanced Prosecco, showing a good blend of baked apple, sour lemon and grapefruit, with a lightly creamy mineral texture on the palate. Medium froth, with some body and a pleasant lemon and mineral finish. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

Name: Riesling Federspiel Trocken Wachau Weissenkirchen Steinriegl
Note: Ripe, full-bodied and succulent, with loads of peach, cherry and berry flavors. Plenty of ripe apple and citrus. The flavors linger with mineral and smoke on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 2,083 cases made.

Name: Brut Champagne Blue Top
Note: Elegant and expressive, this delivers floral, pear and toffee flavors matched to a creamy texture. Beautifully integrated, this lingers nicely on the mineral finish. Drink now through 2010. 35,000 cases imported.

Name: Cornas Les Vieilles Vignes
Note: Really zesty, with lots of red currant and bramble notes bouncing ahead of dark olive and sage flavors. The structure is briary on the finish, with an encore of red fruit and mouthwatering acidity. Drink now through 2017. 1,415 cases made.

Name: Côtes du Roussillon
Note: Rich and intense, with a meaty aroma and layers of red plum, raspberry, dark cherry and dark chocolate flavors. There's also a pure, minerally spiciness, with an enveloping finish of clove, kirsch and mocha. Carignane, Syrah and Grenache. Drink now through 2015. 400 cases made.

Name: Columella Swartland
Note: Offers a stunning array of blue and black fruit--blackberry, boysenberry, blueberry and currant--that is pure, driven and refined, with licorice, sweet spice, vanilla, mineral and sanguine notes flittering throughout. Despite its concentration, this is remarkably elegant, with superb length and a seamless finish. Welcome to the majors, South Africa. Syrah and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2013. 670 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills Clos Pepe Vineyard
Note: Good intensity, richness and concentration, with excellent depth to the earthy, loamy wild berry and blueberry flavors, ending with firm, integrated tannins. Takes some time to open up, but once it does it's compelling. Drink now through 2011. 800 cases made.

Name: Viognier-Marsanne McLaren Vale The Hermit Crab
Note: Soft and charming. A beguiling mouthful of spicy pear and grapefruit flavors that linger with focus on the open-textured finish. Not as rich as pure Viognier, but better balanced. Drink now through 2010. 3,500 cases imported.

Name: Athiri Rhodes Rhodos
Note: Offers a ripe, spicy aroma, with lush flavors of Fuji apple, pear, hazelnut and custard. There are also some pineapple and tropical fruit flavors in the mix. The fresh, creamy finish echoes the spice. Drink now through 2011. 1,500 cases imported.

Name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Ürziger Würzgarten
Note: A beauty, with both intensity and cut. More unevolved than others, this offers grapefruit, peach and mineral flavors matched to a keen acidity. Good lingering finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases imported.

Name: Volnay En Chevret
Note: Very pure, elegant and harmonious, with violet, rose, blackberry and boysenberry flavors and a hint of spice. As silky as this is, the well-integrated tannins offer support. Drink now through 2020. 1,100 cases made.

Name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
Note: Superfresh and racy, with a great underlying minerality driving the chamomile, white peach and honeysuckle flavors, followed by a long, bright finish. Really delicious. Drink now through 2008. 7,265 cases made.

Name: Asirtiko-Athiri Santorini
Note: A very lush and complex white, with mouthfilling flavors of salted almond, ripe pear, peach and spice. The minerally finish features piecrust notes. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

Name: Valdeorras Viña Godeval
Note: Pear, pine and anise flavors are focused and clean in this firm white. Mineral-tinged acidity provides real backbone, with citrus and floral notes lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2011. 1,500 cases imported.

Name: Bierzo Pétalos
Note: Thick, fruity and sweet, this international-style red offers plenty of vanilla and toasty oak flavors, with blackberry, cola and licorice notes, supported by plush tannins. Drink now through 2011. 15,000 cases made.

Name: Chablis Domaine
Note: An apple-scented white, with melon, green plum and mineral flavors. Bright, with a lively structure and a very long finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases imported.

Name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Estate Selection
Note: Smooth, round and generous with its red berry-scented cherry and spice flavors, hinting at cinnamon and gravelly notes as the finish lingers effortlessly. Complex and seamless. Best from 2008 through 2015. 6,871 cases made.

Name: Barolo Vigneto La Villa
Note: What a beautiful nose, with flowers, licorice, ripe fruit and fresh leather. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a wonderful ripeness of fruit, yet this is balanced and structured. Very smooth. The best wine I have ever had from this producer. Best after 2012. 1,700 cases made.

Name: Ode To Lorraine Barossa
Note: Rich, focused and superbly concentrated to show off its intense, rosemary-accented black cherry, plum and blueberry flavors, riding smoothly on a dense, generous frame that feels plush and seductive, yet the flavors come through transparently. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Drink now through 2017. 400 cases imported.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard T6
Note: Powerful, dark, superrich and deeply concentrated. Massive yet elegant, offering a dense core of mocha-laced currant, blackberry, wild berry and toasty, cedary oak, with an intense, persistent finish. Best from 2009 through 2016. 250 cases made.

Name: Pritchard Hill Estate Vineyard Napa Valley
Note: Big, ripe and complex, but light on its feet. An elegant, spicy mix of rich currant, anise, toasty oak, espresso  and subtle herbal scents, all of which fold together nicely, ending with a long, persistent finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot and Malbec. Best from 2010 through 2016. 1,426 cases made.

Name: Champoux Vineyard Horse Heaven Hills
Note: Seamless and harmonious, with beautifully articulated, ripe black cherry, cassis and violet-tinged floral notes that mingle with hints of cedar and dark chocolate as the finish plays out against polished tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Best from 2009 through 2015. 1,185 cases made.

Name: Toscana
Note: Rich, almost decadent aromas of crushed berry, meat and mole. Turns floral. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a long, caressing finish. A beauty. Best after 2011. 7,900 cases made.

Name: Côtes de Francs
Note: Shows lovely black currant, floral and black licorice notes. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a tight bead of fruit and mineral throughout. Has a long finish. Best after 2009. 10,830 cases made.

Name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Edition Chremisa
Note: A ripe, full-bore style, with golden raisin, baked peach, cream and spice. Shows lots of tropical fruit notes as well, including mango and guava. The rich finish features nutmeg and crème fraîche. Drink now through 2015. 1,250 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma-Napa Counties Reserve
Note: Rich and complex, brimming with dense, opulent yet elegant layers of mocha, black cherry, blackberry and wild berry fruit that's pure, focused, deep and persistent, ending with mouthcoating flavors and ripe, fleshy tannins. Drink now through 2015. 1,291 cases made.

Name: Toro San Román
Note: Alluring plum, blackberry, cola and spice cake flavors are rich and balanced in this expressive Spanish red. There's plenty of structure, but it doesn't get in the way of the flavors, and the spicy, floral finish is long and fresh. Best after 2009. 6,100 cases made.

Name: Malbec Calchaquí Valley
Note: Very inviting, with crushed plum and boysenberry aromas that lead to a lush-textured palate of warm figs and currant paste backed by mouthwatering hints of mesquite, mineral and Turkish coffee. The long finish really holds your interest. Drink now through 2011. 14,250 cases made.

Name: Gigondas La Gille
Note: Dark and smoky, with alluring cocoa powder, mesquite and bacon fat notes leading the way for rich black currant, melted licorice and espresso. The long, smoldering finish shows a nice wild side. Impressive now, but better with some cellaring. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now through 2014. 3,000 cases made.

Name: Riesling Clare Valley Magnus
Note: Impressive for its harmony and seamless structure, offering a joyous mouthful of lemon curd, quince and lime on a steely frame. The flavors just don't quit. Drink now through 2015. 2,500 cases imported.

Name: Venezia-Giulia Vintage Tunina
Note: Really complex, with apple tart, apricot, lavender, hints of cream and toasty oak. Full-bodied, with loads of fruit and character. There's masses of spicy mineral and fruity character, yet this is refined and balanced. Gorgeous. Sauvignon, Chardonnay, Ribolla Gialla, Malvasia and Picolit. Drink now. 5,800 cases made.

Name: Estate Reserve Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
Note: Dark and exotic, with notes of fig paste, hoisin sauce, graphite and macerated plum, this stays driven and focused thanks to racy, fine-grained tannins. The lingering finish lets black tea and bittersweet cocoa chime in. A big step up for this wine. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. This wine is labeled as Trilogy outside the U.S. market. Drink now through 2011. 3,500 cases made.

Name: Aix Columbia Valley
Note: Ripe, focused and beguiling for the espresso and caramel notes that swirl through the dark plum and currant fruit, remaining focused and vibrant through the long finish. Time in the cellar should polish the tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Best from 2009 through 2015. 1,900 cases made.

Name: Nero d'Avola-Syrah Sicilia Santagostino Baglio Soria
Note: Shows focused aromas of boysenberry, blackberry and light vanilla. Full-bodied, with soft, round tannins and a long, flavorful finish. Beautiful and juicy. Drink now. 45,830 cases made.

Name: Cahors Croix du Mayne
Note: There's a rich, spicy aroma, and this is dripping with concentrated flavors of kirsch, dark plum and dark cherry. Shows plenty of dark chocolate and raspberry ganache on the tannic finish. Drink now through 2013. 12,000 cases made.

Name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Ürzig Würzgarten
Note: Peach and Golden Delicious apple notes combine with the slate edge in this sleek, well-defined kabinett. Brilliant and succulent, with a lime and mineral aftertaste. Drink now through 2022. 6,000 cases made.

Name: Viognier Eden Valley
Note: Lithe and appealing for its gorgeous apricot, pear and floral flavors, gliding smoothly over a silky frame and lingering effortlessly. Drink now through 2011. 1,600 cases imported.

Name: Riesling QbA Mosel
Note: Needs a little air to reveal its floral, apricot and slate aromas and flavors. Beautifully integrated, with a lingering, stony, savory finish. Drink now through 2018. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Dão Callabriga
Note: A ripe, rich and powerful red, with concentrated flavors of blackberry, dark plum, smoke and spice. The long finish has blueberry and dark chocolate. Drink now through 2012. 10,000 cases made.

Name: Marsannay
Note: Lean and solidly built, despite its ripe cherry notes up front. Tannins and acidity dominate now, but this has a stony character and length, with loads of mineral on the aftertaste. Best from 2010 through 2020. 8,000 cases made.

Name: Coteaux du Languedoc Les Ruffes
Note: This rich, refined red is very pure-tasting, showing mineral, smoke, dried cherry and sandalwood flavors, with powerful undercurrents of currant and French roast. The long finish echoes spice and roasted meat. Best from 2009 through 2014. 1,000 cases imported.

Name: Syrah Sonoma Coast Old Lakeville Road
Note: Ripe and grapey, with rich, elegant spice, pepper and juicy, dusty wild berry flavors that are sleek and focused, ending with a long, persistent finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,155 cases made.

Name: Vacqueyras Le Clos
Note: This Rhône red is dark and really packed, but also seamless, with a round, juicy texture carrying the fig sauce, black licorice, Turkish coffee and iron notes. The long finish is filled with blackberry and mineral. Best from 2009 through 2013. 2,500 cases made.

Name: Malbec La Consulta Reserva
Note: Rich and dark, but pure, with nice drive to the beam of raspberry, plum sauce and macerated black currant fruit. Creamy tannins and a long, well-integrated finish just sail through, with fine buried minerality. Drink now through 2014. 1,400 cases made.

Name: Zinfandel Howell Mountain
Note: Dense and powerful, yet wonderfully rich, supple and well-structured at the core. Offers aromas of blackberry, fresh loamy earth and smoky toast, with ripe yet focused wild berry, mocha-espresso and white pepper flavors. Drink now through 2012. 950 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Evenstad Reserve
Note: Lithe in texture, with a distinctive range of red cherry, black cherry, cinnamon and mocha flavors that ride smoothly over a graceful frame, lingering nicely on the clear, expressive finish. Drink now through 2015. 6,500 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherford
Note: Intense and concentrated, big and expressive, with layers of ripe currant, plum, sage, pencil lead and black cherry, all flowing rather seamlessly. Tightly focused, this is rich without being heavy, ending with a long, persistent finish. Drink now through 2014. 4,750 cases made.

Name: Pinot Grigio Collio
Note: A full-bodied style with lots of character, from peach tart to lemon seed to mineral. Crisp and lively. Drink now. 12,900 cases made.

Name: Rioja Crianza
Note: Plum, chocolate, tobacco and leaf flavors mingle in this round red. Shows good ripeness and concentration, but maintains a traditional style. A bit austere, but balanced. Drink now through 2012. 3,000 cases imported.

Name: Riesling Alsace
Note: A dry white that's well put together, with integrated acidity and a compact structure that mesh nicely. A pleasant orange blossom note accents flavors of quince and honey, while the lingering finish shows a hint of minerality. Drink now through 2020. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Uncut
Note: Polished to a gleam, this fleshy wine shows an expressive array of red cherry, raspberry, Santa Rosa plum and sweet spices, mingling effortlessly through the plush finish. For all that, it actually feels like there's some restraint along the way. Drink now through 2016. 4,000 cases made.

Name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Piesporter Goldtröpfchen
Note: This is unevolved, revealing hints of floral and black currant aromas and flavors, but also yeast and carbonic gas elements. Yet it's vibrant and juicy, with a lingering finish. Best from 2009 through 2022. 2,500 cases made.

Name: Coteaux du Languedoc Clos des Soutyères
Note: A muscular style, offering a concentrated, intense mix of crushed red fruit and bittersweet chocolate flavors, with big structure and big tannins. Mint, tannins and spice fill the long, intense finish. Tempting now. Best from 2009 through 2014. 1,000 cases made.

Name: Malbec Uco Valley
Note: Really goes for the gusto, with dark fig sauce, melted purple licorice, mocha, fruitcake and crushed boysenberry and blueberry fruit, all gliding along rich, velvety tannins. Long, mouthfilling finish. Drink now through 2012. 3,500 cases imported.

Name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Angels Share
Note: Big, bold and expressive, with some unexpected transparency to the black cherry, raspberry, red plum and Asian spice aromas and flavors, lingering on the open-textured finish. The aftertaste just keeps coming. Drink now through 2015. 6,300 cases made.

Name: Albariño Rias Baixas Legado del Conde
Note: A smoky gunflint note adds interest to this firm white. Ripe peach and light herbal flavors pick up floral and citrus zest notes on the finish. Shows balance, depth and verve. Drink now through 2009. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Chablis Montmains
Note: Shows classic Chablis character delivering plenty of mineral, seashore and lemon aromas and flavors, with a little melon and plum. Firm and steely, this is a bit severe now, but balanced. Should develop nicely. Best from 2010 through 2018. 600 cases imported.

Name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Sandgrube
Note: Intense, with concentrated flavors of ripe pear, baked apple, apricot and spice. The long finish features lemon curd, spice and meringue.  Drink now through 2015. 2,917 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Galilee Yarden
Note: Rich and refined, showing focused flavors of red plum, berry and spice, with appealing herbal overtones. Has excellent balance and structure, backed up by crisp acidity. Mineral and smoke notes fill the firm finish. Kosher. Drink now through 2012. 13,000 cases made.

Name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Schiefer
Note: Full-bodied, creamy and spicy, with ripe, rich flavors of peach, pear, apricot and grapefruit. There's plenty of acidity to back it up, with a long finish of white raspberry and custard. Drink now through 2015. 1,250 cases made.

Name: Toscana Il Borgo
Note: This is dark and rich, with loads of blackberry and currant aromas. Full-bodied and very ripe, with soft, velvety tannins. Rich and luscious. Goes on and on. One of the best Cabreos in a long time. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2011. 3,500 cases made.

Name: Douro Vertente
Note: The aroma is redolent of berry and cherry, with rich, lush flavors of plum, raspberry, cherry and spice, flanked by veins of mineral. The long finish is filled with mocha and cream. Drink now through 2014. 1,740 cases made.

Name: Vidal Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
Note: Intense aromas and flavors of beeswax, orange marmalade, vanilla and apricot. Concentrated, yet lithe and supple, with bright acidity and great harmony. Lovely finish and long marmalade aftertaste. Drink now through 2020. 3,200 cases made.

Name: Barolo Marcenasco
Note: This fabulous Nebbiolo displays aromas of very ripe strawberry and cappuccino. Full-bodied, with supervelvety tannins and incredible concentration. All the tannins are coated with gorgeous fruit. Best after 2013. 5,000 cases made.

Name: Toscana Tre
Note: There's wonderful intensity of fruit in this wine, with crushed raspberry and blackberry and hints of coffee and fresh flowers. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a long, soft-textured finish that shows loads of fruit. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2010. 25,000 cases made.

Name: Broken Stones Paso Robles
Note: Offers waves of ripe, exotic dark berry fruit, with wild berry, raspberry and blackberry jam notes that are full-bodied, rich and intense, pure and focused, ending with a long, complex, persistent finish. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2015. 800 cases made.

Name: Toscana Fontalloro
Note: Chocolate, blackberry and black cherry aromas lead to a full-bodied palate, with velvety tannins and a deep concentration of fruit. Powerfully rich and polished. Big and structured. A blockbuster Sangiovese. Best after 2012. 3,300 cases made.

Name: Syrah Russian River Valley Papa's Block
Note: This gorgeous Syrah has amazing complexity, depth and concentration, gushing with pure, rich wild berry, blackberry and boysenberry fruit that's simply delicious right now. Holds its tight focus and gains depth and nuance, with pepper, spice and savory flavors. Drink now through 2016. 307 cases made.

Name: Syrah Sonoma Valley Steel Plow
Note: Shows loads of pepper, beef, dark berry, teriyaki, mineral and spice. Intense, distinctive, full-bodied and focused, this is so complex and well-proportioned that all the flavors work together seamlessly. Drink now through 2015. 1,600 cases made.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Kathryn Hall
Note: A big, dense, concentrated wine, with wonderful aromas marked by chewy tannins, yet the core currant and blackberry flavors and savory herb and earth nuances provide a solid foundation. Best from 2010 through 2016. 3,040 cases made.

Name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Colson Canyon Vineyard
Note: Firm and musclebound, with rich, chewy tannins. Full-bodied, this is the most complex and potent of the 2007 Tensleys, offering layers of earthy wild berry, sage, mineral, dried currant and floral scents. Drink now through 2016. 1,259 cases made.

Name: Shiraz South Australia St. Henri
Note: Aromatic, complex and silky, slipping in its gorgeous blackberry, currant and plum fruit against a seething background of toast, spice, mineral and loamy earth. The texture is seamless, and the flavors just take off, sailing through the long, expressive finish. Best from 2011 through 2020. 1,000 cases imported.

Name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Reserve
Note: Wonderful perfumed aromas fold over to the palate, which is full-bodied and ultrarich without being heavy, delivering tiers of ripe fig, apricot and green apple, shaded by spicy, toasty oak. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2012. 2,448 cases made.

Name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Cailloux Vineyard
Note: Plush and polished, this brims with cherry and blackberry aromas and flavors that are nicely shaded with streaks of mineral and green olive. Supple, harmonious and expressive as the finish keeps sailing on and on. Best from 2011 through 2018. 744 cases made.

Name: Toscana Giorgio Primo
Note: Dark and brooding, with intense aromas of lead pencil, blackberry, black cherry and licorice. Full-bodied, with velvety, polished tannins, followed by vanilla, berry and currant on the finish. Powerful and complex. Built like a brick house. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Best after 2013. 1,750 cases made.

Name: Toscana Crognolo
Note: Beautiful aromas of dried cherry, plum and blackberry, with hints of dark chocolate. Full-bodied, with soft, silky tannins and a fruity finish. Balanced and delicious. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2011. 7,500 cases made.

Name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Collection Charles Giraud
Note: Dark roasted Kenya AA coffee, braised fig, charred mesquite, mulled currant and blackberry fruit all work together in this huge and muscular but seamless and velvety offering. Graphite, brown bread, mineral and espresso notes weave through the finish, which has loads of pepper- and loam-tinged grip in reserve. Grenache and Mourvèdre. Best from 2011 through 2030. 665 cases made.

Name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Cuvée de Trois
Note: Offers great balance and purity of flavor, depth and complexity built around spicy wild berry, black cherry, mineral, anise and spice. Full-bodied, fresh and lively. The finish sails on. Drink now through 2013. 1,900 cases made.

Name: Syrah Red Mountain Ceidleigh
Note: Smooth, round and generous, this positively glows with gorgeous plum, blackberry and floral spice aromas and flavors, echoing on the long, expressive finish. This just doesn't quit. Drink now through 2014. 1,200 cases made.
